line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anything that helps to\nunite all and develop fairness, love , grace and universal brotherhood, is\nDharma.&nbsp; Anything that creates discord,\nsplit and disharmony and foments hatred, is Adharma.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dharma is the cementer and\nsustainer of social life.&nbsp; The rules of\nDharma have been laid down for regulating the worldly affairs of men.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Self-realisation is the\nhighest Dharma.&nbsp;&nbsp; Dharma is the heart of\nHindu ethics. Creator God is the centre of Dharma. No Hindu can ever claim to\nbe an atheist.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Atheist Charavaka school\nwas created and backdated by the white invader.&nbsp;&nbsp; IT is NOT congruent with Sanatana Dharma and\nhence is rejected .&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Can you believe\nthis\u2014Amish Tripathi who threw shit on Lord Shiva called himself a Charvaka\nschool man?&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The moment any man\ncomes in the TIME top 100 or gets a Nobel Prize for peace/ literature or a\nMagsaysay award, the first thing we can think of today is <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHAT IS THE CATCH \u2013\nWHAT DID HE DO TO SCREW THE WATAN.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dharma has its root in\nmorality and the controller of Dharma is God Himself-this is why an atheist\ncannot be a Hindu.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rishi Kanada, founder\nof the Vaiseshika system of philosophy wrote in Vaiseshika Sutras:&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cYato-bhyudayanihsreyasa-siddhih sa dharmah.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThat which leads to\nthe attainment of Abhyudaya (prosperity in this world) and Nihsreyasa (total\ncessation of pain and attainment of eternal bliss hereafter) is Dharma.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The Dharma of this century is different from\nthat of the tenth century.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What is Dharma in one\nset of circumstances becomes Adharma in another set of circumstances. That is\nthe reason why it is said that the secret of Dharma is extremely profound and\nsubtle. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Krishna says in\nthe Gita:&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cLet the scriptures be the authority in determining what ought to be\ndone and what ought not to be done\u201d (Ch. XVI, 24). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The truth of Dharma is subtle lies hidden. &nbsp;A judge in a court cannot deliver dharma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dharma alone is the\ngateway to Moksha.&nbsp; Dharma is the first\nand foremost Purushartha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every western\nphilosopher has lifted from Sanatana Dharma. Whatever they wrote on their own\nsteam is nonsense. I can say this because I have read all of it . . just wasted\nmy time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is absolutely NO\ndiscriminatory caste system in revealed Hindu scriptures. Vedic and non-Vedic\nscripture advance the concept equality of all mankind <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hinduism allows\nabsolute freedom to the rational mind of man. Hinduism never demands an undue\nrestraint upon the freedom of human reason, the freedom of thought, feeling and\nwill of man.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It allows the widest\nfreedom in matters of faith and worship. When foreigners come to Indiato learn\nYoga, they are told in the first introductory session , that Yoga does NOT require\nchange in faith or belief systems. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanatana Dharma allows\nabsolute freedom to the human reason and heart with regard to questions such as\nthe nature of God, soul, creation, form of worship, and goal of life. It does\nnot force or prevent anybody to reflect, investigate, enquire, and cogitate. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanatana Dharma exhorts\nman to use his own conscience .&nbsp; All\nsorts of religious faiths, various forms of worship or Sadhana, diverse kinds\nof rituals and customs, have found their honourable place side by side within\nHinduism, and are cultured and developed in harmonious relationship with one\nanother. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is NO blood\nsacrifice in Sanatana Dharma. What is sacrificed is GHEE . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hinduism does not\ndogmatically assert that the final emancipation is possible only through its\nmeans and not through any other. It is only a means to an end, and all means\nwhich will ultimately lead to the end are equally approved. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The religious\nhospitality of Hinduism is proverbial. Athithi DEvo Bhavah .&nbsp; Hinduism pays respects to all religions. It\ndoes not revile any other religion. It accepts and honours truth, wherever it\nmay come from and whatever garb it may put on.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\nThe truths of the Vedas are divine revelations.&nbsp; There can be NO sect of Hindusim which\naccepts Vedas and then says there is NO creator God.&nbsp; Rothschild screwed himself here.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\nAll the other religions of the world trace their authority\nto having been delivered by special Messengers of God or prophets, but the\nVedas do not owe their authority to any mortal messiah.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\nVedas by themselves the authority as they are eternal. The\nVedas are the oldest books in the library of man. They are the ultimate source\nto which all religious knowledge can be traced.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\nThe Upanishads are the concluding portions of the Vedas, or\nthe end of the Vedas. The teaching based on them is called Vedanta. <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\nHinduism provides spiritual food for all sorts of people to\nsuit their temperaments, capacities, tastes, stages of spiritual development,\nand conditions of life.&nbsp; This is the\ncharm, of Hinduism .</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\nHindu yoga and Vedanta teachers lay great stress on\nself-restraint, meditation, renunciation and practical Sadhana, which is best\nto control the mind and the senses and unfold the Divinity within or attain\nSelf-realisation.&nbsp; Yoga is eminently\npractical to practise.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\nIndologist and author Nancy Wilson Ross ( Mrs. Stanley Young\n) wrote:-<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n\"Anachronistic as this labyrinthine mythology may\nappear to the foreign mind, many of India\u2019s ancient theories about the universe\nare startlingly modern in scope and worthy of a people who are credited with\nthe invention of the zero, as well as algebra and its application of astronomy\nand geometry; a people who so carefully observed the heavens that, in the\nopinion of Monier-Williams, they determined the moon\u2019s synodical revolution\nmuch more correctly than the Greeks.\"<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n\"Many hundreds of years before those great European\npioneers, Galileo and Copernicus, had to pay heavy prices in ridicule and\nexcommunication for their daring theories, a section of the Vedas known as the\nBrahmanas contained this astounding statement: <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n\u201cThe sun never sets or rises. When people think the sun is\nsetting, he only changes about after reaching the end of the day and makes\nnight below and day to what is on the other side. Then, when people think he\nrises in the morning, he only shifts himself about after reaching the end of\nthe day night, and makes day below and night to what is on the other side. In\ntruth, he does not see at all.\u201d <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n\"The Indians, whose theory of time, is not linear like\nours \u2013 that is, not proceeding consecutively from past to present to future \u2013\nhave always been able to accept, seemingly without anxiety, the notion of an\nalternately expanding and contracting universe, an idea recently advanced by\ncertain Western scientists. In Hindu cosmology, immutable Brahman, at fixed\nintervals, draws back into his beginningless, endless Being the whole substance\nof the living world. There then takes place the long \u201csleep\u201d of Brahaman from\nwhich, in course of countless aeons, there is an awakening, and another\nuniverse or \u201cdream\u201d emerges. \"<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\nEdgar Quinet (1803 - 1875)&nbsp;\nthe French intellectual and historian wrote-<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n\u2018When human revolutions first began, India stood more\nexpressly than any other country for what may be called a Declaration of the\nRights of the Being. That divine Individuality, and its community with\ninfinity, is obviously the foundation and the source of all life and all\nhistory.\u2019<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n\u201cIndia made, more loudly than anyone, what we might call the\n\u201cdeclaration of the rights of the Being.\u201d There, in this divine self, in this\nsociety of the infinite with itself, lies clearly the foundation, the root of\nall life and all history.\u201d<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\nAlexander Zinoviev &nbsp;Russian author and sociologist who works in\nRussian Academy of Sciences wrote:<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n\" But I would like to believe Hinduism is too valuable\nfor humanity, and sacred Indian books contain too much precious and unique\nknowledge that it will not sink in oblivion. I\u2019d like to believe that the\nprinciples of Indian philosophy and religion are much more in agreement with\nthe needs for the future than any other religion in the world, in agreement\nwith the tendency, known in Western countries as New Age. It\u2019s my deep belief\nthat without India the world will sink in spiritual darkness and\nignorance.\" <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n\"So, what must be done in order to save Hinduism and\nstop the Islamic flood? There is only one way and it is called mass conversion\nof Muslims into Hinduism. If Hindus want to survive, they must convert. They\nmust adopt the strategy of Catholic missionaries and Muslim mullahs. I don\u2019t\nmean only conversion of one-time Hindus that only recently adopted other\nreligions. <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n\"Hinduism must convert also people of non-Hindu origin.\nThe fact that they live in India is enough because all Indians, notwithstanding\ntheir religious affiliation, had once had Hindu ancestors.\"<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\nBritish Ranchor Prime an author and expert on Vedanta wrote:<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n\u201cThe West has much to learn from the wisdom traditions of\nIndia. Having exposed most of the rest of the world to our own traditions, and\nhaving largely abandoned them ourselves, we now need to learn from others; to\nput aside our swords and guns, our computers and microscopes, our cars and\ntelevisions, and have the courage and the vision to journey to new territory\nwhere these seemingly indispensable aids may be of little value. <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\nReincarnation is a good example of a teaching which has been\nlargely ignored by Western civilization, despite the fact that it has existed\nin one form or another in the unofficial religions of Europe. It is important\nbecause it stresses the equality of all life forms and their transience too. It\ndoes not support the human-centred culture of the West which permits human\nsociety to terrorize the animal kingdom and dominate the cycles of nature for\nits own convenience. Nor does it support the empire-building mania of the\nEuropean societies who wanted to possess as much of the world as they could,\nbelieving that they only had one life in which to do it all. It is these\nattitudes that have encouraged us in our present path of industrial and\ntechnological war upon nature and the world.\"<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\nReincarnation and other knowledge of the spirit is taught by\nthe Vedas, the sacred books of the Hindus. They contain the collected wisdom of\nthe Vedic culture, the world\u2019s oldest living civilization, which in modern\ntimes has come to be known as Hinduism.\"&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">induism is a holistic\nreligion. It is a way of life rather than a religion or a set of beliefs. It\nincludes every aspect of life , every aspect of the cosmos</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">- everything is part of Sanatan Dharma.\n'Religion' is a Western word, and so is 'Hindu'.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">A correct description is 'Sanatan Dharma'.\nSanatan means eternal, and dharma means the true state.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Isa Upanishad says\nit all. Nature is sacred, all life is sacred, the whole earth is sacred.&nbsp; Western life has become desacrilised. The\nonly sanctity left is white human life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Edward J Urwick the\nauthor of The Message of Plato wrote-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cI will not\nattempt&nbsp; - it will need a separate volume\n\u2013 to show how the Indian thought may have filtered through Socrates and Plato;\nhow far it may have reached Plato in his wanderings, how far through\nPythagoras, how far even before the death of Socrates, a direct stream of the\nEastern doctrine may have flowed through Asia Minor into Greece. But I affirm\nvery confidently that if any one will make himself familiar with the old Indian\nWisdom \u2013 Religion of the Vedas and the Upanishads, will shake himself free, for\nthe moment, from the academic attitude and the limiting western conception of\nphilosophy, and will then read Plato\u2019s dialogues, he will hardly fail to\nrealize that both are occupied with the self-same search, inspired by the same\nfaith, drawn upwards by the same vision.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cAgain, just as Manu of\nancient India instituted the caste system upon the basis of the three\nprinciples in the individual soul, so Plato divides his state into three\nclassics, representing the three psychical elements. The lowest caste of\nproducers and traders, corresponding to the vaishya caste, reflects the element\nof ignorant desire, Epithumia. The class next above this, the Auxiliaries,\ncorresponding to the Kshatriya caste, reflects, the passionate element, Thumos.\nThe highest class, the Guardians, corresponding to the Brahmin caste,\nrepresents the principle of prudent reason, the Logistikon.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">British author Rupert\nSheldrake wrote-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"I suddenly saw\nthis astonishing culture which I found completely fascinating, which had riches\nand depths beyond anything I had ever been taught about in England.\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"I was impressed\nby the way that Hindus relate to the land of India and the holy places, and was\nmoved by the great variety of pilgrimages and holy animals and plants and\nfestivals. There are so many aspects of Hinduism that link it to the land and\nto the natural world in India. It is also closely linked to the culture and\nlanguages of India. I realized that as an English person I could never fully\nenter into those aspects of Hinduism.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cAccording to the Hindu\nscriptures, each half cycle is said to last for 4.32 billion years. The Sun,\ntoo, revolves around the center of our galaxy once in 325.5 million years.\nModern science pegs this in the range of 225 to 270 million years. The point of\ndeparture between ancient Hindu cosmology and modern cosmology is that unlike\nmodern cosmology, ancient Hindu cosmology relates the rotational speed of our\nown galaxy to the period of oscillation of the endless cycles of creation,\ngrowth and eventual decay. Our known galaxy is known as Parameshti Mandala, and\nit is said to rotate around Svayambhu Mandala, the center of all galaxies with\na time period of 4.32 billion years . Pursuing this chronology further in\ndetail, it can be shown that the present day of Brahma began exactly 5 Brahma hours,\n28 minutes and 40 seconds ago as of April 1, 1986. Going a step further, they\ncalculate the age of our present universe is 19.252 billion years, amazingly close\nto the modern-day estimate\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6819759480806937504\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_223M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14266175566453047238\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">wolf pack</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/06/methane-time-bomb-arctic-ice-meltdown.html?showComment=1466408102693#c6819759480806937504\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">June 20, 2016 at 1:05 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_223MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nHello Captain,<br />\nThis blogsite should make an amendment in smriti in the subject of organ donation. Whether a soul can rest in peace or not if the organ is donated.<br />\n<br />\nAnother query Captain,<br />\nThe 'saint' thiruvalluvar and thirukkural is heavily sponsored by karunanidhi by writing it in government buses, installing statue in kanyakumari,etc. The kanyakumari christians opposed vivekananda memorial on a nearby rock and claimed that St.Xavier was praying for world peace(sic) on it, but they didn't oppose thiruvalluvar statue.<br />\nSome christians go beyond and tell that thiruvalluvar was influenced by St.Thomas and converted to write thirukural.<br />\nNow BJP MP Tharun vijay want thiruvalluvar statue in ganga river bank.<br />\nAlso in idukki,kerala some people follow 'thiruvalluvar religion' and worship thiruvalluvar statues and thirukural as mantra.<br />\nYou should also dump this thiruvalluvar and the people who cooked him up into garbage bin like other dasa characters.<br />\n<br />\nNOTE: In my school days, one of my teachers told that the image of thiruvalluvar is drawn recently and is not him. The name 'thiruvalluvar and thirukural' is also cooked up.<br />\n<br />\nNOTE 2: I also see similarity in the life of ilangoadigal and ayyapa. font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_223b+seedDkD\" kind=\"d\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_229T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_223b+seedDkD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_229TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; font-size: 12pt;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_229TN\"></span></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"thread-dropContainer thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_229TD\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_223b+seedDkD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_229TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; font-size: 12pt;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_229TN\"><span class=\"thread-drop\"></span></span></span></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_223b+seedDkD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_229TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; font-size: 12pt;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_229TN\">\n</span></span><br />\n</span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_229TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\" unselectable=\"on\"><div style=\"zoom: 1;\" unselectable=\"on\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_223b+seedDkD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_229B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_223b+seedDkD\" kind=\"d\">\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5832310272451225446\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_229M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/06/methane-time-bomb-arctic-ice-meltdown.html?showComment=1466418511052#c5832310272451225446\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">June 20, 2016 at 3:58 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_229MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi ,<br />\n<br />\nThirukkural is made of two words; \u201cThiru\u201d means \u201choly\u201d and \u201cKural\u201d means \u201cshort verse.\u201d<br />\n<br />\nAll the Kurals (verses) have only 7 words , with total 1330 verses.<br />\nThiruKurals fit within 140 characters.<br />\nThe Thirukkural is arranged in 133 Adhikarams (chapters of themes) each with 10 couplets.<br />\n<br />\n40 couplets on God, Rain, Virtue and Ascetics.<br />\n200 couplets on Domestic Virtue.<br />\n140 couplets on Higher Virtue based on Grace.<br />\n250 couplets on Royalty.<br />\n100couplets on Ministers of State.<br />\n220 couplets on the Essential requirements of Administration. In fact these are very good lessons on management.<br />\n130 couples on Morality, both positive and negative.<br />\n250 couplets on human love, sex and fervor.<br />\n<br />\nMahatma Gandhi learnt the concept of non-violence from a letter written to him by famous Russian novelist Leo Tolstoy , who quoted couplets on non-violence from German translation of Thirukkural.<br />\n<br />\nOn 16th Jan 2015, Prime Minister Narendra Modi released a Gujarati translation of Thirukkural.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1260 - Ninandheeyil Ittanna Nenjinaarkku Unto Punarndhooti Nirpem Enal<br />\n'We 'll stand aloof and then embrace': is this for them to say,<br />\nWhose hearts are as the fat that in the blaze dissolves away<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1261 - Vaalatrup Purkendra Kannum Avarsendra Naalotrith Theyndha Viral<br />\nMy eyes have lost their brightness, sight is dimmed; my fingers worn,<br />\nWith nothing on the wall the days since I was left forlorn<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1262 - Ilangizhaai Indru Marappinen Tholmel Kalangazhiyum Kaarikai Neeththu<br />\nO thou with gleaming jewels decked, could I forget for this one day,<br />\nHenceforth these bracelets from my arms will slip, my beauty worn away<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1264 - Kootiya Kaamam Pirindhaar Varavullik Kotuko Terumen Nenju<br />\n'He comes again, who left my side, and I shall taste love's joy,'-<br />\nMy heart with rapture swells, when thoughts like these my mind employ<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1265 - Kaankaman Konkanaik Kannaarak Kantapin Neengumen Mendhol Pasappu<br />\nO let me see my spouse again and sate these longing eyes!<br />\nThat instant from my wasted frame all pallor flies<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1266 - Varukaman Konkan Orunaal Parukuvan Paidhalnoi Ellaam Keta<br />\nO let my spouse but come again to me one day!<br />\nI'll drink that nectar: wasting grief shall flee away<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1267 - Pulappenkol Pulluven Kollo Kalappenkol Kananna Kelir Viran<br />\nShall I draw back, or yield myself, or shall both mingled be,<br />\nWhen he returns, my spouse, dear as these eyes to me<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1268-- Vinaikalandhu Vendreeka Vendhan Manaikalandhu Maalai Ayarkam Virundhu<br />\nO would my king would fight, o'ercome, devide the spoil;<br />\nAt home, to-night, the banquet spread should crown the toil<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1269 -- Orunaal Ezhunaalpol Sellumsen Sendraar Varunaalvaiththu Engu Pavarkku<br />\nOne day will seem like seven to those who watch and yearn<br />\nFor that glad day when wanderers from afar return<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1270 - Perinennaam Petrakkaal Ennaam Urinennaam Ullam Utaindhukkak Kaal<br />\nWhat's my return, the meeting hour, the wished-for greeting worth,<br />\nIf she heart-broken lie, with all her life poured forth<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1271 - Karappinung Kaiyikan Thollaanin Unkan Uraikkal Uruvadhon Runtu<br />\nThou hid'st it, yet thine eye, disdaining all restraint,<br />\nSomething, I know not, what, would utter of complaint<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1272 - Kanniraindha Kaarikaik Kaamperdhot Pedhaikkup Penniraindha Neermai Peridhu<br />\nThe simple one whose beauty fills mine eye, whose shoulders curve<br />\nLike bambu stem, hath all a woman's modest sweet reserve<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1273 - Maniyil Thikazhdharu Noolpol Matandhai Aniyil Thikazhvadhondru Untu<br />\nAs through the crystal beads is seen the thread on which they 're strung<br />\nSo in her beauty gleams some thought cannot find a tongue<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1274 - Mukaimokkul Ulladhu Naatrampol Pedhai Nakaimokkul Ulladhon Runtu<br />\nAs fragrance in the opening bud, some secret lies<br />\nConcealed in budding smile of this dear damsel's eyes<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1275 - Seridhoti Seydhirandha Kallam Urudhuyar Theerkkum Marundhondru Utaiththu<br />\nThe secret wiles of her with thronging armlets decked,<br />\nAre medicines by which my raising grief is checked<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_229MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_229BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_229B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</span></li>\n<span id=\"bc_0_223b+seedDkD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_230B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8270887385924265919\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_230M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/06/methane-time-bomb-arctic-ice-meltdown.html?showComment=1466418569024#c8270887385924265919\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">June 20, 2016 at 3:59 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_230MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1276 - Peridhaatrip Petpak Kalaththal Aridhaatri Anpinmai Soozhva Thutaiththu<br />\nWhile lovingly embracing me, his heart is only grieved:<br />\nIt makes me think that I again shall live of love bereaved<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1277 - Thannan Thuraivan Thanandhamai Namminum Munnam Unarndha Valai<br />\nMy severance from the lord of this cool shore,<br />\nMy very armlets told me long before<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1278 - Nerunatruch Chendraarem Kaadhalar Yaamum Ezhunaalem Meni Pasandhu<br />\nMy loved one left me, was it yesterday?<br />\nDays seven my pallid body wastes away<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1279 - Thotinokki Mendholum Nokki Atinokki Aqdhaan Tavalsey Thadhu<br />\nShe viewed her tender arms, she viewed the armlets from them slid;<br />\nShe viewed her feet: all this the lady did<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1280 - Penninaal Penmai Utaiththenpa Kanninaal Kaamanoi Solli Iravu<br />\nTo show by eye the pain of love, and for relief to pray,<br />\nIs womanhood's most womanly device, men say<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1281 - Ullak Kaliththalum Kaana Makizhdhalum Kallukkil Kaamaththir Kuntu<br />\nGladness at the thought, rejoicing at the sight,<br />\nNot palm-tree wine, but love, yields such delight<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1282 - Thinaiththunaiyum Ootaamai Ventum Panaith Thunaiyum Kaamam Niraiya Varin<br />\nWhen as palmyra tall, fulness of perfect love we gain,<br />\nDistrust can find no place small as the millet grain<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1283 - Penaadhu Petpave Seyyinum Konkanaik Kaanaa Thamaiyala Kan<br />\nAlthough his will his only law, he lightly value me,<br />\nMy heart knows no repose unless my lord I see<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1285 - Ezhudhungaal Kolkaanaak Kannepol Konkan Pazhikaanen Kanta Itaththu<br />\nThe eye sees not the rod that paints it; nor can I<br />\nSee any fault, when I behold my husband nigh<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1286 - Kaanungaal Kaanen Thavaraaya Kaanaakkaal Kaanen Thavaral Lavai<br />\nWhen him I see, to all his faults I 'm blind;<br />\nBut when I see him not, nothing but faults I find<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1287 - Uyththal Arindhu Punalpaai Pavarepol Poiththal Arindhen Pulandhu<br />\nAs those of rescue sure, who plunge into the stream,<br />\nSo did I anger feign, though it must falsehood seem<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1288 - Iliththakka Innaa Seyinum Kaliththaarkkuk Kallatre Kalvanin Maarpu<br />\nThough shameful ill it works, dear is the palm-tree wine<br />\nTo drunkards; traitor, so to me that breast of thine<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1289 - Malarinum Mellidhu Kaamam Silaradhan Sevvi Thalaippatu Vaar<br />\nLove is tender as an opening flower In season due<br />\nTo gain its perfect bliss is rapture known to few<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1290 - Kannin Thuniththe Kalanginaal Pulludhal Enninum Thaanvidhup Putru<br />\nHer eye, as I drew nigh one day, with anger shone:<br />\nBy love o'erpowered, her tenderness surpassed my own<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1291 -- Avarnenju Avarkkaadhal Kantum Evannenje Neeemakku Aakaa Thadhu<br />\nYou see his heart is his alone<br />\nO heart, why not be all my own<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1293 -- Kettaarkku Nattaaril Enpadho Nenjenee Pettaangu Avarpin Selal<br />\n'The ruined have no friends, 'they say; and so, my heart,<br />\nTo follow him, at thy desire, from me thou dost depart<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1295 - Peraaamai Anjum Perinpirivu Anjum Araaa Itumpaiththen Nenju<br />\nI fear I shall not gain, I fear to lose him when I gain;<br />\nAnd thus my heart endures unceasing pain<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1296 -- Thaniye Irundhu Ninaiththakkaal Ennaith Thiniya Irundhadhen Nenju<br />\nMy heart consumes me when I ponder lone,<br />\nAnd all my lover's cruelty bemoan<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1298 - Ellin Ilivaamendru Enni Avardhiram Ullum Uyirkkaadhal Nenju<br />\nIf I contemn him, then disgrace awaits me evermore;<br />\nMy soul that seeks to live his virtues numbers o'er<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1299 -- Thunpaththirku Yaare Thunaiyaavaar Thaamutaiya Nenjan Thunaiyal Vazhi<br />\nAnd who will aid me in my hour of grief,<br />\nIf my own heart comes not to my relief<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1300 -- Thanjam Thamarallar Edhilaar Thaamutaiya Nenjam Thamaral Vazhi<br />\nA trifle is unfriendliness by aliens shown,<br />\nWhen our own heart itself is not our own<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCouplet 1302 - Uppamain Thatraal Pulavi Adhusiridhu Mikkatraal Neela Vital<br />\nA cool reserve is like the salt that seasons well the mess,<br />\nToo long maintained, 'tis like the salt's excess<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_230MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_230BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_230B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_231B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-size: 12pt; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6914450691312001201\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_231M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 12pt; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/06/methane-time-bomb-arctic-ice-meltdown.html?showComment=1466418681806#c6914450691312001201\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">June 20, 2016 at 4:01 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_231MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">CONTINUED FROM 2-</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1311 - Penniyalaar Ellaarum Kannin Podhuunpar Nannen Paraththanin Maarpu</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">From thy regard all womankind Enjoys an equal grace;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">O thou of wandering fickle mind, I shrink from thine embrace</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1312 - Ooti Irundhemaath Thumminaar Yaamdhammai, Neetuvaazh Kenpaak Karindhu</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">One day we silent sulked; he sneezed: The reason well I knew;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">He thought that I, to speak well pleased, Would say, 'Long life to you!'</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1313 - Kottup Pooch Chootinum Kaayum Oruththiyaik Kaattiya Sootineer Endru</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">I wreathed with flowers one day my brow, The angry tempest lowers;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">She cries, 'Pray, for what woman now Do you put on your flowers?'</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1314 - Yaarinum Kaadhalam Endrenaa Ootinaal Yaarinum Yaarinum Endru</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">'I love you more than all beside,' 'T was thus I gently spoke;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">'What all, what all?' she instant cried; And all her anger woke</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1315 - Immaip Pirappil Piriyalam Endrenaak Kannirai Neerkon Tanal</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">'While here I live, I leave you not,' I said to calm her fears</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">She cried, 'There, then, I read your thought'; And straight dissolved in tears</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1316 -Ullinen Endrenmar Renmarandheer Endrennaip Pullaal Pulaththak Kanal</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">'Each day I called to mind your charms,' 'O, then, you had forgot,'</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">She cried, and then her opened arms, Forthwith embraced me not</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1317 -Vazhuththinaal Thumminen Aaka Azhiththazhudhaal Yaarullith Thummineer Endru</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">She hailed me when I sneezed one day; But straight with anger seized,</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">She cried; 'Who was the woman, pray, Thinking of whom you sneezed?'</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1318 -Thummuch Cheruppa Azhudhaal Numarullal Emmai Maraiththiro Endru</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">And so next time I checked my sneeze; She forthwith wept and cried,</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">(That woman difficult to please), 'Your thoughts from me you hide'</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1319 -Thannai Unarththinum Kaayum Pirarkkumneer Inneerar Aakudhir Endru</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">I then began to soothe and coax, To calm her jealous mind;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">'I see', quoth she, 'to other folks How you are wondrous kind</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1320 -Ninaiththirundhu Nokkinum Kaayum Anaiththuneer Yaarulli Nokkineer Endru</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">I silent sat, but thought the more, And gazed on her Then she</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Cried out, 'While thus you eye me o'er, Tell me whose form you see'</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1322 -Ootalin Thondrum Sirudhuni Nallali Vaatinum Paatu Perum</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">My 'anger feigned' gives but a little pain;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">And when affection droops, it makes it bloom again</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1323 -Pulaththalin Puththelnaatu Unto Nilaththotu Neeriyain Thannaar Akaththu</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Is there a bliss in any world more utterly divine,</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Than 'coyness' gives, when hearts as earth and water join</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1324 -Pulli Vitaaap Pulaviyul Thondrumen Ullam Utaikkum Patai</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">'Within the anger feigned' that close love's tie doth bind,</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">A weapon lurks, which quite breaks down my mind</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1325 -Thavarilar Aayinum Thaamveezhvaar Mendrol Akaralin Aangon Rutaiththu</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Though free from fault, from loved one's tender arms</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">To be estranged a while hath its own special charms</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1326 -Unalinum Untadhu Aralinidhu Kaamam Punardhalin Ootal Inidhu</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">'Tis sweeter to digest your food than 'tis to eat;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">In love, than union's self is anger feigned more sweet</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1327 - Ootalil Thotravar Vendraar Adhumannum Kootalir Kaanap Patum</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">In lovers' quarrels, 'tis the one that first gives way,&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">That in re-union's joy is seen to win the day</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1328 -Ootip Perukuvam Kollo Nudhalveyarppak Kootalil Thondriya Uppu</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">And shall we ever more the sweetness know of that embrace,&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">With dewy brow; to which 'feigned anger' lent its piquant grace</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1329 -Ootuka Manno Oliyizhai Yaamirappa Neetuka Manno Iraa</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Let her, whose jewels brightly shine, aversion feign,&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">That I may still plead on, O night, prolong thy reign</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">Couplet 1330- Ootudhal Kaamaththirku Inpam Adharkinpam Kooti Muyangap Perin</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">A 'feigned aversion' coy to pleasure gives a zest;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">The pleasure's crowned when breast is clasped to breast</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>I UNDERSTAND TAMIL!<br />AIYYYOOOOOOOOOOOOO</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span text-decoration: none;\">June 11, 2016 at 1:45 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_28MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi n,<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br />ALMOST ALL INDIAN NAVY OFFICERS BECOME SEA SICK AND PUKE THEIR GUTS OUT EVEN IN SLIGHT ROUGH WEATHER.&nbsp;</span></b><br />\nI KNOW BECAUSE AT SEA ALMOST ALL OUR ELECTRICAL OFFICERS ( USLESS -PATHETIC IN WORK ) ARE FROM THE INDIAN NAVY--AT LEAST 70 OF THEM HAVE SAILED WITH ME .<br />\n<br />\nAS A JUNIOR OFFICE IN SCI, I HAVE SAILED WITH SEVERAL COMMODORES, CAPTAINS, COMMANDERS AND LT COMMANDERS -- ALL MEN OF POOR CHARACTER AND COWARDS.<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">AS A YOUNG MAN I USED TO WONDER HOW OUR NATION IS BEING PROTECTED BY THESE MEN OF STRAW.&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<br />\nAND MIND YOU THEY MADE MAX NOISE FOR OROP. &nbsp; &nbsp;THE NAVAL OFFICERS WEAR WHITE UNIFORM AND STRUT AROUND LIKE PEACOCKS --AND SALUTE MAANGHTA HAI BHAIYYA .<br />\n<br />\nWANT AN EXAMPLE OF INDIAN NAVY COMPETENCE?<br />\n<br />\ncheck out my comment in the post below-- this is the PITS<br />\n<br />\nhttp://defenseblog-njs.blogspot.in/2012/09/ins-vikramaditya-trial-malfunctions-to.html<br />\n<br />\nTODAY MARINE ENGINEERS ALL AROUND THE PLANET PASS THEIR EXAMS USING MY SELF EXAMINER--THE QUESTIONS COME FROM THE POSTS BELOW<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/11/marine-engineering-self-examiner.html<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/10/marine-engineering-self-examiner-water.html<br />\n<br />\nI AM NOT AN ENGINEER- JUST A DECK BOY<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<br />\n<br />\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_51B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2444124719772112871\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_51M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; text-decoration: none;\">June 12, 2016 at 2:44 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_51MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nSir<br />\nThe same Indian navy bombarded Pakistan port during indo pak war .I think sweeping comment because of few selective experiences is not expected from a person of your stature</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_51MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1489067796\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_51BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_51B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_52B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; border-bottom-width: 0px; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3634922564424090941\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_52M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/06/enclosed-spaced-entry-checklist-on.html?showComment=1465679822651#c3634922564424090941\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">June 12, 2016 at 2:47 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_52MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nI KNOW PEOPLE WHO WERE PRESENT ON ON THE NAVIGATING BRIDGE OF THOSE NAVAL SHIPS.<br />\n<br />\nINTERVIEWED DOZENS OF THEM . .<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">THERE WAS NO RESISTANCE FROM PAKISTAN&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">WHOEVER PRESSED THE BUTTON , GOT PROMOTIONS AND MEDALS</span></b><br />\n<br />\nI KNOW THE INSIDE STORY OF INDIAN NAVY</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AT SEA, I DISCARDED THE\nOFFICIAL COMPANY SAFETY CHECKLIST AND USED MY OWN.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THEY THREATENED TO SACK\nME \u2013 &nbsp;SAYING SAFETY FORMS COME UNDER \u201cSAFETY MANAGEMENT SYSTEM\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I REPLIED \u2013 &nbsp;\u201c TRY SACKING ME \u2013 I AM DOING SO FOR SAFETY OF\nLIFE AND SHIP . I HAVE THE POWERS TO DO IT \u201c<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div align=\"center\" class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">ENTERING\nENCLOSED SPACES</span></b><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div align=\"center\" class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lack of oxygen should\nbe suspected in all enclosed spaces.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Entry into an enclosed\nspace or cargo tank with a known unsafe atmosphere with SCBA sets can be made\nonly by the master after a risk assessement.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This can be done only under\nexceptional circumstances, when no practicable and safe alternative exists. A\nwritten statement must be prepared by master declaring that there is no\npractical alternative to the proposed method of entry, and that such entry is\nessential to the SAFE operation fo the ship.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The SCBA sets must be operated in\nthe positive pressure mode, and ventilation must be provided where possible.\nSpare sets of SCBA must be available for rescue of the SCBA wearers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When crew enters tanks\nto do squeegee of veg oil ,&nbsp; continuous\nventilation must be provided and atmosphereic checks of tank made as per ships\nSMS. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A space is SAFE FOR MEN\nwhen:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>--the oxygen content of\nthe atmosphere is not less than 20%,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>--the concentration of\nflammable gas is less than 1% LFL,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>--any toxic materials\nin the atmosphere associated with cargo, fuel, tank coatings or inert gas do\nnot exceed permissible concentrations&nbsp;\nany residues will not produce toxic vapours under prevailing conditions.</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tanks, holds, void\nspaces, double bottoms, duct-keels, pump rooms, cofferdams, chain lockers, CO2\nrooms, sewage tanks, pressure vessels, battery lockers, inter barrier spaces,\nIG scrubbers, bow thruster room etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Entering any confined\nspace is hazardous and can result in rapid death from harmful gases and or lack\nof oxygen.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NEVER ASSUME A TANK OR ENCLOSED SPACE IS SAFE.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is the Master's responsibility to identify\nhazardous spaces and to establish procedures for safe entry.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Any tank, cargo hold or\nspace which has contained a liquid or which has been sealed must be assumed to\nhave a dangerous atmosphere and consequently be unsafe for entry without the\nprotection of breathing apparatus.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unprotected entry should not be attempted\nuntil a competent person has made an assessment and taken the appropriate measures\nto ensure the space is safe for man-entry.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Any open tank which has\nNOT been \"gas freed\" should be secured against entry and a NO ENTRY\nnotice hung on the hatch opening.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Master or Chief\nMate MUST ensure that it is safe to enter an enclosed space by:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>1 Identifying potential\nhazards<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>2 Ensuring the space is\nprepared for entry and has been thoroughly ventilated by natural or mechanical\nmeans.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>3 Testing the\natmosphere of the space at different levels for oxygen deficiency and harmful\nvapour (where suitable instruments are available).<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>4 Ensure procedures are\ninstituted before and after entry. If any doubt as to adequacy of ventilation\nor testing ensure breathing apparatus is worn by all persons entering the space\n<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If, as possible on a\ncargo vessel, there is no suitable equipment to test the atmosphere within a\ntank/hold, it is absolutely essential that the respective tank/hold is\nadequately ventilated prior to entry and continuously thereafter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The MSDS sheets should\nbe consulted for further guidance when planning entry to holds or tanks\ncontaining cargo or residues of cargo.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In all cases and prior\nto entry, the enclosed space check list must be completed (see below).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whenever\nentry is first made into a recently opened tank/hold, there should be a\nqualified man positioned on deck tending the required lifeline and monitoring\nthe situation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SAFETY CHECK LIST<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">before entry into the\nenclosed space the appropriate safety checks listed below must be carried out\nby the Master or the Chief Mate AND by the person who is to enter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">XXXXX&nbsp;&nbsp; XXXX<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">CHEMICAL\nTANKER ENCLOSED SPACE ENTRY PERMIT</span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ship:&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Date:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\nTime:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Identity of Enclosed\nSpace:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
