font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<i><span lang=\"EN-GB\" style=\"color: #215868; font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\">Note: <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<i><span lang=\"EN-GB\" style=\"color: #215868; font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\">Master must not hesitate to seek radio medical\nassistance for chemical poisoning and injury cases. If proper treatment is\ngiven in good time recovery will be faster. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<i><span lang=\"EN-GB\" style=\"color: #215868; font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\">Never give Morphine to a person who has been\ngassed&nbsp; especially by irritant gases..\nFor all poisoning you can give a glass of milk. Milk should NOT be given for\ndegreasing solvents and Chlorinated Hydrocarbon poisoning. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<i><span lang=\"EN-GB\" style=\"color: #215868; font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\">Carbon Monoxide poisoning makes the lips\nbright red and the face pink. Toxic and noxious gases have distinctive odours\nexcept Carbon Monoxide. CO causes chemical asphyxiation by restricting O2 in\nblood. TLV/ 25ppm<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<i><span lang=\"EN-GB\" style=\"color: #215868; font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\">Pulmonary odema: &nbsp;Fluid collects in lungs and you have\ndifficulty in breathing or lying flat. Caused by inhalation of certain gases or\nby vomited matter going into lungs. It can be delayed by as much as 2\ndays.&nbsp; Use a Guedel airway which can vacuum\nout froth from the airway. If the patient is conscious he must be kept in a\nsitting up position and if unconscious kept in the three prone position. The\nmedicine used is Furosemide. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<i><span lang=\"EN-GB\" style=\"color: #215868; font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\">Anaphylaxis is allergy and swelling of tissue\nwhich can be fatal.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<i><span lang=\"EN-GB\" style=\"color: #215868; font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\">TDI and Nitriles enters blood and paralyses\nthe nervous system and causes death. -</span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<i><span lang=\"EN-GB\" style=\"color: #215868; font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\"><br /></span></i>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>H2S gas has odour\nthreshold Metallic taste in mouth, head ache , vomiting , diarrhoea, paralysis\n, difficult breathing</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<i><span lang=\"EN-GB\" style=\"color: #215868; font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"text-align: justify;\">\n<i><span lang=\"EN-GB\" style=\"color: #215868; font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; mso-bidi-font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;\">CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<span style=\"color: #215868;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></i></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b> VENTILATION</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tank cleaning and gas\nfreeing are the most hazardous aspects of chemical tanker operations. The risk\nis greater if the vapours are toxic.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">First the tank has to\nbe washed clean of residues.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The tank domes and\nbutterworth covers should be kept closed until the ventilation of the&nbsp; tank is about to commence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Portable fans or\nblowers should be so constructed that no hazard of incendiary sparking arises\nif, for example, the impeller touches the inside of the casing. Dasic \u201cJet-Fan\u201d\nimpellers are specially coated to prevent static between impeller/casing. The\ncapacity and penetration of portable fans should be such that the entire\natmosphere of the tank can be made gas free quickly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Venting of toxic and\nflammable gas during gas freeing should be through the vessel's approved gas\nfreeing outlets.&nbsp; No escape of cargo\nvapours should be allowed in the proximity of accommodation spaces and the\nvelocity of venting should be sufficient to carry the vapours clear of the\ndeck.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the ship does not\nhave fixed blower/de-humidifier, then portable fan must be used on a tank\ncleaning hatch venting through VCS pipework and p/v valve.&nbsp; If&nbsp; gas\nfreeing is done through cargo pipelines , then the entire line system should be\nthoroughly drained before venting.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the gas level within\nthe tank has fallen below 30% LFL and below the relevant TLV, other deck\nopenings of the tank in question may be opened and THEN ONLY discharge of the\nvapour mixture may continue at tank level.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Intakes of central air\nconditioning or mechanical ventilating systems should be adjusted to prevent\nvacuum inside the accommodation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ventilation outlets\nshould generally be as remote as possible from the portable fans.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Portable fans should\nmake an effective electrical bond to the deck.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fixed gas freeing\nequipment may be used to gas free more than one tank simultaneously but must\nnot be used for this purpose if the system is being used to ventilate another\ntank in which washing is in progress.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a tank appears to\nhave been completely gas freed, a period of about 30 minutes should elapse\nbefore taking final gas measurements .&nbsp;\nThis allows relatively stable conditions to develop within the tank\nspace.&nbsp; Tests should be made at several\nlevels with the fan OFF at levels depending on the VD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gas vent riser drains\nshould be cleared of water, rust and sediment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After ventilation is\ncompleted, testing of the atmosphere should be carried out to determine its\nflammability, as a percentage of LFL, and its toxicity relative to the\nTLV.&nbsp; Samples should be drawn from the\ninside of the ventilation pipe at its exit point.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before venting ventable\ncargoes reduce trim and list to increase the surface area<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Air contains a certain\namount of moisture (vapor of water) depending on its temperature and surroundings.\nIf the air contains the maximum amount of moisture allowed at the<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">temperature, the\nrelative humidity is 100%. If the air contains no moisture, the relative<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">humidity is 0%. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Higher the temperature,\nmore the air can contain moisture, which means if air containing a certain\namount of moisture is cooled down, the relative humidity will increase.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If air\ncontacts a cold surface and gets cooled down below the temperature of 100% of\nrelative humidity (so called \"Dew Point\") the amount of moisture\ncontained in the air in excess of 100% relative humidity will condensed and\nbecome dew (sweat).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is the reason why\ndew is generated on a cold surface within a cargo tank containing air of higher\nrelative humidity. The cold surface can be a bulkhead between adjacent cargo\ntanks containing cold temperature of cargo, a shell plate of which the other\nside is immersed in the sea, etc.,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MEASURES IN CASE OF\nOCCURRENCE OF SWEAT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sweat in an empty\ncargo tank can be generated when a cargo of lower temperature than atmospheric\ntemperature is loaded in an adjacent tank, or a cargo loaded at a cold area is\ncarried to a warm tropical area.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the latter case, if\nthe destination is far from loading port and will take long time more than 4\ndays, the problem of sweat in surrounding cargo tank will not happen because\nthe temperature will be increased naturally. However in case of short voyage,\nit is not enough to increase the temperature naturally.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If sweating is expected\nto happen or has actually happened in the adjacent empty tanks, the followings\nare the possible measures to prevent or cope with:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The best way is to\nsupply dry air into the empty tank, however this is not practicable because\nsuch system to supply dry air is not equipped on board.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If sea temperature is\nhigher than cargo temperature, to ballast into concerned ballast tank in order\nto increase the temperature of cargo tank in the adjacent cargo tank.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the cargo is not a\npolymerize cargo such as SM or MMA in surrounding tank, and not reactive at\nhigher temperature, to steam into empty cargo tank to be loaded (the tank which\nis sweating). It is most effective method to increase indirectly the\ntemperature of cargo within the shortest period (4 or 5 hours).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the cargo is a\npolymerize cargo or reactive cargo for high temperature, Steaming into cargo\ntank should be avoided. Vessel can increase indirectly the cargo temperature by\nventilation of surrounding empty cargo tanks with warm temperature, which\nheated by heating coil. The temperature of empty cargo tank should not exceed\n35C.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the above\nventilation method, sweating in empty cargo tank is inevitable. After raising\ntemperature of cargo to the necessary degree, Heating of empty cargo tank\nshould be stopped and normal ventilation to be carried out after mopping up the\nsweat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prior to arrival\nloading port, the condition of the concerned empty tanks is to be checked to\navoid any last minute surprises.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PREVENTION OF\nOCCURRENCE OF SWEAT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If vessel loads cargo\nin a tropical area at atmospheric temperature and carries it to a cold area. In\nthis case, the sweat will not be generated in empty cargo tanks surrounding the\nloaded cargo tank.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However some cargoes such as SM (styrene monomer) or MMA\n(methyl methacrylate), which react at high temperature, are loaded to cold\ntemperature lower than atmospheric temperature at Tropical area.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In case of\nparcel cargo, if vessel loads such cargo first, the sweat in cargo tanks which\nsurrounded by such cargo tank will be generated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vessel should load\ncargoes of normal temperature first and then load cold temperature cargo last.\nIt could be discussed with agent/charterer in advance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For avoiding generation\nof sweat in empty cargo tank, it is necessary to find dew point. The sweat is\ngenerated when temperature in certain area is lower than dew point. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Therefore, if dew point\nof atmosphere is lower than that of empty cargo tank, ventilation into cargo\ntank is very effective, however dew point of atmosphere temperature is higher\nthan that of empty cargo tank, ventilation should be stopped.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A tank which is having\n100% relative humidity at 30c will have zero RH at -40 C dew point<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dew point= wet bulb\nreading on X axid/ diff between dry and wet on Y axis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ship sweat happens when\nship travels from warm to cold place when tank temp is greater than dew point\nof outside air\u2014ventilate and get rid of the sweat.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wait for temperature of air\nto be &gt; 3 deg cooler than air inside. When tank temp is less than dew point\nof outside air\u2014do not ventilate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Warmer air can hold a\nlot more water than cooler air.&nbsp; The rule\nof thumb is that raising the air temperature 10\u00b0C doubles its moisture\ncapacity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If we cool air without changing its moisture content, eventually\nwe'll reach a temperature at which the air can no longer hold the moisture it\ncontains. Then water will have to condense out of the air, forming dew or fog.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The dewpoint is this critical temperature at which condensation occurs\nOrdinarily the dewpoint doesn't vary much during a 24-hour period. Unlike\ntemperature and unlike relative humidity, the dewpoint is usually the same at\nnight as it is the daytime.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A high relative humidity indicates that the dew\npoint is closer to the current air temperature. If the relative humidity is\n100%, the dew point will be equal to the current temperature&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The dewpoint\ntemperature depends on the air temperature, since hotter air can hold more\nwater vapor per unit volume than can colder air. The higher the dewpoint\ntemperature, the higher the moisture content of the air. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dew point is a better\nabsolute measure of the air's moisture content.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here's a good example of why:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Proforma: Temp/ DP/ RH<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">90/ 80/ 67%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">100/ 80/ 47%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">110/ 80/ 33%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RH=actual vapor\ndensity/ saturation VD x 100%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While relative humidity\nis a relative measure of how humid it is, the dewpoint temperature is an\nabsolute measure of how much water vapor is in the air (how humid it is). In\nvery warm, humid conditions, the dewpoint temperature can reach 75 to 77\ndegrees F, but rarely exceeds 80 degrees. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dew-point does not\nchange with temperature of the air; very much different from relative humidity.\nIt is a measure of atmospheric moisture. It is the temperature to which air\nmust be cooled in order to reach saturation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The closer the\ntemperature and the dew point, the more humid the air is. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Accommodation entrances\nand air inlets to ER should not face cargo area.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gas freeing fan 9000\nm3/ hr which gives the purge pipes of 10 cm dia&nbsp;\nan exit velocity of&gt;30 Mtrs/ sec.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cargoes such a styrene\nmonomer and methyl methacrylate are loaded cold. So if MEG and styrene have to\nbe loaded in adjacent compartments\u2014load MEG first and styrene last.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Almost all chemical\nvapours are heavier than air and so remain at the bottom of tank.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Start gas freeing only\nafter removing water from the bottom suction pit, or it takes too long.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Displacement method</b> (\n1.5 air changes reqd )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">entry velocity must be\nlow to prevent short circuit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">entry from top via\nbutterworth port using portable inlet blower. at 114 cum per minute<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">exit from bottom\nentering via drop line mouth&nbsp; and eject\nvia manifold..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Dilution method</b> ( 4\nairchanges with high entry velocity )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Method 1:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">entry from top\nbutterworth port<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">exit from top\nbutterworth port.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Method 2 :<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">entry from bottom pump\nstack. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">outlet from top\nbutterworth port.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">this will remove&nbsp; few litres water or volatile cargo from\nsuction pit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">use&nbsp; blower fixed at manifold to put in air at 200\ncum&nbsp; \u201cper minute..\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All modern chemical\ntanker pumprooms must have 45 airchanges \u201cper hour\u201d&nbsp; as perCDI regulations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Do not do too much of\nventilation on a wall wash&nbsp; earmarked\ntank to prevent salt in sea wind / dust / oil getting in.&nbsp; The compressed air exhaust of the portable\nvent must be blown/ led&nbsp; away (using a\nshort pipe)&nbsp; from the fan blades to\nprevent compressor carry over oil from getting into tank.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Products with low vapor\npressure, or products which leave residues or contain inhibitors should never\nbe cleaned by evaporation (ventilation). The non-volatile matter (NVM) content\nin the specification of the product is a good indication to determine, whether\na product will leave residues<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gas freeing is most\neffective if 2 blowers are used in a single tank\u2014with one on supply and the\nother on exhaust with a long duct leading to the bottom.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ethanol which is not\nstatic can be removed by bubbling through the sump. Epoxy Paint resistance\nlists and Tank coating manufacturers give clear instructions on long term\nventilation before water is introduced into the tank. Usually a&nbsp; water wash is not necessary after a prolonged\nventilation period unless there is NVM at the bottom or verticals/ sloping\nsurfaces.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Venting after\naggressive cargoes:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Epoxy absorbs solvents\n. The&nbsp; problems are\u2014damage to coating and\ncontamination of next cargo. The cargo must be desorbed by ventilation.The\nrelease is faster if the steel temp is high&nbsp;\nThis steel temperature&nbsp; increase\nmust be from the adjacent compartment.. The ventilation for desorbsion must be\ndevoid of moisture\u2014the moisture takes the place of vapours which the air should\nhave accepted and carried away. The ventilation must go to bottom of tank and\nexit from top from the other end,with the steam coils cracked open.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Don\u2019t bubble through\nsump if the cargo is a static accumulator. Do not butterworth or even steam the\ntank without ventilation if the cargo is water mixable or water reactive.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A check is\nmandatory\u2014will the next cargo be contaminated by the previous cargo. Say\nstyrene monomer after benzene. Empty tanks must be ventilated during the voyage\nto ensure that the index is outside the flammability composition cup diagram.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some of the water\nmixable/ reactive cargoes which are bad for epoxy coating and better off in SS\nor Zinc tanks are\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Acetone, Acrylonitrile,\nEthanol, Methanol, IPA, MEK, Methyl acrylate, VAM, Butyl Acetate, Ekta Solve,\nAdiponitrile etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For many cargoes\nventilation is the only acceptable means of removing the last traces from epoxy\ntanks. For such cargoes bottom flush with water is not a good idea. Read the\npaint manufacturers instructions for the next cargo. It may say\u2014only warm\norganic cargoes.&nbsp; Be very sure to read\nthe footnotes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The test is to shut off\nthe tank and open the steam coils. Open the tank again and check for odour of\nlast cargo. If the odour is still there then ventilation has to be done again.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Caution should be\nexercised when carry high MP heated products as the non-insulated ( from cold\nwind ) PV stacks can clog or the PV valve may stick.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;<b><span style=\"color: red;\"> &nbsp;&nbsp;INSTRUCTIONS FOR TANK ENTRY </span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In &nbsp;XXX XX&nbsp;\nthere is a ZERO TOLERANCE POLICY for flouting tank entry procedures.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No tank entry is\npossible without permission of chief officer/ duty officer. A signed company\nenclosed spaces entry permit must be made for each tank.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No superior ship\nconstruction or company system can prevent accidents if the crew do not have\nsafety culture ingrained in them. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You cannot enter a tank\nby just looking for cleanliness and using your sense of smell. Some gases like\ncarbon monoxide have no odour.&nbsp; Some\ngases choke the sense of smell and are therefore not detected in dangerous\nconcentrations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Read the MSDS sheets to\nfind out the health hazard rating of the last chemical carried or even the\ntankcleaning chemicals used.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Man entry requires\n20.8% oxygen , zero LEL HC and less than TLV ppm on Draeger / Kitagawa gas\ndetector tubes and of course a running vent fan.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Organic face filters\nare of no use against inorganic gases. All organic chemicals have C on the formula\nof MSDS sheet. Nitric acid vapor or Hydrogen sulphide gas is not organic .\nFiltering masks are of no use in an oxygen deficient atmosphere.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Filter protection must\nonly be used against gases which has a distinctive smell and there is no lack\nof Oxygen. If you can smell gas it means the filter is saturated and then it\nhas to be discarded.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Class 1/ 1000 ppm<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Class 2/ 5000 ppm<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mark X/ low BP products<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Filter masks can be\nused only 3hrs in a working day.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Turbo filters have a\nbattery powered blower which reduces the work on the lungs<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Readings of tank\natmospheres must be taken with the ventilation off. Most chemical vapors are\nheavier than air. Readings must be taken from top or bottom depending on vapor\ndensity of cargo<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Know the VP and TLV of\nthe last cargo. Couple of litres of colourless liquid in the sump need not be\nwater, on the contrary it can be a toxic and flammable tankcleaning chemical\neither soluble or insoluble in water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The tank must be isolated\nfrom the other tanks by blanking. Double valve segregation is not good enough\non a parcel chemical tanker. This means the manifold elbow , vapor return elbow\nand manifold flexible jumper hose must be removed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrogen/ free steam\ninlet hose removed and heating steam coil&nbsp;\ninlet manifold shut. Only chief officer REPEAT&nbsp; only chief officer can authorize connection\nof one cargo tank to another by liquid or vapor. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While squeegeing veg\noils the vent fans must be run and steam coils put off. Oxidizing and putrifying\nveg/ animal oils are dangerous for the sweeper.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some gases are so\nacutely toxic that no exceeding of TLV is acceptable. They have been assigned\nwith the letter C for ceiling. Some gases can enter the body through intact\nskin and have been assigned with letter S<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Skin cream does not\nreduce the amount of chemicals absorbed through the skin\u2014but they protect the\nskin itself.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Use harness not belt.\nTry hanging by your waist by 10 seconds to check this out ( don\u2019t damage your\nspine while doing this )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bow thruster room is an\nencl space.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is possible to\nbreathe in an atmosphere containing 17% oxygen provided the air is completely\nnon toxic---such a condition is very rare.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When oxygen is used for\ncombustion in the cells of the body Co2 is formed. The Co2 is removed from the\nbody via blood and the lungs. Oxygen is absorbed in the blood inside lungs and\nCo2 is expelled from blood.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brain superior\ncentres:&nbsp; thought, judgement, controlled\nmovements, senses<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brain subordinate\ncentre: ( self regulating )\u2014control auto functions like breathing, heart rate\ndigestion, temp regulation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Superior centres are\naffected first by toxic gases. Then subordinate centres get damage<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All tank inspections\nmust be done prior to hose connection. Tank can be entered by shore surveyor\nonly in the presence of a ships officer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unless advised to the\ncontrary all tanks must be cleaned to water white standards, dry and odour\nfree. Unseen area checked by rubbing hands for residue. No loose scale or rust\nshould be present.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-r9UGhpd99l4/V1rzjfgiljI/AAAAAAABJ3A/UJ-jE8d55kQLcGWmW1N2U9aMasaMxBNlgCLcB/s1600/capt%2Bajit%2Bvadak2ayil%2B2.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-r9UGhpd99l4/V1rzjfgiljI/AAAAAAABJ3A/UJ-jE8d55kQLcGWmW1N2U9aMasaMxBNlgCLcB/s320/capt%2Bajit%2Bvadak2ayil%2B2.JPG\" width=\"200\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">-------</span><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">CAPT AJIT\nVADAKAYIL ( 30 YEARS IN COMMAND )</span></b><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 250%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">WHY IS\n\"BIG BROTHER\" CONTROLLING INDIAs FINANCE DEPT EVEN AFTER WE GOT\nINDEPENDENCE&nbsp; IN 1947 ?<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 250%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">CANT\nWE HAVE A &nbsp;\"FREE\" &nbsp;FINANCE MINISTER AND RESERVE BANK GOVERNOR?</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Below:&nbsp; THE PRETENDERS at the G7 meet in 2016, Japan. &nbsp;</span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\">These leaders rule the nations with highest GDP . &nbsp;</span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\">They lord it over the rest&nbsp; .&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\">In reality all are beggars.</span></b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-lhAh-vNd76o/V1oafP8sucI/AAAAAAABJwo/KxzFn-9XzPwidsbmEXtjHjbz3Bu-UaeUACLcB/s1600/g7-updated-iFGmage.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"392\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-lhAh-vNd76o/V1oafP8sucI/AAAAAAABJwo/KxzFn-9XzPwidsbmEXtjHjbz3Bu-UaeUACLcB/s640/g7-updated-iFGmage.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These nations doctor\ntheir GDP and stay on top.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me quote Wikipedia-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; The Group of 7 (G7) is a group consisting of<span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><b>\nCanada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, and the United\nStates</b></span>. The European Union is also represented within the G7. These countries\nare the seven major advanced economies as reported by the International\nMonetary Fund: the G7 countries represent more than 64% of the net global\nwealth ($263 trillion).[1] A net national wealth and a very high Human\nDevelopment Index are the main requirements to be a member of this group. The\nG7 countries also represent 46% of the global GDP evaluated at market exchange\nrates and 32% of the global purchasing power parity GDP.[2]&nbsp; :&nbsp; UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>ABOVE IS A LIE OF HUMONGOUS PROPORTIONS&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c7512501827064179901\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_45M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But where from do Americans\nget money to spend? &nbsp;They borrow from other nations like Japan and China.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If all nations to whom\nUSA owes money ( many hostile but chained though nostrils nations like Venezuela, Iran, Iraq,\nLibya, etc.), decided to sell their Treasury securities at the same time-this\ncould potentially decrease demand which would push yields higher. &nbsp;If yields\nrose, the federal government would find it more difficult to service the debt,\npushing the deficit higher. If the deficit rose, the total debt burden would\naccelerate and, unless demand for U.S. debt were to increase, it could get real\nugly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Virtually others save\nfor the US to spend. Global savings are mostly invested in US, in dollars. &nbsp;&nbsp;The world saves for the US \u2013 so that Yanks\ncan spend freely to keep the US consumption going, and for the US economy to\nwork,&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In fact they use their credit cards to spend their future income. This is\na immoral nation who is passing debts to their great grand children, &nbsp;Of couse\nthat will NOT happen as USA knows how to create WW3 . They hope to make India\nand China fight and destroy each other and WW3 will format their debts .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That the US spends&nbsp; is what makes it attractive to export to the\nUS . So US imports more than what it exports year after year.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The result:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The world is dependent\non US consumption for its growth. By its deepening culture of consumption, the\nUS has habituated the world to feed on US consumption. But as the US needs\nmoney to finance its consumption, the world provides the money. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It's like a shopkeeper\nproviding the money to a customer so that the customer keeps buying from the\nshop. If the customer will not buy, the shop won't have business, unless the\nshopkeeper funds him. The US has positioned itself as ZE lucky customer, chosen\nby Kosher Big Brother <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And the world is like\nthe helpless shopkeeper financier. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who is America 's\nbiggest shopkeeper financier? Japan of course. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yet it's Japan which is\nregarded as weak. Modern economists complain that Japanese do not spend, so\nthey do not grow. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHAT IS THIS ELEPHANT DOING IN THIS ROOM.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-tcKv_Izta7E/V1o_YV9zmuI/AAAAAAABJxI/mOUJVGbUAhUnhaQGEpjdOo5mEVi5hyRrACLcB/s1600/2-10-14-GTthe-elephant-in-the-room2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The modern conception\nof GDP was a creature of the interwar slump and WW2.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rothschild arm twisted\nall nations to toe the GDP line\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">LUMP IT IF YOU DON\u2019T\nLIKE IT !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Countries that wanted\nto receive post-war aid under America\u2019s Marshall plan had to produce an\nestimate of GDP.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP treats the plunder\nof the planet as something that adds to income, rather than as a cost.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The kosher system\nDELIBERATELY left out government debt. &nbsp;&nbsp;Debt\naccumulated does not add or subtract from the nation's GDP . &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And hey,&nbsp; GDP has become the metric economists and\npolicymakers primarily look to for analyzing the health of the economy.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I have listened to the\nSOTU address of US presidents for several years \u2013all have kept clear of the\ncrushing external debt ( 19.3 trillion USD today ) .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN DEBT IS IGNORED\nGDP CAN NEVER EVER BE THE SOLE MEASURE OF THE STATE OF ECONOMY OF A NATION.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP cannot distinguish\nbetween \u201cgood\u201d and \u201cbad\u201d spending.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHY ?&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If personal consumption\nincreases, GDP counts that as a positive sign, even if the personal consumption\nis financed by credit cards or other means that put households in a whirlpool\nof debt.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most glaringly, GDP\ndoes not capture the distribution of growth and, as a result, cannot reflect\ninequality..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If a country becomes\nincreasingly in debt, and spends large amounts of income servicing this debt\nthis is not reflected in a decreased GDP.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP is an empty\nabstraction devoid of any link to the real world, and, therefore, has little or\nno value in economic analysis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP focusses on flows,\nnot stocks.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a result an economy\ncan run down its assets yet, at the same time, record high levels of GDP\ngrowth, until a point is reached where the depleted assets act as a check on\nfuture growth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP is misleading in\nthat they do not account for the distribution of income among the residents of\na country, because GDP is merely an aggregate measure. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An economy may be\nhighly developed or growing rapidly, but also contain a wide gap between the\nrich and the poor in a society as in USA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">How can GDP be any\nmeasure of a country's wealth if it does not take into account that country's\nliabilities like external debt <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP is just a measure\nof economic activity rather than wealth. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pissfart nations like Italy and Britain are\nclaiming to be wealthy. &nbsp;&nbsp;Do they even\nknow how much wealth lies under Indian soil?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: x-large;\"><b>CHOOTS.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-tOHd5B9v0oQ/V1pzEgH0nTI/AAAAAAABJxk/_18v8N3nAQosM2JH2wk22TOiHay3PeIuACLcB/s1600/3790DD8282.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
