, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BRAZIL- 0.2%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">LIKE I SAID BEFORE IN\nINDIA 48 % OF OUR GDP RESTS ON OUR SMALL SCALE AND ULTRA SKILLED FAMILY BASED\nCOTTAGE INDUSTRIES\u2014 THIS IS NOT NUMBER CRUNCHED IN DALAL STREET.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OUR ECONOMIC GROTH\nENGINE DOES NOT LIE IN ZIONIST MULTINATIONAL INDUSTRIES OR BIG CITIES.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE DO NOT BELONG TO THE\nSINGAPORE MODEL OR HONGKONG MODEL.&nbsp; OUE\nFOOD GROWS WILD AND FREE \u2013 MOST PEOPLE DO NOT GO TO A MARKET TO BUY FOOD .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">G7 nations talk only\nabout GDP and they have a higher nominal GDP than PPP. We refuse to be\nimpressed any more.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; India has a higher\nPPP than all of them except USA</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Comparisons using PPP\nare more useful when assessing a nation's domestic market because PPP takes\ninto account the relative cost of local goods, services and inflation rates of\nthe country, rather than using international market exchange rates which\ndistort the real differences in per capita income.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A rule of thumb for\nunderstanding GDP nominal and PPP is that PPP is how much of local goods (like\nreal estate, labor, or locally grown produce) a person can buy in their\ncountry, and nominal is roughly how much of an internationally traded good\n(diamonds, cars, phones) a person can buy in their country.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A nominal measure of\nGDP does not account for changes in the relative purchasing power of a good\nacross time; it ignores inflation and deflation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP TELLS NOTHING ABOUT\nSUSTANABILITY<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Over a period of time,\nprices typically tend to go up in an economy and this is reflected in the GDP.\nThus, just by looking at an economy\u2019s unadjusted GDP it is difficult to tell\nwhether the GDP went up as a result of production expanding in the economy or\nbecause prices went up.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This discrepancy has\nlarge implications; for instance, when converted via the nominal exchange rates\nGDP per capita in India is about US$ 1,704 while on a PPP basis it is about US$\n3,608. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At the other extreme, Denmark's\nnominal GDP per capita is around US$ 62,100, but its PPP figure is US$ 37,304.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I REMEMBER , I WAS\nOFFERED A GOOD PAYING SPECIALIST JOB IN NEW YORK, BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE\nCOMPANY .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I REFUSED . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN HE WANTEDTO KNOW\nWHY , I REPLIED &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\u201c I AM SMARTER THAN\nTHE REST- I LOVE TO EARN IN DOLLARS AND SPEND IN RUPEES\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Organization for\nEconomic Cooperation and Development (OECD) annually issues a report based on a\nstudy of 140 countries, indicating the levels of happiness in those countries.\nFor at least the last decade, Denmark and white skinned nations have ranked at\nthe top <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I HAVE BEEN TO THEE\nNATIONS AND I KNOW HOW HAPPY THEY ARE&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FOR THEM SAILING ON A\nYATCH OR ATTENDING A DRUNKEN WIFE SWAPPING PARTY MAY BE HAPPINESS \u2013 FOR AN\nINDIAN BONDING WITH HIS FAMILY WITHIN THE HOME IS HAPPINEES. .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Denmark, which got the\nhighest score, is not only a wealthy country, it's also highly productive with\na 2009 GDP per capita of $68.000 (U.S.) according to the International Monetary\nFund\u2014 Yet they are 58 th in&nbsp; PPP, while\nIndia is No 3.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I know how much a cup\nof coffee costs in Denmark and how much it costs in India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although individuals\ntypically get more wealthy during their lifetimes, they don't get happier. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">DENMARK WITH HIGH\nHAPPINESS RATING IS COLD AND DARK WITH HIGH DIVORCE RATES.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN DENMARK THERE IS 52%\nDIVORCE \u2013 WHILE IN INDIA IT IS 0.08%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The western marriage is\nbased on lust and feelings , the Eastern on TRUST&nbsp; honour and commitment.&nbsp; An Indian woman does NOT go for silicone implants ( which adds to GDP )&nbsp; to SAVE\nher marriage.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vD7ly6t1y2s/V1qEm0yrJUI/AAAAAAABJ0A/CJ2afjeQ-KkLJwqgC3nrCraAlk9G6Y8VgCLcB/s1600/f3daad11018e9f72079ead8914cfffabeb.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vD7ly6t1y2s/V1qEm0yrJUI/AAAAAAABJ0A/CJ2afjeQ-KkLJwqgC3nrCraAlk9G6Y8VgCLcB/s400/f3daad11018e9f72079ead8914cfffabeb.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Excessively focusing on\neconomic indicators such as the GDP and stock market indices takes our\nattention away from the real measurement of a country\u2019s and people\u2019s\nprogress\u2014our overall well being.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Purchasing power parity\n(PPP) compares how many goods and services an exchange-rate-adjusted unit of\nmoney can purchase in different countries. Nominal GDP shows the total productive\noutput of a country, while PPP is an applied doctrine of the comparative value\nof money in different countries <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A purchasing power\nparity (PPP) between two countries, India and Denmark is the ratio of the\nnumber of Rupee &nbsp;needed to purchase in India\nthe same quantity of a specific good or service as &nbsp;Krone will purchase in &nbsp;Denmark <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PPPs can be expressed\nin the currency of either of the countries. In practice, they are usually\ncomputed among large numbers of countries and expressed in terms of a single\ncurrency, with the U.S. dollar (US$) most commonly used as the base or\n\u201cnumeraire\u201d currency.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Comparisons using PPP\nare arguably more useful when assessing a nation's domestic market because PPP\ntakes into account the relative cost of local goods, services and inflation\nrates of the country, rather than using international market exchange rates which\nmay distort the real differences in per capita income.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In GDP the quantity is\nsubstituted for quality<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In other words GDP does\nnot measure the quality of products sold or services provided (actually some G7\ncountries now include income from prostitution/ drugs / anal sex paraphernalia &nbsp;in GDP).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many components of GDP\n(especially FIRE -- finance, insurance and real estate) might be partially\nanti-social and their fast growth (which as services is reflected in GDP) might\nbe detrimental for the health and prosperity of society.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another example is\nsales of high sugar context flavored water called Coca Cola and Pepsi Cola. It\nis negatively affect children health leading to obesity and early diabetes, but\nit is positively reflected in GDP.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The same, even more\ndrastic example is production of arms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Foreign outsourcing of\ncomponent manufacturing distorts statistics and has led to consistent\noverstatement of U.S. GDP and productivity. The connection goes a long way to\nexplain why USA keeps losing jobs even as GDP is apparently expanding. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The strength of\nconsumer spending which is the dominant part of GDP reflects mainly the demand\nof the rich.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;If a harmful drug is taken off the shelves,\nGDP suffers. Similar problem exists with is side-effects of fast food\nepidemics. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Obese people spend\naround billions &nbsp;a year in weight-losing\nproducts. Those spending do not raise economic well-being, just the opposite\nthey compensate harm caused by fast food industry.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VIAGRA SALES ADD TO GDP<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MAKING CHILDREN TAKE\nHARMFUL IMMUNISATION VACCINES , ADDS TO GDP<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">COCA COLA / PEPSI SALES\n( SUGARY AERATED WATER ) WHICH GIVES FATTY LIVER AND DIABETES ADDS TO GDP. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE\nDIABETES DIALYSIS MACHINES ADD TO GDP<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cooperative societies\n(societies that have high level of government services) have lower GDP then\nsocieties were everything is PRIVATISED \u2013and if it is KOSHER you get good\ngrowth ratings.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Government-sponsored\nhealth-care and education decreases GDP.&nbsp;\nThis effect alone makes GDP questionable measure in comparing two\ndifferent countries.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Peaceful societies,\ncharacterized by a lower level of crime (and consequently legal activities,\nprisons, etc.) are penalized in terms of GDP!&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">INDIA HAS LOWEST CRIME,\nRAPES , HOMOSEXUALITY AND DIVORCES BY PERCENTAGE&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Drugs to cure GM/ processed/\n&nbsp;fast food effects on health and low\nmobility induced excessive weight are multi-billion industry which adds to GDP.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If pharmaceutical\nindustry conducts an expensive marketing companion of questionable or even\nharmful drugs and reaps billions from it, GDP increases. If some EVIL man\ncreates a virus in a lab and spreads it , GDP increases.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And this practice was the major driver of\npharmaceutical industry for the last 20 or more years (with the emergence of\n\"blockbuster\" drag concept, like all those cholesterol lowering\ndrags, recreational drugs like Viagra, etc)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IF THE WORLD TRADE\nCENTRE COMES DOWN GDP GROWS.&nbsp; IF YOU GO\nTO WAR FOR THAT GDP GROWS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP only includes\npositive values: if something is destroyed, then rebuilt by a private company,\nGDP goes up while economic well-being is unchanged or even became worse.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wars boosts GDP and USA\nuses this kink in GDP to the fullest extent.&nbsp;\nProfits are reckoned in dollars and the losses in lives.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Destruction or wear of equipment, medical\ndevelopments for better treatment/recovery of wounded soldiers, spillovers into\ncivil sector of intensified research and development for creation of new types\nand modernizing existent types of weapons and defenses against new types of\nenemy attacks all positively contribute to GDP. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Recessions are almost\nimpossible as long as a country is engaged on protracted war- and USA knows\nthis ..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Methods USA uses to\ninflate GDP are ridiculous and illegal ..&nbsp;\nThey have increases GDP to allow for the fact that computers have become\nmore productive over time. This is like giving yourself a medal for farting one\nless time than yesterday.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-CnCbgExuTHI/V1qHHF35qoI/AAAAAAABJ0M/ApSYBvkNaiMRl6aoPkjxHy53I0puvsx5ACLcB/s1600/deeownload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-CnCbgExuTHI/V1qHHF35qoI/AAAAAAABJ0M/ApSYBvkNaiMRl6aoPkjxHy53I0puvsx5ACLcB/s400/deeownload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shifting production\noverseas has inflicted additional damage on the U.S. economy by creating\n\"phantom GDP\".&nbsp; Such gains in\nGDP that don't correspond to any actual domestic production.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP does not take into\naccount the value of all assets in an economy. This is akin to ignoring a\ncompany's balance sheet, and judging it solely on the basis of its income\nstatement.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP measures only\noutput, and makes no claims on the quality of that output, let alone on\nsubjective concepts such as social progress or human happiness. It does what it\nwas intended to do -- offer a value of marketed goods and services produced in\na country in a given time frame \u2013 PERIOD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The biggest flaw of GDP\nis that it obscures growing inequality and encourage the depletion of\nresources.&nbsp; It can\u2019t differentiate\nbetween spending on good things (education) and terrible things (cigarettes/\ndildos for anal sex).&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It cannot&nbsp; measure the those that don\u2019t come with a\nmarket price, such as raising children. It fails to account for the value of\nsocial cohesion, education, health, leisure, a clean environment&nbsp; GDP measures everything \u201cexcept that which\nmakes life worthwhile.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pissfart G7 nation , Italy\nis in the top 10 list of worldwide GDP, but is currently embroiled in a\nnationwide debt crisis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP is a FAALTHU&nbsp; measure of welfare. It tells you how much in\naggregate we produce and earn as a nation. But it doesn\u2019t tell you who\nbenefits.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nor does it tell you whether\nthe income we generate from the economy is sustainable or achieved only by\nrunning down our economic capacity \u2013 consuming at the expense of not replacing\nour infrastructure, for instance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">JUST LOOKING AT THE\nSPEEDOMETER CANNOT WIN THE RACE \u2013WHEN YOU FUEL TANK CANT TAKE YOU ANYWHERE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">LAS VEGAS ( GAMBLING/\nDRUGS / PROSTITUTION ) ADDS TO US GDP<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AIYOOO!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the GDP is up, why\nis America down?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PRAY ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PRITHEE ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">High-knowledge and high\npaying jobs like IT, finance, consulting, engineering, etc. are out of the\nreach of most Americans.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP is a flawed and\nmisleading economic indicator, one that is not the true measure of a country\u2019s\neconomic health and yet most continue to use it as a barometer of our economic\ngrowth and progress. It should be discarded as it distorts the true condition\nof our economy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP FAVOURS LARGE\nZIONIST JEW MULTINATIONALS AND THEIR STOOGES<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is a mandate to\npublish GPI data alongside GDP \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--AND THIS MUST INCLUDE\nTHE DEBT OF THE NATION<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">LET US NOT GO TO TOWN\nWITH VIJAY MALLYAs &nbsp;WEALTH IN BILLIONS\nWHILE HIDING HIS DEBT ( OUR TAX MONEY )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The reason the United\nStates is considered the world\u2019s most prosperous nation is because it has the\nlargest GDP and they want to keep it that way-sorry, we have woken up. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Instead of Moody\u2019 , Fitch and S&amp;P, we\nshall now listen to our own rating agencies . &nbsp;&nbsp;Try stopping us.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is entirely possible\nfor the nation with the world\u2019s highest GDP to also have the world\u2019s highest poverty\nrate and the world\u2019s highest level of national debt. &nbsp;So cut the bull !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The GDP rises whenever\nmoney changes hands. When families break down in the west and children require\nfoster care, the GDP grows, but not so when parents ( like in India) &nbsp;successfully care for their children and run\nhappy homes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People who max out\ntheir credit cards buying things they don\u2019t need make the GDP look good. People\n( like in India ) who save their money and live sensibly don\u2019t.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Seen through such a\nlens, the most economically productive people are cancer patients in the midst\nof getting a divorce. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Healthy people in happy\nmarriages, in contrast, are economically invisible, and all the more so if they\ncook at home, walk to work, grow food in a home garden, and don\u2019t smoke.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By counting the\ndepletion of natural resources as current income rather than as the liquidation\nof assets, the GDP violates both basic accounting principles and common sense.\nSaudi Arabia will soon go back to tents and camels.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The GDP of USA got\nmassive boost by&nbsp; the Exxon Valdez\ndisaster , the boom in prison construction and Osama Bin Laden thingy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meanwhile, natural\nresources such as rivers and oceans, topsoil and forests, the ozone layer and\nthe atmosphere, are seen as essentially valueless\u2014unless, of course, they are\nexploited and converted into revenue.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But even then, the GDP measures the resulting\neconomic activity in a manner that is fundamentally misleading.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP creates a perverse\nincentive to develop policies that lead to short term GDP growth\u2014so that\nPresidents can just finish their term and melt away.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">--while undermining the\nlong term perspectives for the economy and sustainable welfare.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hullo , Obama , we know\nyour GDP and we know your external debt. Selling mortgages to people who could\nnot afford them looked good on paper, but it led to the banking crisis of 2008<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The GDP number hides\nthe underlying realities for everybody except the data crunching experts, it\nacts as a black box. &nbsp;&nbsp;The public does\nnot really knows what caused the growth, except maybe after a crash, with\nhindsight. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This makes it very\ntempting for policymakers to game the indicator and introduce policies that\npromote specific interests and balloon the GDP while not contributing to a\nsustainable economy nor social welfare.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP measures mainly\nmarket transactions. It ignores social costs, environmental impacts and income\ninequality. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If a business used\nGDP-style accounting, it would aim to maximize gross revenue \u2014 even at the expense\nof profitability, efficiency, sustainability or flexibility. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That is hardly smart or\nsustainable&nbsp; Yet since the end of the\nSecond World War, promoting GDP growth has remained the primary national policy\ngoal in almost every white skinned nation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The emphasis on GDP in\ndeveloped countries now fuels social and environmental instability. It also\nblinds developing countries to possibilities for more-sustainable models of\ndevelopment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP does not, and\ncannot, reflect the waste of enormous effort, and precious natural resources,\nthat went into building something that suddenly no one wants. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If USA becomes\nincreasingly in debt, and spends large amounts of income servicing this debt\nthis is not reflected in a decreased GDP.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In China people are\ntaking loans to pay back old loans spent in buying flats they will never live\nin , as nobody else lives in that highrise building \u2013it is too risky.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">72 MILLION EMPTY HOMES,\nAND GHOST CHINESE CITIES IS AN EXAMPLE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\"><b>THE TAILeth SHALL NO LONGER\nWAGeth &nbsp;THE DOGeth.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xUr71B15pQ4/V1rOOarjYRI/AAAAAAABJ1g/wf5eGHZI4pI6bmKvm0r1PbYG6nJyBSh9gCLcB/s1600/dow3nload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xUr71B15pQ4/V1rOOarjYRI/AAAAAAABJ1g/wf5eGHZI4pI6bmKvm0r1PbYG6nJyBSh9gCLcB/s400/dow3nload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>THE CULT IS DEAD , LONG\nLIVE THE CULT&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;TEE HEEEEEE&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GOOD RIDDANCE !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ARRRGGHH &nbsp;PPTTHHEEOOYYY !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Goodhart\u2019s Law: When\nindicators become goals -&nbsp; &nbsp;\u201cWhen a measure becomes a target, it ceases to\nbe a good measure.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-IpfjMXBQMgk/V1qJGz4td_I/AAAAAAABJ0Y/sBqQ-3V3t7URP3LWAALB_N_wCihk2DZfwCLcB/s1600/downlffeeoad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\">Below: &nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\">THERE CAN BE NO GPI , WITHOUT SHOWING\nTHE <span style=\"color: red;\">DEBT OF THE NATION</span>.&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>YOUR PERSONAL BANK ACCOUNT CANT JUST SHOW\nREMITTANCES AS A ACTIVITY&nbsp; --&nbsp;</b></span><b style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: Cambria, serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">-- IT HAS TO SHOW WITHDRAWALS AND THE BALANCE\nSHEET .</b></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0QuBclXEBOc/V1rWdq0eERI/AAAAAAABJ1w/VXU9xDZeXSYIOJmcQYQJW2moNEgeSWoKgCLcB/s1600/Genuine-ProgreEEss-Indicator-041.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-mSKK68ER_YQ/V1rZOzcyXlI/AAAAAAABJ18/f__6kXeZSwIViphCK_PUPNZedamUO9mWACLcB/s1600/gpi_gr44aph_for_ijec.jpeg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"424\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-mSKK68ER_YQ/V1rZOzcyXlI/AAAAAAABJ18/f__6kXeZSwIViphCK_PUPNZedamUO9mWACLcB/s640/gpi_gr44aph_for_ijec.jpeg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">BELOW ARE THE TOP NATIONS WHEN IT COMES TO GDP BY\nPPP ( purchasing power parity )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">Rank /Country / GDP ( Millions of Int$)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">1 China 19,392,357 &nbsp;( <b><span style=\"color: red;\">FUDGED</span></b> )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">2 United States 17,947,000 ( <b><span style=\"color: red;\">FUDGED</span></b> )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>3 India 7,965,162</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">5 Germany 3,840,550 ( <b><span style=\"color: red;\">FUDGED</span></b> )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; line-height: 115%;\">8 United Kingdom 2,679,325<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">9 France 2,646,888<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; line-height: 115%;\">12 Saudi Arabia 1,683,044<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">13 Canada 1,631,943<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">14 Spain 1,615,074<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">15 Australia 1,138,085<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">16 Netherlands 832,623<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">17 South Africa 723,518<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">18 Sweden 473,413<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">19 Norway 356,209<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">20 Portugal 289,791<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">21 Greece 285,976<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">22 Israel 281,939</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">23 Denmark 258,702<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NOTE: GDP Nominal and\nGDP / PPP are identical in the US, because USD is used as the benchmark. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;But in all of the most developed countries\nexcept the US, the nominal is higher. The Geary\u2013Khamis dollar, more commonly\nknown as the international dollar is a hypothetical unit of currency that has\nthe same purchasing power parity that the U.S. dollar had in the United States\nat a given point in time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ztgTS1QavOQ/V1rdm-fg56I/AAAAAAABJ2I/n6ErgPo336sH7EdX-mYWY8teuO9Qb3F9QCLcB/s1600/unit-23-exchange-rate-determinatEEEion-theories-focus-on-ppp-only-16-638.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ztgTS1QavOQ/V1rdm-fg56I/AAAAAAABJ2I/n6ErgPo336sH7EdX-mYWY8teuO9Qb3F9QCLcB/s640/unit-23-exchange-rate-determinatEEEion-theories-focus-on-ppp-only-16-638.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nominal GDP, does not\nreflect differences in the cost of living and the inflation rates of the\ncountries; therefore using a GDP PPP per capita basis is arguably more useful\nwhen comparing differences in living standards between nations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP growth is not a\ngood indicator of improving quality of life because it does not measure the big\npicture.&nbsp; It cannot go from microscope vision\nmode to great condor aerial view more at will. &nbsp;The quality of life&nbsp; depends on many different variables and GDP\nis only a small portion of this.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN IT COMES TO MANUFACTURING--</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: large;\">BY PERCENTAGE. </span>&nbsp;</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">WE DONT CARE FOR WHAT OUR JUDAS BENAMI MEDIA AND THE PERCEPTION MOLDERS SAY .</b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NcHtY-Nz5zU/V1ro_Nna60I/AAAAAAABJ2s/gUlGo9CytVctynmzcQXCT4gahLQmThRmQCLcB/s1600/s-l3EE00.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We pollute the air,\nwater, and soil as well. When trash goes into a landfill, this affects GDP\npositively because a service was purchased.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When minerals are taken out of the\nground and exported ( so that politicians can get 30% kickbacks in foreign\naccounts ) , this counts positively towards GDP, but nowhere in this measure is\nit taken into account that the mineral is now depleted .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Expenditures on the\nmilitary, police, security and services for drug addiction and lawsuits all\ncontribute to GDP. Just because these services are being purchased, doesn\u2019t\nmean that they improve our well-being. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ALL WESTERN NATIONS\nHAVE SUPER EXPENSIVE ACCOUNTANTS AND LAWYERS , WHO DON\u2019T DO A DANG THING FOR\nNATION BUILDING &nbsp;--THEY ALL ADD TO GDP<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP only takes the\nmonetary aspect of our life.&nbsp; &nbsp;In India there are vast swathes of land where\npeople have never touched cash , yet they are very happy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP does not account\nfor any work done outside of the monetary system. These means that much of the\nwork done by Indian women&nbsp; unrecognized\nin the economy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In USA the GDP can\nactually have the inverse affect on the quality of life. &nbsp;This is because of the way Yank medical and\nprison systems are set up. The more people that are sick or incarcerated, the\nmore profit is made. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This means that even\nthough the GDP may rise, it may be a result of a decrease in the quality of\nlife of the US citizens <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PROSPERITY OF EVIL PHARMA &nbsp;IN USA &nbsp;CONTRIBUTES TO GDP<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\nMAD COW DISEASE CONTRIBUTED TO UK GDP . .<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the west they\nDELIBERATLY do double counting, to boost GDP.&nbsp;\nMeasuring intermediate goods and services would lead to double counting\nof economic activity within a country. &nbsp;&nbsp;Double counting occurs when the costs of\nintermediate goods that are used for producing a final product are included in\nthe GDP count.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since the final price of a good already includes the value of\nall the intermediate goods used to produce it, including the price of\nintermediate goods when calculating gross domestic product would involve double\ncounting.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP does NOT reveal\nwhether a nation is happy.&nbsp; Decadent\nwestern mindsets consider that more money makes people happier.&nbsp; We in spiritual India know for sure- simply\nearning more money does not correlate with happiness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN INDIA WEALTH IS NOT\nEQUATED WITH HAPINESS - A HAPPY HOME AND PEACE OF MIND MEANS HAPPINESS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a nation when the\npoor do better, the GPI must rise; when they don't, it must fall.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India almost all\nwomen stay at home, being homemakers. They are NOT sleeping throughout the day.\nThey are working their asses off. &nbsp;&nbsp;Why\ndo we neglect 47% of the female work force? &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India we do NOT employ baby sitters . The\nwomen don\u2019t go to a supermarket to buy food, they prepare food with what is\nlocally available, most of the time not paying cash.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP makes no\ndistinction between market transactions that contribute positively to\nsustainable well-being (such as buying bicycles, solar panels or fresh local\nfood) and those that diminish it (gas-guzzlers, guns, cigarettes).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both the American\npublic and the government routinely spend money on credit, and the effects of\nchronic debt are not factored into GDP.&nbsp;\nDuring the run up to the mortgage crisis, millions of Americans got home\nequity loans. These monies were used for everything from home interior\nrenovations, new cars, vacations, paying back other loans and more.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All those\nexpenditures counted toward positive GDP growth, but the country was not in a\nhealthy state. When the housing bubble burst, the effects of that debt spending\nhit the nation hard \u2013 and the GDP numbers did not reflect that hidden\ntime-bomb.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP cannot distinguish\nbetween a positive economic indicator, like increased spending due to more\ndisposable income, and a negative economic indicator, like increased spending\non credit cards due to loss of wages or declining real value of wages.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gross Domestic\nProduct is supposed to measure the total output of goods and services, it\ndoesn't, in India<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">WE INDIANS MUST MAKE OUR OWN </span><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">GPI </span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">MEASUREMENT TO EXPOSE THE IMMORAL AND LYING WHITE MAN AND KOSHER RULED\nNATIONS . &nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">NO MORE DANCING TO THE KOSHER TUNE-<span style=\"color: blue;\"> \"MORE THE DEBT, THE MERRIER WE ARE \" </span><span style=\"color: red;\">( LIKE VIJAYA MALLYA ) &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></b><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; GNP = GDP + NR (Net income inflow from assets abroad or Net Income Receipts) - NP (Net payment outflow to foreign assets). Total value of Goods and Services produced by all nationals of a country (whether within or outside the country).<br />\n<br />\nBefore USA reported the broader GNP, which includes the GDP plus the balance of international flows of interest and dividend payments.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_30MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_30BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_30B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_31B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c7067684051026716195\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_31M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GPI enables\npolicymakers at the national, state, regional, or local level to measure how\nwell their citizens are doing both economically and socially.&nbsp; GDP is merely a sum of national spending with\nno distinctions between transactions that add to well-being and those that\ndiminish it. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The GPI starts with the\nsame personal consumption data that the GDP is based on, but then makes some\ncrucial distinctions. It adjusts for factors such as income distribution, adds\nfactors such as the value of household and volunteer work, and subtracts factors\nsuch as the costs of crime and pollution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">DEBTS MUST BE FACTORED\nIN UNDLESS SOME JUDAS IN THE PAYROLL OF JEW ROTHSCHILD CONVINCES US THAT DEBTS\nARE GOOD FOR HAPPINESS AND WELL BEING.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
