font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/wm7rOKT151Y/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/wm7rOKT151Y?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a method to\nthe kosher GDP madness.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; GDP does not\ndetect symptoms of fundamental economic malaise such as an unbalanced\npenetration of imports into strategic industries; the sinking of household and\npublic savings into economically terminal consumption rather than\ninfrastructure and asset regeneration; starvation of research or sunrise\nindustries; rising defensive expenditure on remediating pollution or social\ndecay; rampant speculation on asset prices such as real estate or the stock\nmarket; the accumulation of private or public debt; or the transfer of assets\nto foreign investors.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Below:&nbsp; A Minsky moment is a sudden major collapse of\nasset values which is part of the credit cycle or business cycle. Such moments\noccur because long periods of prosperity and increasing value of investments\nlead to increasing speculation using borrowed money.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-27n_CDrrugs/V1vcwDxhMeI/AAAAAAABJ3s/e6PK8QM4sYAfnNMLwnNJvVFRoGZxz2ufgCLcB/s1600/cfhina%2Bminsky%2B1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"368\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-27n_CDrrugs/V1vcwDxhMeI/AAAAAAABJ3s/e6PK8QM4sYAfnNMLwnNJvVFRoGZxz2ufgCLcB/s640/cfhina%2Bminsky%2B1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">Chinese local government\u2019s have meager incomes, but\nvastly bloated debts based on stupendously over-valued inventories of land.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">China has </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">turned to massive lending to boost economic\ngrowth.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br /><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">China is on the cusp of the greatest margin\ncall in history.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/2ZgQ-7uNmSU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/2ZgQ-7uNmSU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP is becoming an ever\nmore misleading measure.&nbsp;&nbsp; In wartime,\nGDP was concerned with managing supply. A problem with GDP even when it is\nbeing asked to do nothing more than measure production is that it is a relic of\na period dominated by manufacturing.&nbsp; A\nproblem with GDP even when it is being asked to do nothing more than measure\nproduction is that it is a relic of a post war period dominated by\nmanufacturing<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Despite convention, a\nlot of what is included in GDP lies outside the market economy.&nbsp;&nbsp; Typically financial services are not paid\nfor directly in fees: banks make a large part of their income from charging\nmore interest on loans than they pay on deposits.&nbsp; To capture the value being added,\nstatisticians use an imputed figure, the \u201cspread\u201d between a risk-free interest\nrate and a lending rate, and multiply this by the stock of loans.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The problem with this\nmethod is that the lending spread is a measure of the risk banks take. For this\nreason its use in GDP figures can have perverse results. For example, at the\nturn of 2009 Britain\u2019s financial sector was close to collapse. But because fear\nof bank defaults was driving spreads up, GDP figures recorded a spike in the\nsector\u2019s value added, and thus its contribution to GDP<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP of G7 nations has\nincreased multifold while GPI has declined drastically due to increasing income\ninequality, environmental degradation and loss of social capital.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Having 1% rich and 99%\npoor like in USA hides GDP reality .&nbsp; For\na family barely scraping by, 600 USD could be the difference between paying the\nrent or being evicted\u2014between having a place to sleep and being homeless.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To\nsomeone more affluent, 600 USD might simply mean a big dinner .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GPI makes deductions\nfor income inequality, because 600 USD in the hands of a poor person does a\ngreat deal more to improve their well-being than an additional 600 USD in the\nhands of a rich person.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDP merely measures a\nnation's raw economic activity in terms of production and consumption\u2014it does\nNOT bother that the nation is drowning in debt , to be passed on to the great\ngrandchildren OR start of WW3. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It doesn't pretend to\ndiscriminate between beneficial economic activity (new infrastructure,\ninvestment in education, disease prevention, etc) and negative activity (the\ncost of crime, pollution, etc). And it entirely ignores whole swathes of\nfruitful activity, such as homemaker women\u2019s housework or volunteering in the\ncommunity.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GDI is identical to GDP\nin theory. Money used to purchase goods and services becomes someone's income\nin one way or another. But GDI differs in practice due to the way the national\nincome and product accounts are constructed.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And HULLLOOOO why hide the\nnations\u2019s DEBT ? &nbsp;Why does USA want to\nhide its 19.3 trillion USD external debt?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">USA is no 1 in GDP, yet\nwe all know that most of the US population is hand to mouth with high unemployment.&nbsp; Despite relatively constant GDP growth, it is\nnow universally recognized that American economic opportunity for most is\nexclusively limited to employment in low-wage low-value add service sectors\nlike retail, hospitality, healthcare, education, and public service.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If a\ntruckload of toxic chemicals spills somewhere, the money spent cleaning it up\nis added to the GDP\u2014this MAD KOSHER SCHEME must now be put to sleep.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">India will do it\u2014</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">India will bell the kosher cat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ksF2GMChv78/V1vicOhJP5I/AAAAAAABJ38/m_7Yc2iYM5MR2m9pjO0l7Q1lxVNdTOzRwCLcB/s1600/tzw6bj.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"478\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ksF2GMChv78/V1vicOhJP5I/AAAAAAABJ38/m_7Yc2iYM5MR2m9pjO0l7Q1lxVNdTOzRwCLcB/s640/tzw6bj.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>The\nGPI counts net additions to the capital stock as contributions to well-being,\nand treats money borrowed from abroad as reductions. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">If the\nborrowed money is used for investment ( &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">LIES ARE TOLD </span><span style=\"color: red;\">ALWAYS </span><span style=\"color: purple;\">BY WESTERN NATIONS</span></span><span style=\"color: purple;\">&nbsp;) , the negative effects are canceled out. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>\n\n\n\n</b></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>But if\nthe borrowed money is used to finance consumption, the GPI declines.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\">#################################################</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\">MORAL / EPILOGUE :&nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\">GDP growth figures reveal very little about the underlying dynamics of an economy if one does not simultaneously attempt to analyze what part of the growth is credited to simply artificially fueling the economy with <span style=\"color: blue;\">NEW LOANS</span> .</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\">Western countries have lost the capacity to grow their economies. All they have left is a capacity to pile up <span style=\"color: blue;\">MASSIVE DEBT .&nbsp;</span></span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\">By massively accumulating <span style=\"color: blue;\">NEW DEBT</span>, they are able to keep up a semblance of at least sluggish growth.</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; line-height: 22.4px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Most of the remittances come from UAE and USA .&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<br />\nNRI Remittances are more reliable than foreign direct investment and foreign institutional investments because NRIs bother a lot less about the investment climate in the country. This is because remittances are made mostly to maintain families living in India.<br />\n<br />\nTHESE REMITTANCES DO NOT INCREASE GDP., BUT AFFECTS ONLY GNP.<br />\n<b style=\"font-size: 16px;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br />WHOSE IDEA IS ALL THIS BULLSHIT.</span></b><br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c7457684098641757227\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_89M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. They caught six or seven monkeys, which was all that was left and got 500 each.\ud83d\ude4a\ud83d\udc35\ud83d\udc35\ud83d\udc35\ud83d\udc35\ud83d\udc35\ud83d\udc12<br /><br />The villagers were waiting anxiously for the next announcement.\ud83d\ude44<br /><br />Then the merchant announced that he is going home for a week. And when he returns, he will buy monkeys @ 1000 each!\ud83d\udc35\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5<br /><br />He asked his employee to take care of the monkeys he bought. He was alone taking care of all the monkeys in a cage.\ud83e\udd20\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12<br /><br />The merchant went home.\ud83d\ude0e<br /><br />The villagers were very sad as there were no more monkeys left for them to sell it at $1000 each.\u2639\ud83d\ude1e\ud83d\ude13<br /><br />Then the employee told them that he will sell some monkeys @ 700 each secretly. \ud83d\ude36<br /><br />This news spread like fire. Since the merchant buys monkey @ 1000 each, there is a 300 profit for each monkey.\ud83d\ude2c<br /><br />The next day, villagers made a queue near the monkey cage.\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc35\ud83d\udc12\ud83e\udd11\ud83e\udd11\ud83e\udd11\ud83e\udd11\ud83e\udd11\ud83e\udd11\ud83e\udd11\ud83e\udd11\ud83e\udd11\ud83e\udd11<br /><br />The employee sold all the monkeys at 700 each. The rich bought monkeys in big lots. The poor borrowed money from money lenders and also bought monkeys!<br />\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udc12\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5\ud83d\udcb5<br /><br />The villagers took care of their monkeys &amp; waited for the merchant to return. \ud83d\ude15<br /><br />But nobody came! ...\ud83d\ude24 Then they ran to the employee...\ud83e\udd20<br /><br />But he has already left too !\ud83d\ude09<br /><br />The villagers then realised that they have bought the useless stray monkeys @ 700 each and unable to sell them! \ud83d\ude29\ud83d\ude2b\ud83d\ude28\ud83d\ude30\ud83d\ude2d\ud83d\ude2d\ud83d\ude2d\ud83d\ude2d\ud83d\ude2d\ud83d\ude2d<br />The Bitcoin will be the next monkey business<br />\ud83d\ude1c<br /><br />It will make a lot of people bankrupt and a few people filthy rich in this monkey business. \ud83d\udc12\ud83d\ude09\ud83d\ude05<br /><br />That' how it will work\ud83e\udd23</span></div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_88MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-759216655\" style=\"background-color: white; display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_88BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_88B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_89B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c130649240389902365\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_89M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. HERE REACTION RULES, NOT THE ACTION..<br /><br />A GOOD TRADER GETS THE WHIFF OF MARKET FUCKIN' FORCES AND SUPPLIES THE DEMAND--SUPPY MUST ALWAYS SMELL THE FART OF DEMAND..<br /><br />YOU KNOW WHY FAALTHU ADVISE IS CHEAP ?--BECAUSE SUPPLY ALWAYS EXCEEDS DEMAND ..<br /><br />THE ARM WRESTING BETWEEN SUPPLY AND DEMAND IS CONTROLLED BY KOSHER BIG BROTHER..<br /><br />WHEN DEMAND IS DOWN AND SUPPLY IS UP-- PRICES CRASH\u2026<br /><br />COST OF PRODUCTION GOVERNS OSCILLATIONS ..<br /><br />MERIT ? BALLS TO MERIT ! HOW DID ROTHSCHILDs TULIPS SELL IN HOLLAND ? ..<br /><br />OUR REACTION TO A SITUATION HAS THE POWER TO CHANGE THE SITUATION..<br /><br />WHAT I WROTE IS THE COMMANDMENTS OF ECONOMICS--- HOW MANY ECONOMISTS IN INDIA CAN EVEN UNDERSTAND IT ? ..<br /><br />THIS IS WHY I SAY-- 95% OF ECONOMICS PROFESSORS IN ELITE BUSINESS SCHOOLS NEED TO BE SACKED.. ..<br /><br />A LIFE OF \"KNEE JERK\" REACTION IS A LIFE OF SLAVERY.. PEOPLE ALWAYS SELL IN PANIC. ..<br /><br />WHAT DO THESE ROTHSCHILDs AGENCIES LIKE MOODYs, S&amp;P, FITCH ETC DO ?..<br /><br />THEY ARE IN THE CHAKRAVYUH OF USELESS COMMANDMENTS . THEY DONT KNOW IF THEY ARE COMING OR GOING-- CANT DIFFERENTIATE BETWEEN ASSHOLE AND ELBOW\u2026<br /><br />TWO STORIES BELOW--<br />########<br />A city traveller was driving through a shanty town in Alabama. .<br /><br />He feels he needs to go for a crap , and so he stops at the best motel in town\u2026<br /><br />He tells the motel owner at the reception that he needs to stay overnight, but he has to check out the best room first, and only if it suits his standards, only then , he will stay overnight. ..<br /><br />The owner agrees, takes 100 dollars from him as a refundable depost, and the traveller goes up to check out his room. ..<br /><br />Meanwhile the motel owner races to the town\u2019s resident whore and returns the 100 dollars he owes her. The whore rushes to the tailor and return 100 dollars she owes him. The tailor rushes to the butcher, the butcher rushes to the tavern owner etc etc\u2014this 100 dollar changes hands several times , before the 100 dollar bill comes back to the motel owner via the local blacksmith who had used the motel several times. ..<br /><br />The traveller meanwhile declares that the motel room is below his standards, ( but he used the toilet for a nice crap quietly ) collects his 100 dollars back from the motel owner , gets into his car and drives away\u2026<br /><br />Now\u2014<br /><br />Every body has benefitted\u2014the traveller had his free crap at leisure, the entire town have repayed their debts in a MERRY GO ROUND WAY , and is looking forwards to a better future with renewed confidence\u2026<br /><br />This is how the American system works\u2026<br /><br />#####<br /><br />CONTINUED TO 2-</span></div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_89MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"background-color: white; They are worse than lawyers in the cerebral dept\u2026<br />#############<br />Experienced economist and not so experienced economist are walking down Oxford street.<br /><br />They get across shit lying on the asphalt\u2026<br /><br />Experienced economist: \"If you eat it I'll give you $20,000!\"..<br /><br />Not so experienced economist runs his optimization program on his I7 procesor laptop and figures out he's better off eating it so he does and collects money\u2026<br /><br />Continuing along the same road they almost step into yet another pice of turd.<br /><br />The not so experienced economist: \"Now, if YOU eat this shit I'll give YOU $20,000.\"<br /><br />After evaluating the proposal , our experienced economist eats shit and pockets the moolah.<br /><br />They go on.<br /><br />The not so experienced economist starts thinking aloud : \"Listen, we both have the same amount of money we had before, but we both ate shit. I don't see us being better off.\"..<br /><br />Experienced economist: \"Well, that's true, but you overlooked the fact that we've been just involved in $40,000 of fucking trade.\"<br /><br />##########<br /><br />\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/04/salman-khan-chinkara-poaching-jail-term.html?showComment=1522947259124#c1942223813594303851\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 5, 2018 at 10:24 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_27MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/economy/policy/rbi-dumps-gva-model-switches-back-to-gdp-to-meaure-economy/articleshow/63629246.cms<br />\n<br />\nGVA gives a picture of the state of economic activity from the producers' side or supply side, the GDP model gives the picture from the consumers' side or demand perspective<br />\n<br />\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xAg3GG0aJlI<br />\n<br />\nGross Domestic Product (GDP) of any nation represents the sum total of gross value added (GVA) in all the sectors of that economy during the said year after adjusting for taxes and subsidies.<br />\n<br />\nGDP at factor cost represents what the producers in the economy make from industrial activity \u2014 wages, profits, rents and capital \u2014 called \u2018factors of production\u2019<br />\n<br />\nGross value added (GVA) is the measure of the value of goods and services produced in an area, industry or sector of an economy. In national accounts GVA is output minus intermediate consumption<br />\n<br />\nThe growth in the economy was gauged by the growth in GDP at factor cost \u2014 period. GDP growth is adjusted for net indirect taxes \u2014 indirect taxes are added while subsidies are subtracted from GVA. This is to reflect the price paid by the consumer.<br />\n<br />\nNow we are coming back from GVA to GDP.<br />\n<br />\nGVA is linked as a measurement to gross domestic product (gdp), as both are measures of output. The relationship is defined as:<br />\n<br />\nGVA + taxes on products - subsidies on products = GDP<br />\n<br />\nWhere, GDP = private consumption + gross investment + government investment + government spending + (exports - imports)<br />\n<br />\nWhile GVA gives a picture of the state of economic activity from the producers\u2019 side or supply side, the GDP gives the picture from the consumers\u2019 side or demand perspective.<br />\n<br />\nProducers may also incur other expenses such as property tax, stamp duties and registration fees before sale. These are included in the GDP, but not the GVA. Essentially, GVA captures what accrues to the producer, before a product is sold.<br />\n<br />\nGVA is used to measure the output or contribution of a particular sector.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/06/gpi-dog-shall-wag-gdp-tail-not-vice.html<br />\n<br />\nWE HAVE TRUMP ADDING THE COST OF THE MEXICAN WALL TO US GDP<br />\n<br />\nTEE HEEEEEEE<br />\n<br />\nTHROW A CHAPPATI IN THE GENERAL DIRECTION OF HILLY BILLY YANKS..<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-IPicSqtyx44/V11zr-fGbwI/AAAAAAABJ9o/dGMxZMmv4i4COO8aTpgei1RfHdmwJTmqwCLcB/s1600/sliWWSde114.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-IPicSqtyx44/V11zr-fGbwI/AAAAAAABJ9o/dGMxZMmv4i4COO8aTpgei1RfHdmwJTmqwCLcB/s640/sliWWSde114.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c1084222837658710761\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_7M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/04/the-pretenders-audrey-truschke-wendy.html?showComment=1524449317588#c1084222837658710761\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 23, 2018 at 7:38 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_7MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: red;\">https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/learning-with-the-times-why-the-us-is-keeping-an-eye-on-indias-exchange-rate-policies/articleshow/63874081.cms</span><br />\nINDIA WILL NOT SURRENDER OUR SOVEREIGNTY TO USA<br />\n<br />\nCurrency manipulation\u2013the effort to keep exports cheap by intervening in the foreign exchange market..<br />\n<br />\nUsually, when a country raises its interest rates, the value of its currency rises, making its exports more expensive and less competitive.<br />\n<br />\nWE DON\u2019T NEED TO LEARN ECOONOMICS FROM USA ..<br />\n<br />\nHere's the criteria a country has to meet to be named a currency manipulator by USA: --<br />\n<br />\n---Have a significant trade surplus with the US<br />\n---Have a \"material\" current account surplus with the US<br />\n---Be engaged in \"persistent, one-sided\" intervention in the foreign exchange market<br />\n<br />\nThe US lists three criterion for judging whether it needs to take action against its partners\u2014a bilateral trade surplus of at least $20 billion ( meaning the value of goods it exports to the U.S. exceeds the value of its American imports by that much), an overall current account surplus of at least 3% of GDP ( a measurement of goods, services and investments that go in and out of a country), and net purchases of foreign currency amounting to at least 2% of GDP over a 12-month period.<br />\n<br />\nINDIAs GDP IS FAR HIGHER THAN WHAT IS PROJECTED BY IMF\u2014 AS WE DO NOT FACTOR IN COTTAGE AND FAMILY BASES INDUSTRIES INTO OUR GDP<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/06/gpi-dog-shall-wag-gdp-tail-not-vice.html</span><br />\n<br />\nIn reality the rupee is overvalued and needs to be at around 69 rupees to the dollar to be at its true value. The over-valuation, it goes without saying, hurts India\u2019s exports<br />\n<br />\nWhile China\u2019s overall current account surplus is 1.4% of GDP, Japan\u2019s is 3.8 %, Germany\u2019s a whopping 7.9 % and India on the other hand has a deficit of 1.4%<br />\nGerman current account SURPUS \u2014 which measures the flow of goods, services and investments is the world\u2019s largest at $290 billion, followed by Japan with $206 billion.<br />\n<br />\nOn the other hand India's Current Account recorded a DEFICIT of 13.7 Billion USD<br />\n<br />\nA country is said to have a trade surplus if its exports exceed its imports, and a trade deficit if its imports exceed its exports.<br />\n<br />\nThe current account deficit is a measurement of a country\u2019s trade where the value of the goods and services it imports exceeds the value of the goods and services it exports<br />\n<br />\nDONALD THE TRUMP\u2014 FUCK OFF !<br />\n<br />\nTHAMBI TRUMP-- YOU WANT TO INCLUDE THE COST OF THE MEXICAN WALL IN YOUR GDP AND GROWTH ? AIYYOOOOOO !!<br />\n<br />\nThere is NO FUCKIN\u2019 WAY that India will meet all three criteria and be called a manipulator, as it has persistently been running current account deficits since 2004<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..<br />\n<br />\nPUT ABOVE COMMENT IN WEBSITES OF--<br />\nPMO<br />\nPM MODI<br />\nARUN JAITLEY<br />\nRBI GOVERNOR<br />\nCOMMERCE MINISTER<br />\nMEA<br />\nSUSHMA SWARAJ<br />\nSWAMY<br />\nGURUMURTHY</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3618527832511547134\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_96M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. text-decoration-line: none;\">May 7, 2018 at 2:26 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_96MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/narendra-modi-has-stopped-so-low-it-doesnt-behove-a-pm-says-manmohan-singh/articleshow/64061690.cms<br />\n<br />\nMANMOHAN PAAJII<br />\n<br />\nYOU AND YOUR SIDE KICK MONETK SINGH AHLUWALIA DO NOT KNOW ECONOMICS...<br />\n<br />\nSO SAYS CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<br />\n<br />\nI AM NOT AN ECONOMIST-- BUT I KNOW ECONOMICS BETTER THAN YOU..<br />\n<br />\nIT BOILS DOWN TO CEREBRAL WHEREWITHAL...<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/06/gpi-dog-shall-wag-gdp-tail-not-vice.html<br />\n<br />\nWE ALL KNOW ROTHSCHILD MADE YOU RBI GOVERNOR AND THEN FINANCE MINISTER VIA RAJYA SABHA BACKDOOR MANMOHAN SINGH. ..<br />\n<br />\nDONT MAKE ME SAY ANYTHING MORE<br />\n<br />\nPUT ABOVE COMMENT IN WEBSITES OF--<br />\nARUN JAITLEY<br />\nFINANCE MINISTRY<br />\nRBI GOVERNOR<br />\nPMO<br />\nPM MODI<br />\nSBI CHAIRMAN<br />\nNITI AYOG<br />\nSPEAKER LOK SABHA<br />\nSPEAKER RAJYA SABHA</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8136309837001199565\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_9M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/05/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load.html?showComment=1525779235769#c8136309837001199565\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">May 8, 2018 at 5:03 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_9MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/rupee-at-15-month-low-whats-causing-the-downturn/articleshow/64076347.cms<br />\n<br />\nThe value of Indian Rupee (or any other currency) is determined by the market. The demand and supply forces in the currency market.. If the demand for Indian currency is high, Indian rupee will have high value, and if demand is low, it will depreciate.<br />\n<br />\nSo, if market forces determine the value of a currency, that type of system is called Floating Rate System. India has adopted floating rate system since 1975. (This means that our Prime Minister, Finance Minister or RBI chairperson cannot fix the currency exchange rate at the click of a button. But they still have some control \u2013 through policy measures or by controlling foreign exchange reserves).<br />\n<br />\n1947 : 1 US$ = 1.00 INR<br />\n1948 : 1 US$ = 4.79 INR.<br />\n1965 : 1 US$ = 4.79 INR.<br />\n1966 : 1 US$ = 7.57 INR.<br />\n1971 : 1 US$ = 8.39 INR.<br />\n1985 : 1 US$ = 12.0 INR.<br />\n1991 : 1 US$ = 17.9 INR.<br />\n1993 : 1 US$ = 31.7 INR.<br />\n2000 : 1 US$ = 45.0 INR.<br />\n2013 : 1 US$ = 60.0 INR.<br />\n2017 : 1 US$ = 65.0 INR.<br />\n2018 : 1 US$ = 67.0 INR.<br />\n<br />\nThe first major devaluation of the rupee happened in 1966 when it was pegged against the US dollar at Rs 4.75 per USD<br />\n<br />\nToday it takes Rs 67 today to buy a dollar.<br />\n<br />\nIn 1991, India had an economic crisis. The government had a balance of payment problem, and was on the verge of defaulting. The rupee was further devalued to Rs 25/$ as part of the measures to overcome the crisis.<br />\n<br />\nBy 1993, with the so-called liberalisation of the economy, the rupee started to slide towards the Rs 35/$ mark, as the open market had taken control of its exchange.<br />\n<br />\nIn 2008, with the global recession, the rupee rose to Rs 51/$, after having appreciated to Rs 39/$. In 2012 with the Greece-Spain sovereign debt crisis, Indian government\u2019s budget conditions worsened and GoI had resorted to selling dollars which devalued the rupee further to Rs 56/$ in June 2012.<br />\n<br />\nThe exchange rate of a currency is not really an indicator of the economic strength of a country. Obviously , the economic position of India in 2018 is far better than that of 1947, though there is fall in Rupee value. But if rupee is Rs.60 one day and if it Rs. 68 the next day, it shows high volatility. Such a situation is not good for the economy and that will only trigger more fall in Indian rupee.<br />\n<br />\nWhy do governments ( like China ) devalue their currencies? They do it mainly to improve the balance of trade (or in other words increase exports and decrease imports!).<br />\n<br />\nA devaluation means that more local currency is needed to purchase imports and exporters get more local currency when they convert the export proceeds (the foreign exchange that they get for their exports). In other words: imports ( gold/ oil ) become more expensive \u2013 and exporters earn more money. This is supposed to discourage imports \u2013 and to encourage exports and, in turn, to reduce trade deficits<br />\n<br />\nEvery time there is a fall in rupee against US dollar, exporters from India are benefited. (Eg: Software companies, seafood / textile exporters etc.) This situation badly affects importers . Many exporters in India import raw material, add value, and export it to other markets around the world. The advantage of a weaker currency is limited for those players.<br />\n<br />\nIndia is a net importer of oil. It has to buy oil in dollars. Therefore, rising oil prices worsen India\u2019s current account and also weaken the Rupee. More Indian\u2019s rupees have to be spent on buying oil. We must reduce dependency on foreign oil, through domestic and renewable energy. If we grow water intensive GM sugarcane for Ethanol it must be away from farmers who produce food<br />\n<br />\nIn reality the rupee is overvalued and needs to be at around 69 rupees to the dollar to be at its true value. The over-valuation, it goes without saying, hurts India\u2019s exports<br />\n<br />\nA country is said to have a trade surplus if its exports exceed its imports, and a trade deficit if its imports exceed its exports.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_9BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/05/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load.html?showComment=1525779293653#c5680285346537234240\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">May 8, 2018 at 5:04 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_8MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1--<br />\n<br />\nThe current account deficit is a measurement of a country\u2019s trade where the value of the goods and services it imports exceeds the value of the goods and services it exports<br />\n<br />\nWhile China\u2019s overall current account surplus is 1.4% of GDP, Japan\u2019s is 3.8 %, Germany\u2019s a whopping 7.9 % and India on the other hand has a deficit of 1.4%<br />\n<br />\nGerman current account SURPUS \u2014 which measures the flow of goods, services and investments is the world\u2019s largest at $290 billion, followed by Japan with $206 billion.<br />\n<br />\nOn the other hand India's Current Account recorded a DEFICIT of 13.7 Billion USD<br />\n<br />\nCAD ( Current Account Deficit ) is basically the difference between the import and the export in a country. India being a primarily import driven economy has a high historical CAD.<br />\n<br />\nCurrency manipulation\u2013the effort to keep exports cheap by intervening in the foreign exchange market..<br />\n<br />\nUsually, when a country raises its interest rates, the value of its currency rises, making its exports more expensive and less competitive. This boosts the internal economy towards export and internal usage of own goods.<br />\n<br />\nHere's the criteria a country has to meet to be named a currency manipulator by USA: --<br />\n---Have a significant trade surplus with the US<br />\n---Have a \"material\" current account surplus with the US<br />\n---Be engaged in \"persistent, one-sided\" intervention in the foreign exchange market<br />\n<br />\nThe US lists three criterion for judging whether it needs to take action against its partners\u2014a bilateral trade surplus of at least $20 billion ( meaning the value of goods it exports to the U.S. exceeds the value of its American imports by that much), an overall current account surplus of at least 3% of GDP ( a measurement of goods, services and investments that go in and out of a country), and net purchases of foreign currency amounting to at least 2% of GDP over a 12-month period.<br />\n<br />\nCountries opt for devaluation only to save the economy from external factors and boost export. China is a very recent example of deliberate devaluation of its currency.<br />\n<br />\nThis not only boosts export but also reduces trade deficit and lowers the interest burden on outstanding government debts. China is an export-driven economy and in order to sustain, the Chinese government has been constantly devaluing its currency.<br />\n<br />\nINDIAs GDP IS FAR HIGHER THAN WHAT IS PROJECTED BY IMF\u2014 AS WE DO NOT FACTOR IN COTTAGE AND FAMILY BASES INDUSTRIES INTO OUR GDP<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/06/gpi-dog-shall-wag-gdp-tail-not-vice.html</span><br />\n<br />\nIndia, however, has enough dollar reserves to be able to devalue the rupee.<br />\n<br />\nThe pace of foreign exchange accumulation is the strongest since 2015 and it stands at 426 billion USD.... India\u2019s foreign reserves have risen from around 268 billion USD in September 2013<br />\n<br />\nWe need money to buy nuclear submarines and anti-missile systems<br />\nInterest rate arbitrage opportunity \u2013is where people earning in dollars would like to invest in India to earn 6-8 per cent on investment and then take the earnings back to the US where the returns are significantly lower.<br />\n<br />\nIn order to overcome this arbitrage opportunity of interest rates, the rupee depreciates every year by about 6 per cent<br />\n<br />\nBALLS TO MANMOHAN SINGH\u2014INDIA IS THE ONLY ROARING ECONOMY ON THIS PLANET..<br />\n<br />\nWILL OUR PEA BRAINED POTHOLE JOURNALIST FAYE DSOUZA DISCUSS ECONOMICS NOW ?<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_9b+seedn9ND\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_9b+seedn9ND\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8074212186205300597\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_7M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. text-decoration-line: none;\">May 10, 2018 at 1:48 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_7MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/economy/indicators/india-fastest-growing-economy-at-7-4-per-cent-in-2018-imf/articleshow/64089078.cms<br />\n<br />\nBALLS !<br />\n<br />\nINDIA IS THE THIRD LARGEST ECONOMY ON THIS PLANET...<br />\n<br />\nINDIA IS GROWING AT 10.2% TODAY...<br />\n<br />\nINDIA IS A 5 TRILLION USD ECONOMY...<br />\n<br />\nWE DONT CARE FOR ROTHSCHILDs RATING AGENCIES TO MEASURE OUR DICK ..WE CAN DO IT OURSELVES..<br />\n<br />\nIndia is the world's THIRD largest economy by nominal GDP and the third-largest by purchasing power parity (PPP)..<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/06/gpi-dog-shall-wag-gdp-tail-not-vice.html<br />\n<br />\nCOUNTRY / GDP NOMINAL / BILLION USD / RANK<br />\n#########################<br />\nUnited States / 18,100 / 1<br />\nChina / 13, 200 / 2<br />\nIndia / 4200 / 3<br />\nJapan / 4,100 / 4<br />\nGermany / 3900 / 5<br />\nUnited Kingdom / 2700 / 6<br />\nFrance / 2600 / 7<br />\n<br />\nCOUNTRY / GDP -PPP / BILLION USD / RANK<br />\n#############################################<br />\n<br />\nChina / 25,200 / 1<br />\nUSA / 19,400 / 2<br />\nIndia / 12,200 / 3<br />\nJapan / 5,400 / 4<br />\nGermany / 4,300 / 5<br />\nRussia / 4,200 / 6<br />\nBrazil / 3,300 / 7<br />\n<br />\n#################################<br />\n<br />\nGDP (Gross Domestic Product) is the total market value of all final goods and services produced in a country in a given year. In Nominal method, market exchange rates are used for conversion.<br />\n<br />\nTo make meaningful comparison, PPP is used to compare economies and incomes of people by adjusting for differences in prices in different countries..To make a comparison of prices across countries that holds any type of meaning, a wide range of goods and services must be considered. Purchasing power is determined in each country based on its relative cost of living and inflation rates. Purchasing power plus parity equalizes the purchasing power of two differing currencies by accounting for differences in inflation rates and cost of living.<br />\n<br />\nROTHSCHILDs KOSHER RATING AGENCIES CAN FUCK THEMSELVES ..<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; max-width: 36px; padding: 5px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4784467750813694293\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_105M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/05/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_14.html?showComment=1526366045494#c4784467750813694293\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">May 15, 2018 at 12:04 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_105MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br />\nStrange as it might seem, the dollar is backed by nothing today \u2013 but just a belief that it can endure\u2014rooted in AMERICAN EXCEPTIONALISM.<br />\n<br />\nUSA is 21.1 trillion USD in debt.<br />\n<br />\nGiven the debt profile of the United States and the large US Government bonds held by China, China can easily destabilise the US dollar.</div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"font-size: medium;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">USA is threatening India with economic snctions if India buys Iranian crude oil or Russian arms.</span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\"></span><br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\">\n</span>\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\">Donald THE Trump\u2014 don\u2019t mess with India . India has the clout to take other nations along and kick out the US Dollar. The US dollar will crash instantaneously. The U.S. currency is fundamentally weak</span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\">\n</span>\nA dollar collapse is when the value of the U.S. dollar plummets. The collapse of the dollar means that everyone is trying to sell their dollar-denominated assets, and no one wants to buy them.<br />\n<br />\nThis will drive the value of the dollar down.. It makes hyperinflation look like a day in the park.<br />\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: medium;\">A sudden dollar collapse would create global economic turmoil. Investors would rush to other currencies, such as the euro, or other assets, such as gold and commodities. Demand for Treasurys would plummet, and interest rates would rise. U.S. import prices would skyrocket, causing inflation.</span></div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: medium;\"></span><br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: medium;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: medium;\">\n</span>\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: medium;\">U.S. exports would be dirt cheap, given the economy a brief boost. In the long run, inflation, high interest rates, and volatility would strangle possible business growth. Unemployment would worsen, sending the United States back into recession or even a depression.</span></div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: medium;\">\n</span>\nThe US debt-to-GDP ratio is now more than 118 % ( the declared 105% is a white lie ). That increases the chance the United States will let the dollar's value slide. That's because it would be easier to repay its debt with cheaper money.<br />\n<br />\nThere must be a viable currency alternative for everyone to buy. The dollar's strength is based on its use as the world's reserve currency. The dollar became the reserve currency in 1973 when President Nixon abandoned the gold standard.<br />\n<br />\nAs a global currency, the dollar is used for 45 % of all cross-border transactions. That means central banks must hold the dollar in their reserves to pay for these transactions. As a result, 62 % of these foreign currency reserves are in dollars.<br />\n<br />\nS&amp;P CUT US RATINGS 7 YEARS AGO--BUT MOODYs AND FiTCH STILL GIVE USA PRISTINE RATING\u2014which is bullshit.<br />\n<br />\nThe next most popular currency after the dollar is the euro. But it comprises less than 28 % of central bank reserves. The eurozone debt crisis weakened the euro as a viable global currency.<br />\n<br />\nAll EU nations are beggar nations.<br />\n<br />\nChina will be alarmed at the dollar's drop in value. That's because it is the largest foreign holder of U.S. Treasurys, and hence its investment will deteriorate. China owns 1.1 trillion USD in U.S. Treasurys.<br />\n<br />\nDONALD THE TRUMP\u2014FUCK AROUND WITH INDIA AT YOUR OWN PERIL..<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..<br />\n<br />\nPUT ABOVE COMMENT IN WEBSITES OF--<br />\nPIYUSH GOEL<br />\nFINANCE MINISTRY<br />\nURJIT PATEL<br />\nPMO<br />\nPM MODI</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; max-width: 36px; padding: 5px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c7557366269159207663\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_72M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. In Nominal method, market exchange rates are used for conversion.<br />\n<br />\nTo make meaningful comparison, PPP is used to compare economies and incomes of people by adjusting for differences in prices in different countries..To make a comparison of prices across countries that holds any type of meaning, a wide range of goods and services must be considered. Purchasing power is determined in each country based on its relative cost of living and inflation rates. He wrote the Essai sur la Nature du Commerce en G\u00e9n\u00e9ral (Essay on the Nature of Trade in General<br />\n<br />\nAdam Smith copied from Cantillon's Essai .Adam Smith lifted Cantillon\u2019s sustenance theory of wages\u2014whole sale. Adam Smith not only contributed nothing of value to economic thought..<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/06/gpi-dog-shall-wag-gdp-tail-not-vice.html<br />\n<br />\nAmartya Sen with a Rothschild wife does not understand economics..<br />\n<br />\nHis wife Emma R0thschild white washed the vile theories of hedonist Rothschild agent, Adam Smith vide her book ECONOMIC SENTIMENTS.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"c3570186697232162647-rt\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\">\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"c3570186697232162647-ra\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c8612744504865380568\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/11/open-letter-to-romila-thapar-from-capt.html?showComment=1542343429979#c8612744504865380568\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">November 16, 2018 at 10:13 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1--<br />\n<br />\nAdam Smith also identified the principles of supply and demand. Every idiot knew this too. The idiots knew further\u2014that after eating 2 tasty biriyanis, his HUMAN PSYCHE does not allow him to eat a third one, without allowing a TIME FACTOR in between.<br />\n<br />\nThis is where and when Adam Smith should have been discarded into the garbage bin.<br />\n<br />\nBottom of the barrel modern economists rarely have mathematical brains. It is NO wonder that their unreal and daft mathematical equations failed.<br />\n<br />\nIn 2008 we had a great humpty dumpty fall . How many of these \u201cbaffle with bullshit\u201d modern economists saw it coming?<br />\n<br />\nMediocre economic students are arm twisted into studying a ridiculous abstract model saturated with overly mathematical theories of economics. They do NOT understand that this model must apply to the psychology of mankind. Even ecology should have been factored in.<br />\n<br />\nCan what is good for \u201cunlimited potential\u201d India be the same as what is good for Saudi Arabia? Can a stork sip water from a flat plate or a fox from a narrow necked jar?.<br />\n<br />\nNone of these economic students had the grey matter to ask , if economics can indeed be blindly interpreted in an unreal abstract manner ( like Picasso\u2019s nonsense ) through numbers and equations without any background in the real social sciences or any consideration of the \u2018human subject\u2019 central to it all.<br />\n<br />\nModern Economics is an empirical pseudo-science which exists solely to support and propagate a social order in which the top few have mind boggling wealth, the rest of the masses exist in poverty, and corporations enjoy unfettered power. This new social order is called neoliberalism.<br />\n<br />\nWhen an economist cannot understand what is happening and is asked simple questions on TV he will start using complicated words ( baffle with bullshit method ) like \u201cdynamic stochastic general equilibrium\u201d, to show that he knows more than the public.<br />\n<br />\nToday\u2019s so called economists are the modern equivalent of medieval churchmen in robes trying to confound and baffle the world by shoving in high school calculus in between the Bible verses.<br />\n<br />\nGDP is an empty abstraction devoid of any link to the real world, and, therefore, has little or no value in economic analysis.<br />\n<br />\nGDP = private consumption + gross investment + government spending + (exports \u2212 imports), or<br />\nGDP = C + I + G + ( X - M )<br />\n<br />\nAbove is bullshit of the highest order , dressed up in fancy mathematics to look like science.<br />\n<br />\nThey add up all the transactions in the economy, whether they represent benefits or costs, call the total the Gross Domestic Product and refer to it as \u201cthe economy\u201d.<br />\n<br />\nThe GDP framework cannot tell us whether final goods and services that were produced during a particular period of time are a reflection of real wealth expansion, or a reflection of capital consumption.<br />\n<br />\nNo economist has the guts to say that the Emperor is NOT wearing clothes, it just shows the quality of their moral fibre.<br />\n<br />\nIt is difficult to wake up an economist who is pretending to sleep. He has to be kicked awake on a spot where it hurts real bad.<br />\n<br />\nWE DONT WANT KENYAN GUJARATI URJIT PATEL TO SAVE INDIA.. HE MUST WORK FOR THE WANT, NOT HIS MASTER JEW ROTHSCHILD..<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;\">\n<br style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; max-width: 36px; padding: 5px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">97 Para-Brahma\nUpanishad<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">98\nParamahamsa-Parivrajaka Upanishad<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">99 Pasupata Brahmana\nUpanishad<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">106 Surya Upanishad<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
