, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">108 Tripura-Tapini\nUpanishad<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">arthashrayatvam\nshabdasya<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">drashtur lingatvam eva\nca<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">tan-matratvam ca\nnabhaso<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">lakshanam kavayo viduh<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Srimad Bhagavatam\n(3.26.33)\u20145000 BC</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Persons who are\nlearned and who have true knowledge define sound as that which conveys the idea\nof an object, indicates the presence of a speaker and constitutes the subtle\nform of ether.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shepherds verses indeed\n!<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<img height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-xSg71sFcswg/U15UjnwEnDI/AAAAAAAAruM/93CCPGdJMK0/s400/whiteheadvi69edanta.jpg\" width=\"396\" /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The immoral white\ninvader , after injecting our ancient scriptures in poison, gave the relevant\ninformation to some of their sponsored heroes , like BR Ambedkar ( who wrote\nriddles in Hinduism ) who did NOT know Sanskrit and would take more 10 life\ntimes to master the 4 Vedas and 108 Upanishads..&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cOm ityetadaksharam\nidam sarvam, tasyopavyakhyanam bhutam bhavat bhavishyaditi sarvam omkara\neva.\u201d-&nbsp; <b>Mandukya&nbsp; Upanishad -5000 BC</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe Imperishable is\nOM, and it is 'all this'.&nbsp;&nbsp; All this,\nwhatever is visible, whatever is cognisable, whatever can come within the\npurview of sense-perception, inference or verbal testimony, whatever can be\ncomprehended under the single term, creation all this is OM.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A cosmic creative\nvibration (called sphota or explosion) arises between Shiva and Shakti called\nNada. This Nada then gets consolidated into Shabda Brahman (differentiated\nsound energy), the universal cosmic resonance, symbolized by OM.&nbsp;&nbsp; From this arises cosmic intelligence that is\nresponsible for the creation.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Taithiriya\nUpanishad says that \"with OM, Brahma begins creation.\"&nbsp;&nbsp; It means the whole creation comes out of\nsound.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The cosmos is vibrant\nwith a mystic melody comprising planetary chimes as well as the plaintive song\nof atoms, unknown to us and unheard by us.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And unheard by us is\neven the strident crescendo of the universal orchestration in which galaxies,\nstars and planets whirl around perpetually in spirals, cycles, whorls and\nvortices causing incessant resonance,&nbsp;\nwas&nbsp; the incessant boom of the\ndamaru of Lord Shiva during his frenzied tandav or cosmic dance.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This unheard, dynamic\nvibrato is recognized in the Vedas as the sound-vehicle of the power of Brahman\npermeating the cosmos as the forces of creation and destruction.&nbsp; It is called the Shabda Brahman, that is the\nUltimate Reality in its aspect of sound.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, the unheard\ncosmic sounds, the symphony of Shabda-Brahman, was heard by the 12 stranded\nVedic Maharishis in their spiritual trances and is enshrined in the Upanishads\nas the syllable.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM is the quintessence,\nthe seed-syllable of the universe.&nbsp;\nMantra is the sound-body of consciousness.&nbsp;&nbsp; Our 7000 year old Vedas say that matter is\ncreated from vibrations.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<img height=\"304\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/--liwn2Dlv_c/U15jM8YgaiI/AAAAAAAArvc/UtP_UtTpRRM/s640/Quote01Fibvcsnal.gif\" width=\"640\" /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Yoga Shiksha\nUpanishad says: \u201cThat indestructible transcendent vibrating sound is\nShabda-Brahman.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nada yoga&nbsp; is an ancient Indian metaphysical system\nwhich is based on the premise that the entire cosmos and all that exists in the\ncosmos, including human beings, consists of sound vibrations, called nada.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This concept holds that\nit is the sound energy in motion rather than of matter and particles which form\nthe building blocks of the cosmos.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The longitudinal sound\nwave or scalar wave creates.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<img height=\"484\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-_DS1x-Zmylg/U16lO9Y6CSI/AAAAAAAArv0/c0E6ZcgmaN4/s640/Ondes_compression_2d_20_petit.gif\" width=\"640\" /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Matter is created by\nvibrations.&nbsp; On a macro scale everything\nis longitudinal sound.&nbsp;&nbsp; On a micro scale\nevery disease is musical disharmony.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Primal sound is&nbsp; referred to as Shabda Brahman - \"God as\nword\".&nbsp; Closely related to this is\nthe concept of Nada Brahman - \"God as sound\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just in case you wonder\nwhat is SHABDA and what is NADA \u2013 the former is masculine connoting artha (\nmeaning ) while the latter is feminine signifying the voiced sound .</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Music is Nada.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fundamental\nstructure of the universe is based on Nada or sound vibrations.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A mantra in its purest\nform , the inner power , is a manifestation of Nada.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The movement of prana (\nenergy )&nbsp; in the body is an expression of\nNada.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nada is the celestial\nmusic within us. The word Nada is derived from the Sanskrit root nad, meaning\n\u201cunion through sound.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<img height=\"484\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-lGMuvmltT3w/U16lYchen-I/AAAAAAAArv8/fwOOG-HFbhE/s640/Onde_compression_impulsion_1d_30_petit.gif\" width=\"640\" /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, Nada refers to\nthe vibrations which make up the sound.&nbsp;\nShabda refers to a discreet sound, separate from the meaning it conveys.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Nada Yogi&nbsp; sees the whole macrocosmic and microcosmic\nworld as made up of sound. The Nada Yogi experiences the macrocosmic universe\nas a projection of sound vibrations; the whole world as having developed from\nsound alone.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nada means not only\nsound, but energy, flow and pitch.&nbsp; Thus\nNada Yoga,&nbsp; in a deeper sense is the\nscience of vibration.&nbsp; Quantum physics\nagrees with our 7000 year old Vedas that vibration (sound) is the essence of\nall forms in the creation.&nbsp; Sound\nvibration brings into being the visual world of forms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pandit Omkarnath\nThakur, was a Nada yogi , a super sound engineer , a great Indian\nclassical&nbsp; musician .&nbsp; In 1933, while on a European tour , Adolf\nHitler directed him to Benito Mussolini, who was unable to sleep for many days\ndue to stress.&nbsp; Thakur performed the Raga\nPuriya , a hexatonic raga and put Mussolini to deep REM sleep within a few\nminutes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A nada yogi\nbelieves that the micro and macro world is nothing but a projection of sound\nalone.&nbsp; This music is from the RIGHT\nbrain lobe ( sub-conscious ) for a right hander.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indian classical music\nis nada yoga, where the music is rendered absolutely scientific and classical\nin order to experience the nada.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The development of\nIndian classical musical systems in the past was done strictly in accordance\nwith the views of nada yoga sadhanas.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Below: The fundamental\ntheory of Indian classical music, art and poetry is grounded in the theory of\nNada Brahman or Shabda Brahman, and is linked with the Sanatana Dharma.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-c_xMU_UYLck/U181E_reh9I/AAAAAAAArxE/3Tg_S4hmmCE/s1600/melakartha-chart1.png\" /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 7000 year old Sama\nVeda is always sung with a scientific exactness and in accordance with nada\nyoga sadhana.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Do6do9DjaQQ/U181XI-038I/AAAAAAAArxM/AyXo4rYt2p0/s1600/ChromaticScale11.jpg\" /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like I said before,\nwhen a damaru is beaten, it produces dissimilar sounds which are fused together\nby resonance to create one sound.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nAccording to our Vedas , Nada is the source of creation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the ancient wisdom\nof the Sanatana Dharma, the medium of creation is conscious sound\nvibration.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"By His utterance\ncame the universe.\" (Brihadaranyaka Upanishad 1.2.4) 5000 BC.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now Nada also contains\nsounds beyond the human audible range. But these sounds were perceptible to a\n12 strand DNA maharishi.&nbsp; Nada is the\nsound that exists in all Kundalini Chakras.&nbsp;\nIn the heart it exists as Anahata (unstruck sound).&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shabda and Nada\nmanifested in the cosmic energy of sound give rise to the energies of heat,\nlight and other basic streams of energy&nbsp;\nexisting in the universe.&nbsp; The\nNada (cosmic vibration) of the Shabda (eternal sound) is the originator of\neverything that exists in nature. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a damaru is\nvibrated, it produces dissimilar sounds which are fused together by resonance\nto create one single sound&nbsp; .&nbsp; When the Damaru is twisted in one revolution,\nit often makes the sounds of three successive tones.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Panini formulated the\nrules of Sanskrit morphology, syntax and semantics in fourteen verses, from\nthe&nbsp; sounds of Lord Shiva's Damaru,\ncalled Maheshwara Sutrani.&nbsp; These Sutras\nare also known as A\u1e63\u1e6dadhyayi, meaning eight chapters, the foundational text of\nthe grammatical branch of the Vedanga.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<img height=\"241\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-2GFTAU4CUFE/U184LNdJhNI/AAAAAAAArx8/s5b1bcrhLoE/s400/gsl.gif\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\" width=\"400\" /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The knowledge of Shabda BrahmAn - Nada BrahmAn is thus the most\nimportant branch of the Indian school of spirituality. .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Beeja mantras are\none-syllable seed sounds that, when said aloud, activate the energy of the\nchakras in order to purify and balance the mind and body. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you utter beeja\nmantras, you resonate with the energy of the associated chakra.-- as mentioned\nin the&nbsp; Jabala Darsana Upanishad in 5000\nBC. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ham, Yam, Ram, Vam and\nLam are the panch bhoota mantras.&nbsp;&nbsp; The\nfive elements evolve from the five tanamatras (principals); earth from gandha\n(smell), water from rasa (taste), fire from rupa (sight), air from sparsha\n(touch) and akasha from shabda (hearing).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every Beej mantra\ncreates a huMMMMMMMM, which produces the magic molecule Nitric Oxide. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitric oxide is a gas\nthat affects blood vessels.&nbsp; It is a\nsimple molecule, having two atoms - nitrogen and oxygen.&nbsp; But it does an incredible array of\nthings.&nbsp; Our blood vessels make nitric\noxide. It's a potent and facile dilator. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the human body\nreaches the age of 27 years, the secretion of nitric oxide is at its peak. As\nyou get&nbsp; older and the production of\nnitric oxide in the human body declines gradually, more from age 42 onwards. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitric oxide controls\nblood flow in our body.&nbsp; It controls our\nvascular resistance , the blood pressure . When your body produces sufficient\namounts of Nitric oxide, then your blood vessels are relaxed, and your blood\npressure is low.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conversely if you're\nnot making enough or Nitric Oxide production is inactivated,&nbsp; then&nbsp;\nyour blood vessels become contracted and your blood pressure shoots up.&nbsp; So this is an important feature of the blood\nvessels is its&nbsp; ability to control its\nown diameter automatically. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitric oxide is part of\nthe body's self-defense mechanism.It can defend against bacteria.&nbsp; It also defends against tumor cells.&nbsp; Nitric Oxide in higher concentrations can\nactually halt the growth of cells or can halt bacterial growth, so it's a\ndefense against infection. Macrophages, certain cells of the immune system,\nproduce Nitric oxide in order to kill invading bacteria.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a defense against\ntumor and cancer. It is a defense against hardening of the arteries too.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Nitric oxide - is our self-defense system\nagainst athrosclerosis.&nbsp; The endothelial\nlining of the blood vessel is like Teflon.&nbsp;\nIt keeps things from sticking to the vessel wall.&nbsp; The reason it has this property of Teflon is\nbecause it releases nitric oxide, so it's a non-sticky surface because it's\nreleasing nitric oxide, which not only relaxes the blood vessel but also\nprevents things from sticking to the vessel.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitric oxide also\nserves as a neurotransmitter between nerve cells, part of its general role in\nredox signaling. Unlike most other neurotransmitters that only transmit\ninformation from a presynaptic to a postsynaptic neuron, the small, uncharged,\nand fat-soluble nitric oxide molecule can diffuse widely and readily enters\ncells.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitric oxide is an\nimportant neurotransmitter in various parts of the gastrointestinal tract. It\ncauses relaxation of the gastrointestinal smooth muscle. In the stomach it\nincreases the capacity of the fundus to store food and fluids.&nbsp; Nitric oxide acts on cardiac muscle to\ndecrease contractility and heart rate. Nitric oxide contributes to the\nregulation of cardiac contractility.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dissonant sounds create\ndisharmony -- rifts between the individual and her environment, as well as\nwithin the body's own frequencies.&nbsp; If 10\ntuning forks tuned to the same frequency are lined up together and one is struck,\nthey will all begin to reverberate together.&nbsp;\nThis is resonance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, if you strike\na tuning fork of a different frequency and place it near the others, they will\nall stop. This is dissonance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kolam is an Indian art\nform of drawing designs with rice flour.&nbsp;\nKolam is seen adorning the doorsteps of every traditional Hindu home in\nsouthern India.&nbsp; They are drawn&nbsp; around a grid of 108 dots , which serve as\nthe skeletal structure for the kolam. .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lines are drawn,\nconnecting the dots or around them, very often in a single, continuous\ncurve.&nbsp; Kolam is a visible sound\nmantra--outside the human audio range<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By adopting digital\nSanskrit as a computer language it is possible to create conscious computers\nwhich can laugh at a genuine joke, or tell the moral of a story like \u201c haste is\nwaste\u201d.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is the only\nunambiguous computer language suitable for N-GRAM NLP and AskMSR.&nbsp;&nbsp; My son had written a critique&nbsp; while at Cornell for his ME, for which he\nsecured full marks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AskMSR program uses\ninformation on web pages to respond to questions to which the answer is a\nsingle word or phrase \u2013 What is the height of Christiano Ronaldo?&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You have SIRI in Ipad now.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">n-gram models are used\nin statistical natural language processing, in speech recognition, handwriting\nrecognition , information retrieval, optical character recognition&nbsp; etc.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nn-grams find use in several areas of computer science, computational\nlinguistics, and applied mathematics.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Astadhyayi, presented\nthe processes of phonology, morphology and syntax, and laid down the basis for\ncenturies of commentaries and expositions by Sanskrit grammarians who followed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Panini's approach was\namazingly formal; his production rules for deriving complex structures and\nsentences represent resemble those of modern computer languages.&nbsp; Many of the developments in Indian\nMathematics, especially the place value notation system may have originated\nfrom Paninian analysis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Panini's grammar\nconsists of four parts:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u015aivas\u016btra: phonology\n(notations for phonemes specified in 14 lines)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A\u1e63\u1e6dadhy\u0101y\u012b: morphology\n(construction rules for complexes)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dh\u0101tup\u0101\u1e6dha: list of\nroots (classes of verbal roots)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ga\u1e47ap\u0101\u1e6dha: lists\nclasses of primitive nominal stems<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Shiva Sutras,\nPanini discusses something like the concepts of the phoneme, the morpheme and\nthe root.&nbsp; The Shiva Sutras describe a\nphonemic notational system in the opening part of the Astadhyayi.&nbsp;&nbsp; The notational system introduces different\nclusters of phonemes that serve special roles in the morphology of Sanskrit,\nand are referred to throughout the text.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Upanayana ceremony,\nor Vedic initiation of boys, is known as Brahmopadesa,&nbsp; or the teaching of BrahmAn.&nbsp;&nbsp; The Gayathri mantra is the mantra selected\nfor Brahmopadesa. The boy's father becomes his GURU and whispers into his ears\nthis powerful Gayatri mantra. The Sacred Thread Ceremony signifies a young\nbrahmin boy's formal entrance into the first stage of life as a student\u2014a\nritual telling him that he is now come to age ( to learn the holy Vedas..)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In terms of the\nuniversal cosmology, vaikhari, madhyama and pashyanti correspond respectively\nto bhuh, bhuvah, and svah.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gayathri Mantra is in\nconsonance with the spirit of the Vedas.&nbsp;\nThis Mantra originates in the 7000 year olf Rig&nbsp; Veda (III-62.10)&nbsp; and is referred to with great reverence in\nthe Upanishads and many other works.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rigveda stated 7000\nyear ago that speech process has four stages. These four stages are Para,\nPasyanti, Madhyama and Vaikhari.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shabda brahmAn\nmanifests through his power of maya first as para vani in the mooladhara chakra\nat the perineum, then as pashyanti in the manipura chakra at the navel, next as\nmadhyama in the heart and then eventually as vaikhari in the throat and mouth.\nThis is the divine descent of voice.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first three are\ninternal and yogic and can be experienced only by seers. The fourth stage is\nVaikhari is the audible speech, which is used by all human beings. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The general perception\nof a layman is that when we speak, sound comes from the throat.&nbsp; But what happens is when we have the urge or\nthe thought to speak, our life force in the form of vaayu, starts from the root\nchakra and brings Paraa, the subtle sound, then travels up to the navel, heart\nchakras as Pasyanti and Madhyamaa respectively, then comes to the throat,\nmouth, teeth and tongue as Vaikhari to come out as speech or sound at the gross\nlevel.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These four levels of\nsound correspond to four states of consciousness. Paraa represents the\ntranscendental consciousness. Pasyanti represents the intellectual\nconsciousness. Madhyamaa represents the mental consciousness. And Vaikhari\nrepresents the physical consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These states of\nconsciousness correspond with the four states known technically as Jagrat,\nSvapna, Sushupti, and Turiya - or the wakeful state, the dreaming state, the\ndreamless state, and the transcendental state.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These four stages also\ncorrespond to the four types of bodies. The Sthula sharira, ( physical body)\noperates in the state of Jagrat (wakeful state).&nbsp; It is in this realm of consciousness, and\nthrough this body, that the Vaikhari-vaak is manifested. The Sukshma-sharira, (\nsubtle or psychic body ) operates in the state of Svapna.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is in this realm of\nconsciousness, and through this body, that the Madhyama-vaak is\nmanifested.&nbsp; The Kaarana-sharira, (\ncausal body ) , operates in the state of Sushupti ( deep sleep ).&nbsp; It is in this realm of consciousness, and\nthrough this body, that the Pashyanti-vaak is manifested. The Para-vaak is\nmanifested through the fourth state of consciousness, known as Turiya.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1V9YUW1VlyQ/U1_U4d4BwYI/AAAAAAAAryk/iU1M5EmGq_w/s1600/Vedic_sound_table-cdage.png\" /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHAT IS PARA ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Para represents transcendental\nconsciousness. Para is a soundless seed,&nbsp;&nbsp;\npure adya shakti from kundalini, beyond name and forms.&nbsp; . Para is Adya Shakti.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Taitreeya\nUpanishad, Aakaasa evolved first.&nbsp; From\nAakaasa evolved Vaayu, from Vayu evolved Agni, from Agni evolved Jala and from\nJala evolved Prithvi.&nbsp; So Aakaasa is\ncalled Param, as it was the first one to form among the five basic elements.\nIts attribute Sabda is called Paraa.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the time of\ncreation, this Paraa expressed itself as Bindu or a subtle particle. It is also\ncalled as Kaarana bindu, the cause for all sound manifestations within and\noutside our body. Paraa means the highest or the farthest.&nbsp;&nbsp; Para vaak is the sound beyond the perception\nof our senses. Paraa is the first stage of sound in its unmanifest stage and is\nthe source of all root ideas and germ thoughts.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the stage of\nPara-vaak there is no distinction between the object and the sound. The sound\ncontains within it all the qualities of the object.&nbsp; Nada Yogis claim that Paraa Nada is a high\nfrequency sound, so high that it does not stir or produce any vibrations.&nbsp; By the urge of man to talk, with the help of\nvaayu or air, Paraa moves up to the Manipuraka chakra or the navel centre and\ngets transformed into Pasyanti. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Para means highest or\nfarthest, and in this connection it indicates that sound which is beyond the\nperception of the senses. Para-vak is also known as \"rava-shabda\" -\nan unvibratory condition of sound beyond the reach of mind and intelligence (avyakta),\nonly to be realized by great souls, the 12 strand maharishis, parama-jnanis. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the stage of\npara-vak there is no distinction between the object and the sound. The sound\ncontains within it all the qualities of the object. The highest manifestation\nof sound energy, the primal voice, the divine voice is para. The para voice\ngives birth to root ideas or germ thoughts. It is the first manifestation of\nvoice. In the para state the sound remains in an undifferentiated form.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Para is pure\nintention.&nbsp; Pure because it is a direct\nexpression of the will of reality, unadulterated by any personal\npreference.&nbsp; Para means transcendental,\n\u2018beyond\u2019 or \u2018the other side\u2019. It is beyond the reach of the indriyas, or sense\norgans, and the mind and other means of cognition. Hence para nada is the\ntranscendental sound. It is indicative of a truth that there is a sphere of\nsuper-consciousness where the sound is heard in different dimensions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sounds having a very\nhigh frequency are transformed into silence. Beyond a certain limit, the ears\ndo not have the capacity. No one can hear or understand a sound like that even\nif it is present. Para or transcendental sound has the highest vibration\nfrequency. This intense vibration faculty makes para inaudible. . When a sound\ngoes to its maximum pitch, it attains a sudden stillness, and that is para\nnada.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<img height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-_H5pjGnGtfo/U1_beAn4jNI/AAAAAAAAry8/wjcVjqYKX8c/s640/3TTT1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHAT IS PASYANTI ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pasyanti represents the\nintellectual consciousness, a state of abstract knowledge, like an idea which\nhas not yet been expressed in words.&nbsp;\nPashyanti is the thought form. Pasyanti literally means observing or\nseeing one's self. In the pasyanti stage sound possesses qualities such as\ncolor and form.&nbsp; When sound goes up to\nthe navel with the bodily air in vibratory form without any particular syllable\n(varna), yet connected with the mind, it is known as Pashyanti-vaak.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pasyanti observes and\nanalyses her impending changes in the heart, throat and the tongue, where the\nsound finally attains audibility. Within the Pasyanti-vaak exists the nature's\nIccha-shakti, or the power of will.&nbsp;\nPashyanti-vak is the second level of sound, and is less subtle than\npara-vak. Pashyanti in Sanskrit means \"that which can be seen or visualized\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-CaaBpXB2t2A/U2DLjLpak8I/AAAAAAAAr3E/AOtOvdwVPS4/s1600/1194254113_pavvshyanti.gif\" /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yogis who have inner\nvision can perceive these qualities in sound.&nbsp;\nOn this stage the differences between language do not exist, as this\nsound is intuitive and situated beyond rigidly defined concepts.&nbsp; On the stage of pashyanti-vak, speech is\nintuitively connected to the object. There is near oneness between the word and\nthe experience described.&nbsp; Pashyanti-vak\nis the finest impulse of speech. The seat of pashyanti is in the navel or the\nManipura Chakra. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When sound goes up to\nthe naval with the bodily air in vibratory form without any particular syllable\n(varna), yet connected with the mind, it is pashyanti-vak. Within the\npashyanti-vak exists the nature's iccha-shakti, or the power of will.&nbsp; Yogis who have subtle inner vision can\nexperience the pashyanti state of sound.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Pashyanti does not distinguish between subject\nand object. Perceptible but not yet particularized, it covers the middle ground\nbetween para\u2019s pure intention and madhyama\u2019s verbalized but as yet unspoken\nmental speech. The second stage of sound, which has less frequency and is more\ngross than para, is pashyanti.&nbsp; It is a\nsound which cannot be heard, but it can be seen. This is why Pashyanti in\nSanskrit means \u2018that which can be seen or visualized\u2019.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<img height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-agOXm3-lEJM/U2DQToT-VHI/AAAAAAAAr5I/DhOu4gy_RbA/s400/imagrryes.jpg\" width=\"347\" /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHAT IS MADHYAMA&nbsp; ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyamaa represents\nthe mental consciousness&nbsp; . Pasyanti, on\nreaching the Anaahata chakra or the heart chakra , transforms into Madhyama\nvaak.&nbsp; Madhyamaa literally means in\nbetween or middle.&nbsp; Here there is a clear\ndistinction between the sound and the object it denotes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyama vaak is more\nof a mental speech rather than the external audible speech.&nbsp; Within the Madhyama-vaak exists the nature's\nJnana-shakti, or the power of knowledge.&nbsp;\nMadhyama-vak is the intermediate unexpressed state of sound, whose seat\nis in the heart.. The middle sound is that sound which exists between the\nstates of susupti and jagrat.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyama is the\nintermediate unexpressed state of sound experienced in the heart. Madhyama is\nmental speech, verbalized but unspoken, the internal monologue and dialogue; it\nexpresses j\u00f1ana shakti, the power of knowledge and wisdom (or lack\nthereof).&nbsp; Madhyama measures, evaluates,\nquestions, harnessing your rational and emotional minds to formulate the\nintentions that precipitate into words.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyama is\nparticularized into phonemes, directed to mental objects, the objects of the\ninner senses. It straddles the gulf between the noiseless conviction that is\npashyanti and the spoken word that is vaikhari. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyama is sound\nhaving lower frequencies than para and pashyanti, but still subtler than the\naudible vaikhari form of sound.&nbsp; No\naudible effect is produced in it. Madhyama produces very minute vibrations in\nthe act of a whisper. In an ordinary sound, two objects strike against each\nother in order to produce sound.&nbsp; But in\nmadhyama no two things strike violently so as to produce audible sound.&nbsp; The word madhyama means a middle sound, a\nwhispering sound or the sound of a whisper.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHAT IS VAIKHARI ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vaikhari represents the\nphysical consciousness, an audible speech manifestation .. Vaikhari resides in\nthe throat chakra.&nbsp; Vaikhari is what we\nspeak through our mouth, which had started from Para.&nbsp; Para is subtle and Vaikhari is manifested\nform of Bhava/sound.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vaikhari is the&nbsp; sound which has come all the way from the\nroot chakra with the force of vaayu, travels further upwards to the throat,\nmouth, teeth and tongue, to become an articulate sound, audible to the external\near.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When sabda is spoken\nthrough the mouth with the help of syllables, that speech is Vaikhari vak.\nWithin the Vaikhari-vaak exists the nature's Kriya-shakti, or power of action.\nVaikhari-vak is the grossest level of speech, and it is heard through the\nexternal senses. When sound comes out through the mouth as spoken syllables it\nis called as vaikhari. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vaikhari the\narticulated speech, which, in a waveform, reaches the ears and to the intellect\nof the listener.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<img height=\"620\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-jgjGjUtRxUg/U1_owveAMgI/AAAAAAAArzM/aMCQcKl29RA/s640/179ttt1603.png\" width=\"640\" /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Audible vaikhari lies\nwithin the purview of the conscious mind and jagrat (waking-time\nconsciousness). The spoken sound vaikhari is produced by friction or by\nstriking two things against each other.&nbsp;\nIts frequencies of vibration are conducted within a certain limited\nrange. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">mulam adharam arabhya\ndvistkantam upeyusi<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">udita aneka sahasra\nsurya vahnindu sannibha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">cakravat punar adharat\nsanta pasyatha madhyama<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">vaikhari sthanam\nasadhya tatrasta sthanavartini<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">varnanam jananim bhutva\nbhogya prasnoumi gouriva<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Seated in the\narea starting from the muladhara to the position of dvistkanta with effulgence\nequal to the rising of millions of suns, fires and moons. Like a wheel from the\nadhara becoming the sounds known as santa, pashyati, madhyama.&nbsp; Reaching the position of vaikhari, there\nsituated in eight places, viz., the throat etc. Being the mother of all sounds\nI bestow enjoyments like a cow.\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<img height=\"266\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-yatqN3CgaDE/U2BcJIPbHJI/AAAAAAAArzc/Ju4PMNN8Glk/s400/imagesy4553.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Graphene is pure carbon\nin the form of a very thin, nearly transparent sheet, basically one atom thick\nand is used in military fighter jet applications. It is remarkably strong for\nits very low weight, and it conducts heat and electricity with great\nefficiency.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Graphene can self-repair\nholes in its sheets, when exposed to molecules containing carbon, such as\nhydrocarbons. Bombarded with pure carbon atoms, the atoms perfectly align into\nhexagons, completely filling the holes.&nbsp;\nIt has a beehive hexagon construction .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/GCUg4Kx_CjY/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/GCUg4Kx_CjY?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Taithiriya\nUpanishad says that \"with OM, Brahma begins creation.\"&nbsp; It means the whole creation comes out of\nsound.&nbsp;&nbsp; Every Hindu mantras have OM\nprefixed , for the quantum butterfly and tunneling &nbsp;effect.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hindus believe that\nshabda-sound is NOT just mere noise , but has has enormous power. Today modern\nscience has realized the power of a longitudinal wave and resonance.&nbsp; The maharishi with 12 strand DNA could\nconnect wiith the source of creation. The Vedas are thus NOT cowherd\u2019s verses\nto while away their time while grazing goats. OM is not the call of a man to\nsummon his wife..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/17tqXgvCN0E/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/17tqXgvCN0E?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vedas when chanted\nthe right way releases the wisdom they contain as real sacred energy that can\n\u201ccreate the spiritual states of mind and of life which the words describe\u201d ,\nand influence the course of human destiny and even the order of the Universe.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why were all these Stonehenges created.&nbsp;\nThe seers ( like Narada ) who wandered the land chanting the sacred\nmantras did so for maintaining the equilibrium of the world as well.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/ZQOxpwHk0fQ/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZQOxpwHk0fQ?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nSarvadarsana-samgraha teaches that this \u201ceternal word, called sphota (\nexplosion )\u201d is the cause of the cosmos, and is in truth identical with\nBrahmAn:&nbsp; \"OM is the symbol of\nsphota.&nbsp;&nbsp; It shines out in the meaning of\nall things, and it is the source of the whole world.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<img height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-lzfE7gNKBtQ/U2Bu6rVgAqI/AAAAAAAAr0k/HDj4CLBSZHI/s400/vaEEEk.gif\" width=\"374\" /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM ityed aksharam&nbsp; Sarvam OM karam eva<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This primordial word is\nthe AUM.&nbsp; It is every thing&nbsp; -&nbsp;\n<b>Mandukyopanishad- 5000 BC</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Below: &nbsp;Panini got up\nfrom a deep trance, wrote the Maheshwara Sutras and formed the Sanskrit\ngrammar.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/3B6-u8c7Xp8/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/3B6-u8c7Xp8?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Panini captured the\nsounds of the damaru and translated them into syllables.&nbsp; From these sounds emerged the 14 syllables\nwhich provided Panini with the basis for formulating the rules of Sanskrit\ngrammar.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. a i u \u1e47<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. \u1e5a\u1e37 k<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. e o \u1e45<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. ai au c<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5. ha ya va ra \u1e6d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6. la \u1e47<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7. \u00f1a ma \u1e45a \u1e47a na m<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">12. ka pa y<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These 14 verses are\nknown as \"Maheshwara Sutras\" or \"Maheshwara Sutrani\" (in\nSanskrit). These verses are just a collection of sounds and if you say them\naloud, in one breath, they really sound like drum beats.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<img height=\"293\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-41PDJUA2m6I/U2Brwl0JOcI/AAAAAAAAr0A/bO2jY7NA_qA/s400/imageffhs.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva, the Lord of\nDance,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">with a view to bless\nthe sages Sanaka and so on,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">played on His Damaru\nfourteen times,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">from which emerged the\nfollowing fourteen Sutras,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">popularly known as\nShiva Sutras or Maheshwara Sutras.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<img height=\"170\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-8jTtmwKWbZ8/U2BtRU4tZWI/AAAAAAAAr0M/IOk2A5PZD3E/s400/imadeeges.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">jAlam = web (of)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Does it sound like\nbulls#it of the first order?<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NOPE !<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a most\nintelligent rearrangement of the alphabet.&nbsp;\nThe letter at the end of each sutra is called an it.&nbsp; A letter followed by an it specifies all the\nletters in between.&nbsp; , serif;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Ashtadhyayi of\nPanini consists of&nbsp; 3990 sutras or\naphorisms.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/7Brv2FaOluU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/7Brv2FaOluU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
