The seven main ones are:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Gayatri: 3 padas of 8\nsyllables containing 24 syllables in each stanza.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Ushnuk : 4 padas of 7\nsyllables containing 28 syllables in each stanza.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Anustubh: 4 padas of 8\nsyllables containing 32 syllables in each stanza. This is the typical shloka of\nclassical Sanskrit poetry<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Brihati : 4 padas (8 +\n8 + 12 + 8) containing 36 syllables in each stanza.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Pankti : 4 padas\n(sometimes 5 padas) containing 40 syllables in each stanza.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Tristubh: 4 padas of 11\nsyllables containing 44 syllabes in each stanza</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Jagati: 4 padas of 12\nsyllables containing 48 syllables in each stanza</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mantra has got a\nBeeja or seed. The seed is a significant word, or series of words, which gives\na special power to the Mantra. The Beeja is the essence of the Mantra. This\nrepresents the sound string defined by the Seers as being the repository of\nauditory energy sources. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Beeja gives the\nmantra in which it is used, its special power of self-generation and effects.\nJust as within a seed is hidden within tree, so too, the energy of the mantra\nis resident in the seed on which it is based. This helps the mantra to manifest\nitself into spiritual consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; We call this Sound Frequency\nHealing.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For any healing to be\ncomplete, it needs to take place at all levels \u2013 the body, the mind and the\nspirit. The smallest particles known to man are vibrations.&nbsp; Thoughts are vibrations.&nbsp; Words are vibrations.&nbsp; Sounds are vibrations.&nbsp; Light is a vibration.&nbsp; Our planet is a vibration. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our entire universe and\neverything within it (seen and unseen) is a vibrating mass of atoms and\nsubatomic particles. If the hydrogen bonding angles of one molecule are\naltered, those in the other molecules might be expected to follow suit (as in a\ndomino effect).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a mantra is\nchanted , it vibrates the brain matter and connects new neural circuits. This\neffect comes after repeating the mantra for a long period of time and bringing\nin the resonance effect in the brain.&nbsp;\nFor this the seers developed various methods.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">How much a mantra is to\nbe chanted and how it is to be chanted etc.&nbsp;\nwere all given in the Mantra Shastra (Scripture of Mantras).&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n################################################################<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cholesteatoma is a\nserious condition and, when diagnosed, requires prompt treatment. Cholesteatoma\nis a type of skin cyst that is located in the middle ear and mastoid bone in\nthe skull.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It may be a birth defect, but it\u2019s most commonly\ncaused by repeated middle ear infections.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/p3Oy4lodZU4/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/p3Oy4lodZU4?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The cyst may become\ninfected or get bigger. This can cause the breakdown of some of the middle ear\nbones or other structures of the ear. This can affect hearing, balance, and\npossibly the function of the facial muscles.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/qgdqp-oPb1Q/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/qgdqp-oPb1Q?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cholesteatomas often\ndevelop as cysts or pouches that shed layers of old skin, which build up inside\nthe middle ear.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Over time, the\ncholesteatoma can increase in size and destroy the surrounding delicate bones\nof the middle ear .</span> <o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/WoffYaM5LSw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/WoffYaM5LSw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The dead skin cells\nthat accumulate in the ear provide an ideal environment for bacteria and fungus\nto thrive. This means the cyst can become infected, causing inflammation and\ncontinual ear drainage.</span> <br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dead\nskin cells are normally passed out of the ear, but if the eardrum collapses, it\nmay create a pocket where the dead skin cells can collect.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/BEmAUsCuafI/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/BEmAUsCuafI?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cholesteatomas very\noften continue to grow if they are not removed.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cholesteatomas\ndon\u2019t go away naturally.</span> &nbsp;&nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nonly way to treat a cholesteatoma is to have it surgically removed. The cyst\nmust be removed to prevent the complications that can occur if it grows larger.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-JQ7yptaDi1w/V1Z8oaVaEOI/AAAAAAABJuw/cKGPDGnoHJMWL6KUh3ebHedrV0szk-JHACLcB/s1600/anatomCBNMy-of-the-outer-ear-diagram-113.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"535\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-JQ7yptaDi1w/V1Z8oaVaEOI/AAAAAAABJuw/cKGPDGnoHJMWL6KUh3ebHedrV0szk-JHACLcB/s640/anatomCBNMy-of-the-outer-ear-diagram-113.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A cholesteatoma can\ndevelop if part of the eardrum collapses because of problems equalising the\npressure across it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The eustachian tube\nconveys air from the back of the nose into the middle ear to equalize ear\npressure (\u0093clear the ears\u0094). When the eustachian tubes work poorly, perhaps due\nto allergy, a cold, or sinusitis, the air in the middle ear is absorbed by the\nbody, creating a partial vacuum in the ear. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2ri7UK2K__k/V1Z8uIfxdzI/AAAAAAABJu4/8TSnyRvHd08u2L2yJ13rwRQG1e_7pRVFwCLcB/s1600/35WERT163.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"502\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2ri7UK2K__k/V1Z8uIfxdzI/AAAAAAABJu4/8TSnyRvHd08u2L2yJ13rwRQG1e_7pRVFwCLcB/s640/35WERT163.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The vacuum pressure\nsucks in a pouch or sac by stretching the eardrum, especially areas weakened by\nprevious infections. This can develop into a sac and become a cholesteatoma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-cfg1eGiyyoo/V1Z81kPnYDI/AAAAAAABJvA/GDV-AvOdFG8PudA_dWHvqA7i50OVzs5LwCLcB/s1600/CholesteatBoma-371x270.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"464\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-cfg1eGiyyoo/V1Z81kPnYDI/AAAAAAABJvA/GDV-AvOdFG8PudA_dWHvqA7i50OVzs5LwCLcB/s640/CholesteatBoma-371x270.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cholesteatomas actively\nerode bone because they contain enzymes which are activated by moisture.&nbsp;&nbsp; In time, cholesteatomas will eventually\nerode the bone leading into the inner ear. This can cause nerve loss and\ndeafness as well as severe imbalance and dizziness. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-jD9qIZCYfTY/V1Z8685FYSI/AAAAAAABJvI/oXJ58rc9-bEDR_4wIeP0cdyBsCJpQOo_QCLcB/s1600/maxresdefVBault.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"360\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-jD9qIZCYfTY/V1Z8685FYSI/AAAAAAABJvI/oXJ58rc9-bEDR_4wIeP0cdyBsCJpQOo_QCLcB/s640/maxresdefVBault.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The thin plate of bone\nthat separates the roof of the ear from the brain can also be eroded by\ncholesteatomas. This exposes the covering of the brain. In extreme situations,\nit can lead to brain infection and other severe complications.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/1HH_v6F-gZU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/1HH_v6F-gZU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-vHl6APRi_ko/V1bxdvA8-yI/AAAAAAABJvc/sk6dv7rVUVQKcM6sY-blk7tjUJgncVdmQCLcB/s1600/hearinnnmg-aids.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"416\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-vHl6APRi_ko/V1bxdvA8-yI/AAAAAAABJvc/sk6dv7rVUVQKcM6sY-blk7tjUJgncVdmQCLcB/s640/hearinnnmg-aids.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Symptoms of\ncholesteatoma:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Dizziness<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Drainage from the ear<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Hearing loss in one ear<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Pressure in the ear<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Earache<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Numbness of the ear<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>A sensation of spinning<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Muscle weakness in the\nface on the affected side</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Possible Complications:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Brain abscess<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Deafness in one ear<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Dizziness (vertigo)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Erosion into the facial\nnerve (causing facial paralysis)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Labyrinthitis<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Meningitis<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Persistent ear drainage<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Spread of the cyst into\nthe brain<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Hearing loss<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Muscle weakness</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A perforation of the\near drum will generally heal without surgery. In some cases, however, instead\nof normally healing, the skin of the ear drum can grow through the hole into\nthe middle ear.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If infection is present, the skin will continue to grow into\nthe middle ear and will become a tumor of the ear termed a cholesteatoma.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cholesteatomas are NOT a form of cancer. They\nare benign tumors. As they grow, they can look like an onion peel of white skin\nformed into a ball.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ear specialist&nbsp; will examine the inside of your ear using an\notoscope. This medical device allows your doctor to see if there are signs of a\ngrowing cyst. Specifically, they will look for a visible deposit of skin cells\nor a large mass of blood vessels in the ear.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A CT scan is a painless\nimaging test that captures images from a cross section of your body. The scan\nallows your doctor to see inside your ear and skull. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CT\nscan can determine how much the cholesteatoma has spread in the ear. CT\nscanning is the diagnostic imaging modality of choice for these lesions, owing\nto its ability to detect subtle bony defects.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MRI is used when very\nspecific problems, such as the following, are expected to involve surrounding\nsoft tissues :--</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dural\ninvolvement or invasion<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Subdural\nor epidural abscess<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brain\nherniation into the mastoid cavity<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Inflammation\nof the membranous labyrinth or facial nerve<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sigmoid\nsinus thrombosis<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meningitis<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Depending on the\nprocedure,&nbsp; one in four of&nbsp; cholesteatoma operations are unsuccessful,\nwith cholesteatoma persistence or recurrence manifesting at some point in the\npostoperative period UNLESS THE SURGEON IS AN EXPERT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patients who refuse\nsurgery or whose medical condition makes a general anesthetic too hazardous\nshould have their ears cleaned regularly.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\nRegular cleaning can help to control infection and may slow growth of\nthe cholesteatoma, although it does not stop further expansion or eliminate\nrisk.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your doctor uses a\nscalpel or a needle and a syringe to thoroughly clean the ear and remove fluid\nand bacteria. You'll be given eardrops to prevent the infection from returning.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You're likely to\nrecover fully without complications if the tumor is caught and treated early\nwith surgery.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most patients who\nundergo surgery for cholesteatoma are able to maintain or improve their hearing\nat a subsequent operation for reconstruction of the bones of hearing.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However,\nindividuals may not be candidates for further reconstructive surgery if\nirreversible changes took place in the ear due to the disease. A hearing aid\nfitting will usually be considered in this situation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ear drum is\ngenerally repaired at the time of surgery by inserting a grafted, new ear drum\ntaken from tissue behind the ear over the skull. In most cases, this new\ngrafted ear drum heals. In less than 10% of cases, it could break down and need\nto be repaired at the second surgery.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The facial nerve is\npotentially at risk in all cases of ear surgery, but especially when removing a\ncholesteatoma. Special care must always be taken to identify the facial nerve.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sometimes, the normal structures may be severely distorted and the nerve very\ndifficult to identify, especially in an infected ear. To counter this\ndifficulty, a facial nerve monitor is often used to identify the facial nerve\nin cholesteatoma surgery.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ear surgeon must\nnot only remove the cholesteatoma, but preserve as much hearing as possible at\nall costs. Since it is likely that cholesteatoma left at surgery will regrow,\nthe ear surgeon must call on all of his experience to provide complete removal\nof tumor and a satisfactory hearing result.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Surgery is performed\nunder general anesthesia in most cases. The primary purpose of surgery is to\nremove the cholesteotoma to eliminate the infection and create a dry ear.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A\nsecond surgery is sometimes necessary both to ensure that the cholesteatoma is\ngone as well as to attempt reconstruction of the damaged middle ear bones in an\neffort to improve hearing. In cases of severe ear destruction, reconstruction\nmay not be possible..</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reconstruction of the middle ear is not always possible\nin one operation; therefore, another operation may be performed six to 12\nmonths later. This operation will attempt to restore hearing and, at the same\ntime, allow the surgeon to inspect the middle ear space and mastoid for\nresidual cholesteatoma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The surgeon generally\nmakes a cut either behind or just in front and above your ear. As well as\nremoving the dead skin cells, they may also need to remove some of the\nsponge-like mastoid bone (part of the skull behind your ear) and repair any\nhole in your eardrum.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You will often need to\nstay in hospital at least overnight after the operation, and you should plan to\ntake a week or two off work.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You should be able to\nwash your hair after a week, provided you do not get water inside the ear. This\ncan be avoided by plugging the ear with cotton wool coated with Vaseline.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swimming, strenuous\nactivities and sports may need to be avoided for a few weeks. Your surgeon may\nalso recommend avoiding flying for several weeks after surgery.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8365523149952430696\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_51M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/02856727136371066503\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">shailesh M</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/06/cholesteatoma-human-ear-capt-ajit.html?showComment=1465345458266#c8365523149952430696\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">June 8, 2016 at 5:54 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_51MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nHi Captain,<br />\n<br />\nCan you please explain the durga suktam<br />\n<br />\n\u091c\u093e\u0952\u0924\u0935\u0947\u0951\u0926\u0938\u0947 \u0938\u0941\u0928\u0935\u093e\u092e\u0952 \u0938\u094b\u092e\u0951 \u092e\u0930\u093e\u0924\u0940\u092f\u0952\u0924\u094b \u0928\u093f\u0926\u0951\u0939\u093e\u0924\u093f\u0952 \u0935\u0947\u0926\u0903\u0951 \u0964<br />\n\u0938 \u0928\u0903\u0951 \u092a\u0930\u094d-\u0937\u0952\u0926\u0924\u093f\u0951 \u0926\u0941\u0952\u0930\u094d\u0917\u093e\u0923\u093f\u0952 \u0935\u093f\u0936\u094d\u0935\u093e\u0951 \u0928\u093e\u0952\u0935\u0947\u0935\u0952 \u0938\u093f\u0928\u094d\u0927\u0941\u0902\u0951 \u0926\u0941\u0930\u093f\u0924\u093e\u0924\u094d\u092f\u0917\u094d\u0928\u093f\u0903 \u0965<br />\n<br />\nWe offer oblations of Soma unto Agni. May he burn those who are against us. May that Agni lead us beyond all difficulties, like a boatman takes his boat across a river.<br />\n<br />\n\u0924\u093e\u092e\u0952\u0917\u094d\u0928\u093f\u0935\u0951\u0930\u094d\u0923\u093e\u0902 \u0924\u092a\u0951\u0938\u093e \u091c\u094d\u0935\u0932\u0952\u0928\u094d\u0924\u0940\u0902 \u0935\u0948\u0951\u0930\u094b\u091a\u0952\u0928\u0940\u0902 \u0915\u0951\u0930\u094d\u092e\u092b\u0952\u0932\u0947\u0937\u0941\u0952 \u091c\u0941\u0937\u094d\u091f\u093e\u0953\u092e\u094d \u0964<br />\n\u0926\u0941\u0952\u0930\u094d\u0917\u093e\u0902 \u0926\u0947\u0952\u0935\u0940\u0917\u094d\u0902 \u0936\u0930\u0951\u0923\u092e\u0952\u0939\u0902 \u092a\u094d\u0930\u092a\u0951\u0926\u094d\u092f\u0947 \u0938\u0941\u0952\u0924\u0930\u0951\u0938\u093f \u0924\u0930\u0938\u0947\u0951 \u0928\u092e\u0903\u0951 \u0965<br />\n<br />\nI take refuge in that Goddess, who has the lustre of fire, who is radiant due to her penance, who gives the fruits of all actions, and who is difficult to obtain. O Durga, we bow to you who are skilled in making us cross all difficulties.<br />\n<br />\n\u0905\u0917\u094d\u0928\u0947\u0952 \u0924\u094d\u0935\u0902 \u092a\u093e\u0951\u0930\u092f\u093e\u0952 \u0928\u0935\u094d\u092f\u094b\u0951 \u0905\u0952\u0938\u094d\u092e\u093e\u0928\u094d\u0925\u094d-\u0938\u094d\u0935\u0952\u0938\u094d\u0924\u093f\u092d\u093f\u0952\u0930\u0924\u093f\u0951 \u0926\u0941\u0952\u0930\u094d\u0917\u093e\u0923\u093f\u0952 \u0935\u093f\u0936\u094d\u0935\u093e\u0953 \u0964<br />\n\u092a\u0942\u0936\u094d\u091a\u0951 \u092a\u0943\u0952\u0925\u094d\u0935\u0940 \u092c\u0951\u0939\u0941\u0952\u0932\u093e \u0928\u0951 \u0909\u0952\u0930\u094d\u0935\u0940 \u092d\u0935\u093e\u0951 \u0924\u094b\u0952\u0915\u093e\u092f\u0952 \u0924\u0928\u0951\u092f\u093e\u092f\u0952 \u0936\u0902\u092f\u094b\u0903 \u0965<br />\n<br />\nO Agni! You are worthy of praise. Lead us safely across all obstacles. May our land and earth be abundant. Bless our children and grandchildren with happiness.<br />\n<br />\n\u0935\u093f\u0936\u094d\u0935\u093e\u0951\u0928\u093f \u0928\u094b \u0926\u0941\u0952\u0930\u094d\u0917\u0939\u093e\u0951 \u091c\u093e\u0924\u0935\u0947\u0926\u0903\u0952 \u0938\u093f\u0928\u094d\u0927\u0941\u0952\u0928\u094d\u0928 \u0928\u093e\u0952\u0935\u093e \u0926\u0941\u0951\u0930\u093f\u0952\u0924\u093e\u200c\u0924\u093f\u092a\u0930\u094d\u0937\u093f \u0964<br />\n\u0905\u0917\u094d\u0928\u0947\u0951 \u0905\u0924\u094d\u0930\u093f\u0952\u0935\u0928\u094d\u092e\u0928\u0951\u0938\u093e \u0917\u0943\u0923\u093e\u0952\u0928\u094b\u0953\u200c\u0b89\u0938\u094d\u092e\u093e\u0915\u0902\u0951 \u092c\u094b\u0927\u094d\u092f\u0935\u093f\u0952\u0924\u093e \u0924\u0952\u0928\u0942\u0928\u093e\u0953\u092e\u094d \u0965<br />\n<br />\nO Destroyer of all difficulties! Rescue us from difficulties, just as one crosses a river by means of a boat. O Agni! Protect our bodies vigilantly like Atri (who is concerned with the welfare of all beings).<br />\n<br />\n\u092a\u0943\u0952\u0924\u0952\u0928\u093e\u0952 \u091c\u093f\u0924\u0952\u0917\u094d\u0902\u0952 \u0938\u0939\u0951\u092e\u093e\u0928\u092e\u0941\u0952\u0917\u094d\u0930\u092e\u0952\u0917\u094d\u0928\u093f\u0917\u094d\u0902 \u0939\u0941\u0951\u0935\u0947\u092e \u092a\u0930\u0952\u092e\u093e\u0925\u094d-\u0938\u0952\u0927\u0938\u094d\u0925\u093e\u0953\u0924\u094d \u0964<br />\n\u0938 \u0928\u0903\u0951 \u092a\u0930\u094d-\u0937\u0952\u0926\u0924\u093f\u0951 \u0926\u0941\u0952\u0930\u094d\u0917\u093e\u0923\u093f\u0952 \u0935\u093f\u0936\u094d\u0935\u093e\u0952 \u0915\u094d\u0937\u093e\u092e\u0951\u0926\u094d\u0926\u0947\u0952\u0935\u094b \u0905\u0924\u093f\u0951 \u0926\u0941\u0930\u093f\u0952\u0924\u093e\u200c\u0b89\u0924\u094d\u092f\u0952\u0917\u094d\u0928\u093f\u0903 \u0965<br />\n<br />\nWe invoke Agni from the highest assembly , who charges and vanquishes his enemies and is fearsome. May that Agni protect us and lead us beyond all that is transient, all difficulties, and all sins.<br />\n<br />\n\u0930\u0952\u0924\u094d\u0928\u094b\u0937\u093f\u0951 \u0915\u0952\u092e\u0940\u0921\u094d\u092f\u094b\u0951 \u0905\u0927\u094d\u0935\u0952\u0930\u0947\u0937\u0941\u0951 \u0938\u0952\u0928\u093e\u091a\u094d\u091a\u0952 \u0939\u094b\u0924\u093e\u0952 \u0928\u0935\u094d\u092f\u0951\u0936\u094d\u091a \u0938\u0924\u094d\u0938\u093f\u0951 \u0964<br />\n\u0938\u094d\u0935\u093e\u091e\u094d\u091a\u093e\u0953\u200c\u0b89\u0917\u094d\u0928\u0947 \u0924\u0952\u0928\u0941\u0935\u0902\u0951 \u092a\u093f\u0952\u092a\u094d\u0930\u092f\u0951\u0938\u094d\u0935\u093e\u0952\u0938\u094d\u092e\u092d\u094d\u092f\u0902\u0951 \u091a\u0952 \u0938\u094c\u092d\u0951\u0917\u0952\u092e\u093e\u092f\u0951\u091c\u0938\u094d\u0935 \u0965<br />\n<br />\nO Agni! Praised in sacrifices, you multiply our joy. You are present in the sacrifices and are always laudable. Grant us happiness thinking of us as your own body. Bring us good fortune from all corners.<br />\n<br />\n\u0917\u094b\u092d\u093f\u0952\u0930\u094d\u091c\u0941\u0937\u094d\u091f\u0951\u092e\u092f\u0941\u091c\u094b\u0952 \u0928\u093f\u0937\u093f\u0951\u0915\u094d\u0924\u0902\u0952 \u0924\u0935\u0947\u0902\u0953\u0926\u094d\u0930 \u0935\u093f\u0937\u094d\u0923\u094b\u0952\u0930\u0928\u0941\u0952\u0938\u091e\u094d\u091a\u0951\u0930\u0947\u092e \u0964<br />\n\u0928\u093e\u0915\u0951\u0938\u094d\u092f \u092a\u0943\u0952\u0937\u094d\u0920\u092e\u0952\u092d\u093f \u0938\u0952\u0902\u0935\u0938\u093e\u0951\u0928\u094b\u0952 \u0935\u0948\u0937\u094d\u0923\u0951\u0935\u0940\u0902 \u0932\u094b\u0952\u0915 \u0907\u0952\u0939 \u092e\u093e\u0951\u0926\u092f\u0928\u094d\u0924\u093e\u092e\u094d \u0965<br />\n<br />\nO Indra, all-pervading! We shall follow you blessed with cattle and unbroken happiness. May those who live on the heights of heaven bring here the world of Vishnu.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nHere in whole suktam, Durga is refered to only once, and most other time the prayer is to agni, so I am wondering if this is actually a durga suktam or not. Also is it complete?</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_51MN\" kind=\"m\"><br /><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1411704075\" style=\"display: inline;\"></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_51BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/m7tH6exJKZk/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/m7tH6exJKZk?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u091c\u093e\u0952\u0924\u0935\u0947\u0951\u0926\u0938\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u0941\u0928\u0935\u093e\u092e\u0952</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u094b\u092e\u0951</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092e\u0930\u093e\u0924\u0940\u092f\u0952\u0924\u094b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0928\u093f\u0926\u0951\u0939\u093e\u0924\u093f\u0952</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">1.1: To that Jataveda\n(one from whom the Vedas are born) we press out the Soma (i.e. Invoke Her\nardently); (We invoke that Jataveda) Who consumes by Her Fire of Knowledge\n(Veda) all the Adversities (within and without) (And frees us from the bondage\nof the world),<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">2.1: To Her, Who is of\nthe colour of Fire (Agni Varna) and blazing with Tapas (Tapasa Jwalantim); Who\nwas born of that Fire (of Tapas) (Vairochinim), and Who is worshipped through\nFruits of Actions (Karma Phalas) (offered to Her Fire as oblations),<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">2.2: To that Durga, to\nthat Devi, I take Refuge (Sharanam Aham) by falling at Her Feet (Prapadye); (O\nMother Durga, I Prostrate before You) Please ferry me mercifully (over this\nOcean of the World full of great Difficulties and Perils),<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">5.1: (She is) the\n(Great) Fire Who is Invincible in Battle, and charges ahead in a Terrible\nmanner conquering (the Enemies); font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Svaam Ca-Agne Tanuvam\nPiprayasva-Asmabhyam Ca Saubhagam-Aayajasva ||6||<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">(We offer our oblations\nto the Fire of Durga to cross over this very difficult ocean of worldly\nexistence)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">6.1: You are lauded for\nspreading Bliss in the Sacrifice since ancient times (The Bliss resulting from\nkilling the inner Enemies); You act as a Hota (Invoker of Bliss) by abiding as\na New Maiden (Who is eternally young and free of decay) (in the Sacrificial\nAltar within the Hearts of the Devotees),<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">6.2: Your own Conscious\nForm, O Agni (Fire of Durga) is a source of Happiness (Bliss) for us, and a\nsource of Welfare for our Sacrifice,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "133", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/2149230169048792567/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "5825056020498777014", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2016-06-05T15:01:00+05:30", "updated": "2018-01-12T05:37:59+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNTE1NzE1Njc5NDgyCm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/06/avascular-necrosis-and-stem-cell.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/5825056020498777014", "title": "AVASCULAR NECROSIS AND STEM CELL THERAPY \u2013 CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;
