, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plato, Socrates,\nAristotle, Kant, Swedenborg and Spinoza are all striking examples in the\ninteresting history of Western philosophy for the high pedestal on which they\nhave placed morality, duty and righteousness, and adored them all as the only\nmeans to the attainment of the goal of life .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\">ALL COPIED FROM VEDANTA \u2014 &nbsp;EACH AND EVERY PHILOSOPHER OF THIS PLANET</span></b><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-NbE2gG3vFe4/V1FlxGVmMpI/AAAAAAABJik/GN7V4kNz-PcgmfMGhhgCJlTnFSTLv-U2ACLcB/s1600/1f0.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-NbE2gG3vFe4/V1FlxGVmMpI/AAAAAAABJik/GN7V4kNz-PcgmfMGhhgCJlTnFSTLv-U2ACLcB/s640/1f0.jpg\" width=\"490\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>The truth of Dharma is subtle and lies\nhidden..</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<ol id=\"bc_0_198TB\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; line-height: 22.4px; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_185B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c7341073760046764693\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_185M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/06584861446937763484\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Leo</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/09/garuda-vimana-of-vishnu-and-garuda.html?showComment=1442339482234#c7341073760046764693\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">September 15, 2015 at 11:21 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_185MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nHi Captain,<br />\nThere is no doubt in our minds that Bhishma is a great Guru and great personality. But how can one explain the fact that he remained silent when Draupadi was disrobed.</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_185MN\" kind=\"m\"><br /><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1307214491\" style=\"display: inline;\"></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_185BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_185B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_186B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c7586561751780774007\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_186M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/09/garuda-vimana-of-vishnu-and-garuda.html?showComment=1442344748890#c7586561751780774007\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">September 16, 2015 at 12:49 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_186MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi l,<br />\n<br />\nThose who kept quiet included included mighty warriors like Bheeshma, Drona, Ashwatthama and Kripa, and all five of Draupadi\u2019s own husbands.<br />\n<br />\nAll of them could have taken on Duryodhana by themselves .<br />\n<br />\nYudhishthira had staked himself and his 4 brothers in the dice game , lost and now had the status of slaves of Duryodhana.<br />\n<br />\nThen he wagered Draupadi lost her.<br />\n<br />\nDuryodhana tells a servant to bring Draupadi to the hall so that her can order her to go to the maid's quarters. She is no longer a queen and cannot stay in the main palace.<br />\n<br />\nThe servant returns with a question to Yuddhistira from Draupadi which goes like this \"Can a man who staked and lost himself to be a slave have any right to stake his wife?\"<br />\n<br />\nDuryodhana orders the servant to call Draupadi and ask all this personally. Draupadi refuses to come to the hall. Duryodhana then sends Dushashana to bring her. Dushashana drags Draupadi to the hall by her hair. Bhima tries to attack Dushashana but is stopped by levelheaded Yuddhistira.<br />\n<br />\nDraupadi questions Yuddhistira and his brothers. She asks then Bhishma, King Dhritharasthra, Drona and Kripa to help and protect a helpless woman. She also asks them the question if a woman is a property of the husband.<br />\n<br />\nDraupadi repeatedly demanded to know from Bhishma a man of Dharma - whether she has been won in the dice game or not \u2013<br />\n<br />\njitam va ajitam va mam manyadhve sarvabhoomipah: \u201c<br />\n\u201cwhat do the kings present here consider \u2013 that I have been won, or that I have not been won?\u201d.<br />\n<br />\nBhishma says:<br />\n<br />\nUktavanasmi kalyani dharmasya parama gatih<br />\nLoke na shakyate jnatum api vijnair mahatmabhih\u2026<br />\nNa vivektum cha te prashnam imam shaknomi nishchayat<br />\nSookshmatvad gahanatvad cha karyasya asya cha gauravat<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n\u201cI have already told you, auspicious one, the path of dharma is subtle indeed. Even great men with immense knowledge find it difficult to comprehend it\u2026 I am not able to arrive at a definite conclusion about your question \u2013 because the matter is subtle, deep and of enormous import.\u201d<br />\n<br />\nThe essence of dharma is difficult to comprehend; hidden is the path of dharma. Dharma is too subtle..<br />\n<br />\nThat is what Bheeshma says.<br />\n<br />\nThe four Pandavas younger feel their dharma does not allow them to act against their eldest brother Yuddhistra.<br />\n<br />\nDraupadi, in a last ditch effort, finally prayed to Krishna.<br />\n<br />\nWhen Dushasana started pulling her saree , initially Draupadi held on with all her strength . Only when she let go and raised her hands did Krishna help her .<br />\n<br />\nLord Krishna sees Dharma from his perspective as a god \u2013he just sees a woman in acute distress.<br />\n<br />\nThough he knows that Queen Draupadi as a hostess had insulted King Duryodhana when he fell into the pool of water . Such is thing was NEVER done .<br />\n<br />\nDraupadi had confessed to Yuddhistira that she as a hostess had insulted guest Duryodhana.<br />\n<br />\nSo did Yuddhistira (the embodiment of justice and righteousness) do this deliberately \u2013 on a extreme moral ground of divine justice?<br />\n<br />\nWhy did nobody stop Yuddhistira from staking so high? Except for Vidura no one did.<br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>\"Dharma works in very subtle ways\" -- said Bhishma.&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<br />\nHe was spot on !<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-I4hrKsX3gQA/V1FmG9l3ZxI/AAAAAAABJis/PUnQrbgE5ZgiSGxF25Q_a9H1hY60zCwDgCLcB/s1600/drauspadi1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"422\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-I4hrKsX3gQA/V1FmG9l3ZxI/AAAAAAABJis/PUnQrbgE5ZgiSGxF25Q_a9H1hY60zCwDgCLcB/s640/drauspadi1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 19th-century German\nSanskritist Theodore Goldst\u00fccker noted that Portuguse JEW Baruch Spinoza's religious\nconceptions were lifted from Vedanta.&nbsp; He\nwrote:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\u201c... a western system\nof philosophy which occupies a foremost rank amongst the philosophies of all\nnations and ages, and which is so exact a representation of the ideas of the\nVedanta, that we might have suspected its founder to have borrowed the fundamental\nprinciples of his system from the Hindus, did his biography not satisfy us that\nhe was wholly unacquainted with their doctrines... We mean the philosophy of\nSpinoza, a man whose very life is a picture of that moral purity and\nintellectual indifference to the transitory charms of this world, which is the\nconstant longing of the true Vedanta philosopher... comparing the fundamental\nideas of both we should have no difficulty in proving that, had Spinoza been a\nHindu, his system would in all probability mark a last phase of the Vedanta\nphilosophy.\u201d<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If anybody has read\nSpinoza\u2019s SUBSTANTIA , he will know it is totally lifted from Vedanta. His\noriginals were stolen by Dutch WEST India Company from my hometown Calicut.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madame Helena\nBlavatsky, the founder of the Theosophical Society compared Spinoza's religious\nthought to Vedanta\u2014she wrote \"As to Spinoza's Deity\u2014natura\nnaturans\u2014conceived in his attributes simply and alone; and the same Deity\u2014as\nnatura naturata or as conceived in the endless series of modifications or\ncorrelations, the direct out-flowing results from the properties of these\nattributes, it is the Vedantic Deity pure and simple.\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-EPf1_uBPa-A/V1FtKHdsNnI/AAAAAAABJjA/jVsp3dkzxowhSGRuNO9NEPVoLpOvGi3PACLcB/s1600/cat-thief_o_13AA26221.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"472\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-EPf1_uBPa-A/V1FtKHdsNnI/AAAAAAABJjA/jVsp3dkzxowhSGRuNO9NEPVoLpOvGi3PACLcB/s640/cat-thief_o_13AA26221.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">German JEW Rothschild used German JEW Immanuel Kant to cultivate the Aryan invasion theory--that the blonde white skinned , blue eyed man invented Sanskrit and wrote our Vedas.</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-OgX2ym8bHuE/V1FypqyF1kI/AAAAAAABJjQ/1FtVn2eQr5EAq90WK5ilmL1CLXX6ltdJACLcB/s1600/2ca4sssx933d1b589a70e0319ebe5656b80d.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-OgX2ym8bHuE/V1FypqyF1kI/AAAAAAABJjQ/1FtVn2eQr5EAq90WK5ilmL1CLXX6ltdJACLcB/s640/2ca4sssx933d1b589a70e0319ebe5656b80d.jpg\" width=\"434\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">German JEW Immanuel\nKant ( died 1804) lifted from Vedanta in his philosophical and astronomical works. Kant\u2019s differentiation between the physical world as seen in the space\nand time, and the unknowable thing in itself beyond these concepts, is same as\nthe doctrine of Maya. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kant was shallow minded\nand could NOT grasp the essence of Vedanta. He tried to give away Sanskrit to\nLithuania ( TEE HEEEE )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The nebular hypothesis\nis the most widely accepted model in the field of cosmogony to explain the\nformation and evolution of the Solar System &nbsp;Kant\u2019s astronomical \u201cdiscovery\u201d ( sic ) &nbsp;about the nature of Earth's rotation, for\nwhich he won the Berlin Academy Prize in 1754 is lifted from India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c1299463317821027516\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_29M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/06/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_3.html?showComment=1464955957660#c1299463317821027516\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">June 3, 2016 at 5:42 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_29MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nTHE LIST OF MAHA MERUS WHO FOOLED THE WORLD , WHOM I HAVE TRASHED INTO THE GARBAGE BIN OF THE PLANET NOW REACHES 13<br />\n<br />\nGARBAGE BUCKET LIST:<br />\n<br />\n1) BERTRAND RUSSEL<br />\n2) ROMILA THAPAR<br />\n3) IRFAN HABIB<br />\n4) NOAM CHOMSKY<br />\n5) RAMCHANDRA GUHA<br />\n6) SHELDON POLLOCK<br />\n7) SIGMUND FREUD<br />\n8) GEORG WILHELM HEGEL<br />\n9) AMARTYA SEN<br />\n10) WENDY DONIGER<br />\n11) FREIDRICH WILHELM NIETZSCHE<br />\n12) IMMANUEL KANT<br />\n13 ) BARUCH SPINOZA<br />\n<br />\nI HAVE READ KANTs / SPINOZAs WORKS LONG AGO .<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Russian Theodore\nStcherbatsky (1866 - 1942) has written that Kant\u2019s doctrine of the categorical\nimperative and aesthetics are lifted from Vedanta.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In his lectures at\nKonigberg University in East Prussia from 1756 to 1796, he talked about the\nphysiography of India and the customs and manners of the people, and it seems\nlikely that an intellectual of his genius would have gathered other information\nabout India and reflected upon it with utmost care and competence. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Theodore\nStcherbatsky&nbsp; that he had extensive and\naccurate knowledge of Indian thought. He said the Hindus were gentle and\ntolerant of other religions and nations. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">French Orientalist\nAnquetil-Duperron (translated the Upanishads - Oupnekhat from a Persian\ntranslation of Dara Shikoh- eldest son of Emperor Shah Jehan ) pointed out that\nImmanuel Kant\u2019s idealism had many things in common with the Upanishads.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Rothschild\nhistorian writes , that Oupnekhata is from a nineteenth-century German\ntranslation titled Das Oupnekhat; die aus den Veden zusammengefasste Lebre von\ndem Brahm (Dresden, 1882), derived from an earlier Latin edition of 1801.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sorry Darah Shikoh ,\nthe eldest brother of Aurangazeb wrote it.&nbsp;\nHe translated more than 50 Upanishads from their original Sanskrit into\nPersian in 1657 so that they could be studied by Muslim scholars.&nbsp; Most of these books were later copied by\nEuropeans .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Darah Shikoh wrote that\nKoran ( Kitab al-maknun ) is derived from the Upanishads.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Younger brother of Dara\nShikoh became emperor after Shah Jehan. Aurangazeb had Darah Shikoh paraded in\nchains on an elephant facing backwards. The elephant was covered in human\nshit.&nbsp; The placard of the elephant read\nAPOSTATE FROM ISLAM.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was assassinated (\nhalal method ) by four of Aurangzeb's soldiers in front of his son on 30 August\n1659.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Below: The neglected library of Dara Shikoh -- he would have been emperor if his younger brother Aurangazeb had NOT killed him. &nbsp;The people , both Hindus and Muslims loved him.</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-3Duk0q1tjhg/V1F9YYJXNaI/AAAAAAABJj4/Fe-O29TgXXgOtUrNh7QdL_ugL_VAcGuDACLcB/s1600/MwwG_8581.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"426\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-3Duk0q1tjhg/V1F9YYJXNaI/AAAAAAABJj4/Fe-O29TgXXgOtUrNh7QdL_ugL_VAcGuDACLcB/s640/MwwG_8581.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-YY_DTVM1UYo/V1F9xwxz4NI/AAAAAAABJkA/p3CPnhAReVAzLCVd-rfHP3xIOs-hPNX0QCLcB/s1600/Dara-Shikssoh-Library4.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-YY_DTVM1UYo/V1F9xwxz4NI/AAAAAAABJkA/p3CPnhAReVAzLCVd-rfHP3xIOs-hPNX0QCLcB/s640/Dara-Shikssoh-Library4.jpg\" width=\"544\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the British\ncaptured power Sir David Ochterlony, the first British Resident to the Mughal\ncourt at Delhi, stayed on top of the library.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">JEW Ochterlony lived\nlike a Nawab surrounded by khidmatgars, had 13 Indian wives, dressed like an\nIndian Nawab, smoked the hukka and hosted lavish nautch parties&nbsp; ( homosexual sex with small boys included ) where\nthe Mughal Royalty too was invited.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-IrhE4OPRCh4/V1F_9irLY1I/AAAAAAABJkQ/cD4VEk7_eTcEGPQeqaZTlcw8qbn-mMN_ACLcB/s1600/stock-illustration-41682118-sir-david-ffochterlony-and-the-gurkhas.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"528\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-IrhE4OPRCh4/V1F_9irLY1I/AAAAAAABJkQ/cD4VEk7_eTcEGPQeqaZTlcw8qbn-mMN_ACLcB/s640/stock-illustration-41682118-sir-david-ffochterlony-and-the-gurkhas.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zpVDXgnRy1M/V1GAXY3CsTI/AAAAAAABJkY/Z_mBvfnDEwEJgWG_MtGmtWhiKiiwQagnACLcB/s1600/ma5db.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zpVDXgnRy1M/V1GAXY3CsTI/AAAAAAABJkY/Z_mBvfnDEwEJgWG_MtGmtWhiKiiwQagnACLcB/s640/ma5db.jpg\" width=\"500\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-fU8cqcwPjYQ/V1GAsi62ZYI/AAAAAAABJkk/OkvCmALf0qIIptHpKA0skfNUgNodCWmdwCLcB/s1600/150613xd033.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"456\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-fU8cqcwPjYQ/V1GAsi62ZYI/AAAAAAABJkk/OkvCmALf0qIIptHpKA0skfNUgNodCWmdwCLcB/s640/150613xd033.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every evening, Ochterlony\nbaby paraded all his 13 wives on a promenade around the walls of the Red Fort,\neach on the back of her own elephant. These women were pretty.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His preferred &nbsp;wife was a gorgeous Brahmin woman converted to\nIslam-- Bebee Mahruttun Moobaruck ul Nissa Begum.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today her tomb is referred\nto by the local inhabitants of the old city as the \"Rundi ki Masjid\"\n(the Whore's Mosque).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Babur ( 1526-1530 ) had\na great passion to kill people, cut heads off people and create pillars out of\nthe cut off heads.&nbsp; He claimed to have\ncreated several such pillars in his autobiography.&nbsp; His soldiers raped dead Hindu women,\nsomething unthinkable for a Hindu.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Babar\u2019s son Humayun ( 1530-1556\n)&nbsp; had his own brother Kamran Mirza\nblinded which would end any claim to the throne.&nbsp;&nbsp; He killed his other brother&nbsp; Hindal Mirza. He sent another brother to Haj\nand got him killed enroute.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Akbar ( 1556 -1605 )\njust jailed his son Jehangir who was getting too greedy to usurp the throne\nbefore Akbar died. Jehangir (1605-1627) killed his uncle Mahdi Khwaja who was\neyeing the throne.&nbsp; He also blinded his\nown eldest son Khusrau who was eyeing his throne.&nbsp; Can you believe this -- Guru Arjan Singh was\nblamed by Jehangir of giving moral support to Khusrau , tortured severely and\nthen drowned in the river Ravi.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shah Jahan.(1628-1658 )\nkilled his younger&nbsp; brother Sheharyar so\nthat he will not lay claim to the throne.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aurangezeb ( 1658-1707\n) the third son of Shah Jehan killed his&nbsp;\n3 brothers. He also put his father in jail for 8 years till he died. For\nchoosing his capable eldest son Dara Shikoh as heir Aurangzeb punished him by\npresenting Dara\u2019s head in a platter to his father .&nbsp; Can you believe this-- Guru Har Rai got into\nthe good books of Emperor Shah Jehan by saving his favourite son Dara Shikoh\nfrom tiger's whiskers poisoning using laxative herbs ( poisoned by his brother\nAurangazeb) --and in the bargain he pissed of Aurangazeb.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Nobody names his son after\nAurangazeb or Babur even today, though there are plenty of Akbars.. Pakistanis\nname their missiles Babur.&nbsp; They don\u2019t\nrealize that when Babur came to India their forefathers were all Hindus and\ntheir women ancestors were raped.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Aurangzeb's son Bahadur\nShah I (Muazzam ) killed his brothers Muhammad Azam and Muhammad Kam Bhaksh to\ncapture the throne.&nbsp; Can you believe\nthis?&nbsp; Guru Gobind Singh sent his army\nunder the command of Bhai Dharam Singh, to help Muazzam.&nbsp; Muazzam's forces defeated&nbsp; his brother Azam\u2019s forces in the Battle of\nJajau on 12 June 1707.&nbsp; Both sides\nnumbered some 100,000 combatants, but Bah\u0101dur Shah had more artillery.&nbsp; Both Muhammad A\u1e93am and his son Bidar Bakht\nwere killed in the battle.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Bahadur Shah I died in\n1712, and his successor Jahandar Shah was killed on the orders of the Sayyid\nBrothers.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Bahadur Shah's death\nfollowed a war of succession among his four sons, Jahandar Shah, Azim-us-Shah,\nJahan Shah and Rafi-is-Shah.&nbsp; Jalandar\nshah killed his 3 brothers to ascend the throne .<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Azim-us-Shah's son\nFarrukhsiyar killed his uncle and ascended the throne.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">In 1719, the Brothers\nblinded, deposed and murdered Farrukhsiyar<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Sayyid brothers were\nsoon killed by Muhammad Shah. <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Ahmad Shah, son of\nMuhammad Shah, was blinded in 1754 by the Wazir Ghazi-ud-din Imad-ul-mulk<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Alamgir II (1754 -\n1759) was killed by Ghazi-ud-din Imad-ul-mulk's orders.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Shah Alam II (1759 -\n1806) blinded by the Afghan chief Gulam Qadir,<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Bahadur Shah-II was\nfalsely accused by the British of treason and rebellion and exiled to\nBurma.&nbsp; His descendants were beheaded and\nheads presented to him on a platter \u2013<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">-- and the glorious\nMughal empire was swept away once and for all.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Now let me narrate a\nshort story from Ramayana 4300 BC. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">This was the Dharma in\nHindu India before the Muslims and the Christians invaded .<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">King Dasaratha , the\nfather of Lord Rama was in the thick of battle with the Asuras. His favourite\nqueen Kaikeyi was on the horse chariot with him. Dasaratha was injured , and\nthe wheel of his chariot was about to be dislodged due to a missing cotter pin\n. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Queen Kaikeyi put her\nfinger into the orifice suffering great pain. In addition to this , as soon a\nDasaratha became unconscious she drove the chariot away from the battle field\nand saved the king.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Later when Dasharatha\ncame to know what transpired , he gave his wife two boons . She said that she\nwould redeem the boon at a later date and time.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Years passed . Lord\nRama being the eldest son was crown prince and Dasarath wanted to hand over his\nkingdom to Rama and then retire for sanyas. Queen Kaikeyi\u2019s son Bharata was\naway in another city. The city of Ayodha was being decorated for the huge event\nas the people loved prince Rama.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The shrewd hump backed\nmaid Mandara of Kaikeyi poisoned her mind.&nbsp;\nShe reminded Kaikeyi of the two boons which the King had given her, and\ntold her that she must redeem it now. She must ask that her son Bharat must be\ncrowned king and his elder half brother Rama , son of eldest queen Kausalya\nmust be banished to a far away forest on exile for 14 years.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Queen Kaikeyi\napproached King Dasaratha and reminded him of his promise . Then she told him\nwhat she wanted. The king was in a bind . He had to follow his dharma of not\nbreaking a promise. Out of sheer grief he fell dead.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;</span></i></span><i style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;</span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Rama did the last rites\nfor his father and went away of exile with his wife Sita and his brother\nLakshman . It was the dharma of both his wife and brother to be with him .&nbsp; The whole city of Ayodha was in gloom.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Meanwhile Bharata had a\nbad dream and a premonition . He came rushing back to Ayodhya. He knew\nsomething was wrong as the whole city of Ayodhya was in mourning and darkness.\nWhen he heard that his father is dead and his brother Rama was in exile, he\nfainted out of grief.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">When he came to, he\ngave a piece of his mind to his mother Kaikeyi and went to Rama\u2019s mother\nKausalya's room and slept at her feet.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;</span></i></span><i style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;</span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Next morning with the\nqueen mothers, his brother Shatrughna , priests, ministers and&nbsp; a small army , he set off to the forest to\nbring his brother back to Ayodhya and crown him king. Maharishi Bharadwaja\ndirected him to the cottage&nbsp; where Rama\nwould be with his wife Sita and brother Lakshman. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Both Rama and Bharat\nhugged each other . Bharat fell at his elder brother Rama\u2019s feet and implored\nhim to come back to Ayodhya and become king. Kaikeyi apologized and took back\nher boon.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Rama did NOT want to\nbreak his dharma of obeying his dead father\u2019s command.&nbsp; Bharat then asked Rama to give him his\nsandals and said till Rama comes back after 14 years his sandals would be on\nthe throne and that he would rule on Rama\u2019s behalf from outside the palace ,\nfrom Nandigram. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;</span></i></span><i style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;</span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">After 14 long years\nwhen Hanuman broke the news of Rama\u2019s impending return to Ayodhya , Bharat\nagain fainted with joy\u2014this time around.&nbsp;\nHe showered Hanuman with gifts for the good tidings and commanded his\nbrother Shatrughna to have the people decorate Ayodhya city .<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;</span></i></span><i style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The two brothers met\nand hugged each other, after which, Bharat led him to the throne on which was\nplaced Rama\u2019s sandals.&nbsp; Rama was crowned\nking and there was great joy. Rama made Bharat his crown prince.</span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">At Rama's command,\nBharat and his sons went to the Gandhar kingdom and defeated the Gandharvas\nliving there. &nbsp; &nbsp;Bharat founded the two capital cities of Takshashila and\nPushkalavat in the conquered kingdom and established his sons, Taksh and\nPushkal as its rulers.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;</span></i></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This was the Hindu\ndharma.&nbsp; Dharma broadly means\nrighteousness.&nbsp; Our scriptures and\nhistory is full of such sacrifices to sustain dharma.</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hinduism provides\nspiritual food for all sorts of people to suit their temperaments, capacities,\ntastes, stages of spiritual development, and conditions of life.&nbsp; It prescribes Yoga Sadhana to attain\nGod-realisation, while doing ones ordinary avocation in the world. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hindu yoga and Vedanta teachers lay great\nstress on self-restraint, meditation, renunciation and practical Sadhana, which\nis best to control the mind and the senses and unfold the Divinity within or\nattain Self-realisation. Yoga is eminently practical to practise. Your body\nuses its own weight to suit your own choice.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nancy Wilson Ross( Mrs\nStalney Young )&nbsp; served on the board of\nthe Asia Society of New York and was on the governing board of the India\nCouncil. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She has written:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\"Anachronistic as\nthis labyrinthine mythology may appear to the foreign mind, many of India\u2019s\nancient theories about the universe are startlingly modern in scope and worthy\nof a people who are credited with the invention of the zero, as well as algebra\nand its application of astronomy and geometry; a people who so carefully\nobserved the heavens that, in the opinion of Monier-Williams, they determined\nthe moon\u2019s synodical revolution much more correctly than the Greeks.\"<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\"Many hundreds of\nyears before those great European pioneers, Galileo and Copernicus, had to pay\nheavy prices in ridicule and excommunication for their daring theories, a\nsection of the Vedas known as the Brahmanas contained this astounding\nstatement: <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\u201cThe sun never sets or\nrises. When people think the sun is setting, he only changes about after\nreaching the end of the day and makes night below and day to what is on the\nother side. Then, when people think he rises in the morning, he only shifts\nhimself about after reaching the end of the day night, and makes day below and\nnight to what is on the other side. In truth, he does not see at all.\u201d <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\"The Indians,\nwhose theory of time, is not linear like ours \u2013 that is, not proceeding\nconsecutively from past to present to future \u2013 have always been able to accept,\nseemingly without anxiety, the notion of an alternately expanding and\ncontracting universe, an idea recently advanced by certain Western scientists\"</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\"In Hindu cosmology, immutable Brahman, at fixed intervals, draws back into his\nbeginningless, endless Being the whole substance of the living world. There\nthen takes place the long \u201csleep\u201d of Brahaman from which, in course of\ncountless aeons, there is an awakening, and another universe or \u201cdream\u201d\nemerges. \"<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<i><br /></i>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">French historian Edgar\nQuinet (1803 - 1875) wrote:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2018When human revolutions\nfirst began, India stood more expressly than any other country for what may be\ncalled a Declaration of the Rights of the Being. That divine Individuality, and\nits community with infinity, is obviously the foundation and the source of all\nlife and all history.\u2019<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\u201cIndia made, more loudly than anyone, what we\nmight call the \u201cdeclaration of the rights of the Being.\u201d There, in this divine\nself, in this society of the infinite with itself, lies clearly the foundation,\nthe root of all life and all history.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<i><br /></i>\n<i><br /></i>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Alexander Zinoviev from the Russian Academy of\nSciences wrote:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\" Hinduism is too valuable for humanity, and sacred Indian books contain\ntoo much precious and unique knowledge that it will not sink in oblivion.&nbsp; I\u2019d like to believe that the principles of\nIndian philosophy and religion are much more in agreement with the needs for\nthe future than any other religion in the world, in agreement with the\ntendency, known in Western countries as New Age.&nbsp; It\u2019s my deep belief that without India the\nworld will sink in spiritual darkness and ignorance.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">British author Ranchor\nPrime wrote:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe West has much to\nlearn from the wisdom traditions of India. Having exposed most of the rest of\nthe world to our own traditions, and having largely abandoned them ourselves,\nwe now need to learn from others; to put aside our swords and guns, our\ncomputers and microscopes, our cars and televisions, and have the courage and\nthe vision to journey to new territory where these seemingly indispensable aids\nmay be of little value.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4596656199011134467\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/06/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_3.html?showComment=1464995377802#c7431853907715379466\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">June 4, 2016 at 4:39 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_48MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi vb,<br />\n<br />\nCHURCH IS NOW MAKING MONEY OUT OF \"CHRISTIAN YOGA\"<br />\n<br />\nTHEY NOW HAVE \"CHRIST CONSCIOUSNESS\"<br />\n<br />\nISKON IS CONSOLIDATING RADHA -- A MISTRESS OF KRISHNA WHO NEVER EXISTED.<br />\n<br />\nDAMARU OF SHIVA IS \"SHABDA BRAHMAN\" -- IT BEAT SRI YANTRA ( A DIVINE GEOMETRY OF OM , WHICH CONTAINS THE THEORY OF EVERYTHING ) INTO EXISTENCE.<br />\n<br />\nTHIS IS WHAT WIKIPEDIA WROTE ( NOW THEY HAVE DELETED IT )<br />\n<br />\n\"OM is this imperishable Word. OM is the universe, and this is the exposition OM. The past, present and the future, all that was, all that is, all that will be is OM. Likewise all else that may exist beyond the bounds of time, that, too, is OM.\" ( <b>Verse 1- Mandulya Upanishad 5000 BC </b>)<br />\n<br />\nQUOTE : The hourglass-shaped drum known in Sanskrit as \"damaru\" is an instrument used in ritual shamanic performances in India .<br />\n<br />\nFashioned out of a human cranium, the drum is comprised of <b><span style=\"color: red;\">two skulls: a boy of sixteen and a girl of twelve .</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">Monkey skins</span></b> are stretched tightly over the skulls.<br />\n<br />\nOne side is <span style=\"color: red;\"><b>smeared with sperm</b></span>, and the other side is decorated with a lotus blossom coated with a twelve year old girl's <b><span style=\"color: red;\">menstrual blood.</span></b> ( <span style=\"color: blue;\">hey, you forgot about sh#t and piss ! TEE HEEE !! )</span><br />\n<br />\nThe hide is then pierced with sixteen holes and attached to the drum with human hair. The whirling balls are made of the bones of a waterbird's foot ( <span style=\"color: blue;\">Oh boy ! </span>) and wrapped in wax and cloth.<br />\n<br />\nThe damaru drum is an ancient and spiritually potent symbolic medium for ritual music and magic used to communicate the intangible abstract other world through the senses.<br />\n<br />\nIn India, the damaru is so highly regarded as a spiritual instrument that everything to do with it is ritualized. It must even be correctly placed with the male skull to the musician's right and the female to his left in accordance with the traditional Shiva Shakti order - UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\">THIS IS THE TYPE OF THING THE LITERARY FEST DROHIS DISCUSS . MOST OF THESE FOUL STORIES ARE COOKED UP IN JNU BY THE COMMIE PROFESSORS .</span></b><br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_49b+seedEANtD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_49b+seedEANtD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-aOh0fAXm0Zk/V1IO5qTxz-I/AAAAAAABJk4/_TDshpTj2q4mJouZnYKoWXEdk5CjY6rGwCLcB/s1600/gSSgy.jpeg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-aOh0fAXm0Zk/V1IO5qTxz-I/AAAAAAABJk4/_TDshpTj2q4mJouZnYKoWXEdk5CjY6rGwCLcB/s400/gSSgy.jpeg\" width=\"299\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mind of god\nrepresented by the Sri Yantra is cosmic music ( shabda brahman ) resonating\nthrough hyperspace.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The dot in the middle\nof the Sri Yantra is Bindu, the witness&nbsp;\n( consciousness ).&nbsp;&nbsp; The musical\nanalogies of maths , physics , chemistry, quantum particles and contained in Sri Yantra geometry in the form of notation, harmony, melody and notes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Few decades ago Quantum\nphysicists discovered that the laws of classical mechanics do not apply at the\natomic scale.&nbsp; Experiments such as the\nphotoelectric effect completely contradicted the laws of classical physics.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>Below: IDIOT Isaac Newton was doing very well till this experiment was done. &nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>When shocked scientists saw the PHOTO ELECTRIC EFFECT , they dumped Newton into the Garbage bin of the planet</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;
